text: And, behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.

label: Matthew
text: Then answered Peter, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.

label: Matthew
text: While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.

label: Matthew
text: And when the disciples heard [it], they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus came and touched them, and said, Arise, and be not afraid.

label: Matthew
text: And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.

label: Matthew
text: And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen again from the dead.

label: Matthew
text: And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Elias truly shall first come, and restore all things.

label: Matthew
text: But I say unto you, That Elias is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they listed.

label: Matthew
text: Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them.

label: Matthew
text: Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.

label: Matthew
text: And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a [certain] man, kneeling down to him, and saying,

label: Matthew
text: Lord, have mercy on my son: for he is lunatick, and sore vexed: for ofttimes he falleth into the fire, and oft into the water.

label: Matthew
text: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.

label: Matthew
text: Then Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you?

label: Matthew
text: how long shall I suffer you?

label: Matthew
text: bring him hither to me.

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.

label: Matthew
text: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus said unto them, Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.

label: Matthew
text: Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.

label: Matthew
text: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men:

label: Matthew
text: And they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised again.

label: Matthew
text: And they were exceeding sorry.

label: Matthew
text: And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received tribute [money] came to Peter, and said, Doth not your master pay tribute?

label: Matthew
text: He saith, Yes.

label: Matthew
text: And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon?

label: Matthew
text: of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute?

label: Matthew
text: of their own children, or of strangers?

label: Matthew
text: Peter saith unto him, Of strangers.

label: Matthew
text: Jesus saith unto him, Then are the children free.

label: Matthew
text: Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.

label: Matthew
text: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,

label: Matthew
text: And said, Verily I say unto you, Except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.

label: Matthew
text: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

label: Matthew
text: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me.

label: Matthew
text: But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me, it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and [that] he were drowned in the depth of the sea.

label: Matthew
text: Woe unto the world because of offences!

label: Matthew
text: for it must needs be that offences come; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh!

label: Matthew
text: Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee, cut them off, and cast [them] from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire.

label: Matthew
text: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast [it] from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.

label: Matthew
text: Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you, That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven.

label: Matthew
text: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.

label: Matthew
text: How think ye?

label: Matthew
text: if a man have an hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains, and seeketh that which is gone astray?

label: Matthew
text: And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth more of that [sheep], than of the ninety and nine which went not astray.

label: Matthew
text: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.

label: Matthew
text: Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone: if he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.

label: Matthew
text: But if he will not hear [thee, then] take with thee one or two more, that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.

label: Matthew
text: And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell [it] unto the church: but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican.

label: Matthew
text: Verily I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

label: Matthew
text: Again I say unto you, That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven.

label: Matthew
text: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.

label: Matthew
text: Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him?

label: Matthew
text: till seven times?

label: Matthew
text: Jesus saith unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven times: but, Until seventy times seven.

label: Matthew
text: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king, which would take account of his servants.

label: Matthew
text: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.

label: Matthew
text: But forasmuch as he had not to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.

label: Matthew
text: The servant therefore fell down, and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

label: Matthew
text: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him, and forgave him the debt.

label: Matthew
text: But the same servant went out, and found one of his fellowservants, which owed him an hundred pence: and he laid hands on him, and took [him] by the throat, saying, Pay me that thou owest.

label: Matthew
text: And his fellowservant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

label: Matthew
text: And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay the debt.

label: Matthew
text: So when his fellowservants saw what was done, they were very sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that was done.

label: Matthew
text: Then his lord, after that he had called him, said unto him, O thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou desiredst me:

label: Matthew
text: Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant, even as I had pity on thee?

label: Matthew
text: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.

label: Matthew
text: So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses.

label: Matthew
text: And it came to pass, [that] when Jesus had finished these sayings, he departed from Galilee, and came into the coasts of Judaea beyond Jordan;

label: Matthew
text: And great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there.

label: Matthew
text: The Pharisees also came unto him, tempting him, and saying unto him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?

label: Matthew
text: And he answered and said unto them, Have ye not read, that he which made [them] at the beginning made them male and female,

label: Matthew
text: And said, For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife: and they twain shall be one flesh?

label: Matthew
text: Wherefore they are no more twain, but one flesh.

label: Matthew
text: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

label: Matthew
text: They say unto him, Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement, and to put her away?

label: Matthew
text: He saith unto them, Moses because of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives: but from the beginning it was not so.

label: Matthew
text: And I say unto you, Whosoever shall put away his wife, except [it be] for fornication, and shall marry another, committeth adultery: and whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adultery.

label: Matthew
text: His disciples say unto him, If the case of the man be so with [his] wife, it is not good to marry.

label: Matthew
text: But he said unto them, All [men] cannot receive this saying, save [they] to whom it is given.

label: Matthew
text: For there are some eunuchs, which were so born from [their] mother’s womb: and there are some eunuchs, which were made eunuchs of men: and there be eunuchs, which have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven’s sake.

label: Matthew
text: He that is able to receive [it], let him receive [it].

label: Matthew
text: Then were there brought unto him little children, that he should put [his] hands on them, and pray: and the disciples rebuked them.

label: Matthew
text: But Jesus said, Suffer little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.

label: Matthew
text: And he laid [his] hands on them, and departed thence.

label: Matthew
text: And, behold, one came and said unto him, Good Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?

label: Matthew
text: And he said unto him, Why callest thou me good?

label: Matthew
text: [there is] none good but one, [that is], God: but if thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.

label: Matthew
text: He saith unto him, Which?

label: Matthew
text: Jesus said, Thou shalt do no murder, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness,

label: Matthew
text: Honour thy father and [thy] mother: and, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

label: Matthew
text: The young man saith unto him, All these things have I kept from my youth up: what lack I yet?

label: Matthew
text: Jesus said unto him, If thou wilt be perfect, go [and] sell that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come [and] follow me.

label: Matthew
text: But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful: for he had great possessions.

label: Matthew
text: Then said Jesus unto his disciples, Verily I say unto you, That a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven.

label: Matthew
text: And again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

label: Matthew
text: When his disciples heard [it], they were exceedingly amazed, saying, Who then can be saved?

label: Matthew
text: But Jesus beheld [them], and said unto them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.

label: Matthew
text: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Behold, we have forsaken all, and followed thee; what shall we have therefore?

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus said unto them, Verily I say unto you, That ye which have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit in the throne of his glory, ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

label: Matthew
text: And every one that hath forsaken houses, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my name’s sake, shall receive an hundredfold, and shall inherit everlasting life.

label: Matthew
text: But many [that are] first shall be last; and the last [shall be] first.

label: Matthew
text: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man [that is] an householder, which went out early in the morning to hire labourers into his vineyard.

label: Matthew
text: And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

label: Matthew
text: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,

label: Matthew
text: And said unto them; Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you.

label: Matthew
text: And they went their way.

label: Matthew
text: Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did likewise.

label: Matthew
text: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle, and saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?

label: Matthew
text: They say unto him, Because no man hath hired us.

label: Matthew
text: He saith unto them, Go ye also into the vineyard; and whatsoever is right, [that] shall ye receive.

label: Matthew
text: So when even was come, the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward, Call the labourers, and give them [their] hire, beginning from the last unto the first.

label: Matthew
text: And when they came that [were hired] about the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny.

label: Matthew
text: But when the first came, they supposed that they should have received more; and they likewise received every man a penny.

label: Matthew
text: And when they had received [it], they murmured against the goodman of the house,

label: Matthew
text: Saying, These last have wrought [but] one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us, which have borne the burden and heat of the day.

label: Matthew
text: But he answered one of them, and said, Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst not thou agree with me for a penny?

label: Matthew
text: Take [that] thine [is], and go thy way: I will give unto this last, even as unto thee.

label: Matthew
text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own?

label: Matthew
text: Is thine eye evil, because I am good?

label: Matthew
text: So the last shall be first, and the first last: for many be called, but few chosen.

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way, and said unto them,

label: Matthew
text: Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes, and they shall condemn him to death,

label: Matthew
text: And shall deliver him to the Gentiles to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify [him]: and the third day he shall rise again.

label: Matthew
text: Then came to him the mother of Zebedee’s children with her sons, worshipping [him], and desiring a certain thing of him.

label: Matthew
text: And he said unto her, What wilt thou?

label: Matthew
text: She saith unto him, Grant that these my two sons may sit, the one on thy right hand, and the other on the left, in thy kingdom.

label: Matthew
text: But Jesus answered and said, Ye know not what ye ask.

label: Matthew
text: Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?

label: Matthew
text: They say unto him, We are able.

label: Matthew
text: And he saith unto them, Ye shall drink indeed of my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with: but to sit on my right hand, and on my left, is not mine to give, but [it shall be given to them] for whom it is prepared of my Father.

label: Matthew
text: And when the ten heard [it], they were moved with indignation against the two brethren.

label: Matthew
text: But Jesus called them [unto him], and said, Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them, and they that are great exercise authority upon them.

label: Matthew
text: But it shall not be so among you: but whosoever will be great among you, let him be your minister;

label: Matthew
text: And whosoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant:

label: Matthew
text: Even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.

label: Matthew
text: And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.

label: Matthew
text: And, behold, two blind men sitting by the way side, when they heard that Jesus passed by, cried out, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord, [thou] Son of David.

label: Matthew
text: And the multitude rebuked them, because they should hold their peace: but they cried the more, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord, [thou] Son of David.

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus stood still, and called them, and said, What will ye that I shall do unto you?

label: Matthew
text: They say unto him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.

label: Matthew
text: So Jesus had compassion [on them], and touched their eyes: and immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed him.

label: Matthew
text: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,

label: Matthew
text: Saying unto them, Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose [them], and bring [them] unto me.

label: Matthew
text: And if any [man] say ought unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.

label: Matthew
text: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,

label: Matthew
text: Tell ye the daughter of Sion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek, and sitting upon an ass, and a colt the foal of an ass.

label: Matthew
text: And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them,

label: Matthew
text: And brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they set [him] thereon.

label: Matthew
text: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; others cut down branches from the trees, and strawed [them] in the way.

label: Matthew
text: And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the Son of David: Blessed [is] he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.

label: Matthew
text: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?

label: Matthew
text: And the multitude said, This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,

label: Matthew
text: And said unto them, It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.

label: Matthew
text: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.

label: Matthew
text: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children crying in the temple, and saying, Hosanna to the Son of David; they were sore displeased,

label: Matthew
text: And said unto him, Hearest thou what these say?

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus saith unto them, Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?

label: Matthew
text: And he left them, and went out of the city into Bethany; and he lodged there.

label: Matthew
text: Now in the morning as he returned into the city, he hungered.

label: Matthew
text: And when he saw a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said unto it, Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever.

label: Matthew
text: And presently the fig tree withered away.

label: Matthew
text: And when the disciples saw [it], they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!

label: Matthew
text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this [which is done] to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; it shall be done.

label: Matthew
text: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.

label: Matthew
text: And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things?

label: Matthew
text: and who gave thee this authority?

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.

label: Matthew
text: The baptism of John, whence was it?

label: Matthew
text: from heaven, or of men?

label: Matthew
text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why did ye not then believe him?

label: Matthew
text: But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.

label: Matthew
text: And they answered Jesus, and said, We cannot tell.

label: Matthew
text: And he said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

label: Matthew
text: But what think ye?

label: Matthew
text: A [certain] man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work to day in my vineyard.

label: Matthew
text: He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.

label: Matthew
text: And he came to the second, and said likewise.

label: Matthew
text: And he answered and said, I [go], sir: and went not.

label: Matthew
text: Whether of them twain did the will of [his] father?

label: Matthew
text: They say unto him, The first.

label: Matthew
text: Jesus saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.

label: Matthew
text: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye had seen [it], repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.

label: Matthew
text: Hear another parable: There was a certain householder, which planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country:

label: Matthew
text: And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.

label: Matthew
text: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.

label: Matthew
text: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them likewise.

label: Matthew
text: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.

label: Matthew
text: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.

label: Matthew
text: And they caught him, and cast [him] out of the vineyard, and slew [him].

label: Matthew
text: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?

label: Matthew
text: They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out [his] vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.

label: Matthew
text: Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord’s doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?

label: Matthew
text: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.

label: Matthew
text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

label: Matthew
text: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.

label: Matthew
text: But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables, and said,

label: Matthew
text: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king, which made a marriage for his son,

label: Matthew
text: And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come.

label: Matthew
text: Again, he sent forth other servants, saying, Tell them which are bidden, Behold, I have prepared my dinner: my oxen and [my] fatlings [are] killed, and all things [are] ready: come unto the marriage.

label: Matthew
text: But they made light of [it], and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his merchandise:

label: Matthew
text: And the remnant took his servants, and entreated [them] spitefully, and slew [them].

label: Matthew
text: But when the king heard [thereof], he was wroth: and he sent forth his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.

label: Matthew
text: Then saith he to his servants, The wedding is ready, but they which were bidden were not worthy.

label: Matthew
text: Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.

label: Matthew
text: So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together all as many as they found, both bad and good: and the wedding was furnished with guests.

label: Matthew
text: And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment:

label: Matthew
text: And he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment?

label: Matthew
text: And he was speechless.

label: Matthew
text: Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast [him] into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

label: Matthew
text: For many are called, but few [are] chosen.

label: Matthew
text: Then went the Pharisees, and took counsel how they might entangle him in [his] talk.

label: Matthew
text: And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, neither carest thou for any [man]: for thou regardest not the person of men.

label: Matthew
text: Tell us therefore, What thinkest thou?

label: Matthew
text: Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?

label: Matthew
text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, Why tempt ye me, [ye] hypocrites?

label: Matthew
text: Shew me the tribute money.

label: Matthew
text: And they brought unto him a penny.

label: Matthew
text: And he saith unto them, Whose [is] this image and superscription?

label: Matthew
text: They say unto him, Caesar’s.

label: Matthew
text: Then saith he unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar’s; and unto God the things that are God’s.

label: Matthew
text: When they had heard [these words], they marvelled, and left him, and went their way.

label: Matthew
text: The same day came to him the Sadducees, which say that there is no resurrection, and asked him,

label: Matthew
text: Saying, Master, Moses said, If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

label: Matthew
text: Now there were with us seven brethren: and the first, when he had married a wife, deceased, and, having no issue, left his wife unto his brother:

label: Matthew
text: Likewise the second also, and the third, unto the seventh.

label: Matthew
text: And last of all the woman died also.

label: Matthew
text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven?

label: Matthew
text: for they all had her.

label: Matthew
text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Ye do err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God.

label: Matthew
text: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God in heaven.

label: Matthew
text: But as touching the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,

label: Matthew
text: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

label: Matthew
text: God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.

label: Matthew
text: And when the multitude heard [this], they were astonished at his doctrine.

label: Matthew
text: But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, they were gathered together.

label: Matthew
text: Then one of them, [which was] a lawyer, asked [him a question], tempting him, and saying,

label: Matthew
text: Master, which [is] the great commandment in the law?

label: Matthew
text: Jesus said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.

label: Matthew
text: This is the first and great commandment.

label: Matthew
text: And the second [is] like unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

label: Matthew
text: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.

label: Matthew
text: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

label: Matthew
text: Saying, What think ye of Christ?

label: Matthew
text: whose son is he?

label: Matthew
text: They say unto him, [The Son] of David.

label: Matthew
text: He saith unto them, How then doth David in spirit call him Lord, saying,

label: Matthew
text: The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool?

label: Matthew
text: If David then call him Lord, how is he his son?

label: Matthew
text: And no man was able to answer him a word, neither durst any [man] from that day forth ask him any more [questions].

label: Matthew
text: Then spake Jesus to the multitude, and to his disciples,

label: Matthew
text: Saying, The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat:

label: Matthew
text: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe, [that] observe and do; but do not ye after their works: for they say, and do not.

label: Matthew
text: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay [them] on men’s shoulders; but they [themselves] will not move them with one of their fingers.

label: Matthew
text: But all their works they do for to be seen of men: they make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge the borders of their garments,

label: Matthew
text: And love the uppermost rooms at feasts, and the chief seats in the synagogues,

label: Matthew
text: And greetings in the markets, and to be called of men, Rabbi, Rabbi.

label: Matthew
text: But be not ye called Rabbi: for one is your Master, [even] Christ; and all ye are brethren.

label: Matthew
text: And call no [man] your father upon the earth: for one is your Father, which is in heaven.

label: Matthew
text: Neither be ye called masters: for one is your Master, [even] Christ.

label: Matthew
text: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.

label: Matthew
text: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.

label: Matthew
text: But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!

label: Matthew
text: for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye neither go in [yourselves], neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in.

label: Matthew
text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!

label: Matthew
text: for ye devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayer: therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation.

label: Matthew
text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!

label: Matthew
text: for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is made, ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves.

label: Matthew
text: Woe unto you, [ye] blind guides, which say, Whosoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, he is a debtor!

label: Matthew
text: [Ye] fools and blind: for whether is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifieth the gold?

label: Matthew
text: And, Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it, he is guilty.

label: Matthew
text: [Ye] fools and blind: for whether [is] greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifieth the gift?

label: Matthew
text: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.

label: Matthew
text: And whoso shall swear by the temple, sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.

label: Matthew
text: And he that shall swear by heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.

label: Matthew
text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!

label: Matthew
text: for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier [matters] of the law, judgment, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

label: Matthew
text: [Ye] blind guides, which strain at a gnat, and swallow a camel.

label: Matthew
text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!

label: Matthew
text: for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.

label: Matthew
text: [Thou] blind Pharisee, cleanse first that [which is] within the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.

label: Matthew
text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!

label: Matthew
text: for ye are like unto whited sepulchres, which indeed appear beautiful outward, but are within full of dead [men’s] bones, and of all uncleanness.

label: Matthew
text: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.

label: Matthew
text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!

label: Matthew
text: because ye build the tombs of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous,

label: Matthew
text: And say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.

label: Matthew
text: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves, that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets.

label: Matthew
text: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers.

label: Matthew
text: [Ye] serpents, [ye] generation of vipers, how can ye escape the damnation of hell?

label: Matthew
text: Wherefore, behold, I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: and [some] of them ye shall kill and crucify; and [some] of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecute [them] from city to city:

label: Matthew
text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.

label: Matthew
text: Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.

label: Matthew
text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, [thou] that killest the prophets, and stonest them which are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens under [her] wings, and ye would not!

label: Matthew
text: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.

label: Matthew
text: For I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye shall say, Blessed [is] he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus went out, and departed from the temple: and his disciples came to [him] for to shew him the buildings of the temple.

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus said unto them, See ye not all these things?

label: Matthew
text: verily I say unto you, There shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

label: Matthew
text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives, the disciples came unto him privately, saying, Tell us, when shall these things be?

label: Matthew
text: and what [shall be] the sign of thy coming, and of the end of the world?

label: Matthew
text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Take heed that no man deceive you.

label: Matthew
text: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many.

label: Matthew
text: And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars: see that ye be not troubled: for all [these things] must come to pass, but the end is not yet.

label: Matthew
text: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be famines, and pestilences, and earthquakes, in divers places.

label: Matthew
text: All these [are] the beginning of sorrows.

label: Matthew
text: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted, and shall kill you: and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name’s sake.

label: Matthew
text: And then shall many be offended, and shall betray one another, and shall hate one another.

label: Matthew
text: And many false prophets shall rise, and shall deceive many.

label: Matthew
text: And because iniquity shall abound, the love of many shall wax cold.

label: Matthew
text: But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

label: Matthew
text: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations; and then shall the end come.

label: Matthew
text: When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, stand in the holy place, (whoso readeth, let him understand:)

label: Matthew
text: Then let them which be in Judaea flee into the mountains:

label: Matthew
text: Let him which is on the housetop not come down to take any thing out of his house:

label: Matthew
text: Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes.

label: Matthew
text: And woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

label: Matthew
text: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the sabbath day:

label: Matthew
text: For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time, no, nor ever shall be.

label: Matthew
text: And except those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved: but for the elect’s sake those days shall be shortened.

label: Matthew
text: Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here [is] Christ, or there; believe [it] not.

label: Matthew
text: For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall shew great signs and wonders; insomuch that, if [it were] possible, they shall deceive the very elect.

label: Matthew
text: Behold, I have told you before.

label: Matthew
text: Wherefore if they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the desert; go not forth: behold, [he is] in the secret chambers; believe [it] not.

label: Matthew
text: For as the lightning cometh out of the east, and shineth even unto the west; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

label: Matthew
text: For wheresoever the carcase is, there will the eagles be gathered together.

label: Matthew
text: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:

label: Matthew
text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

label: Matthew
text: And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

label: Matthew
text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When his branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer [is] nigh:

label: Matthew
text: So likewise ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is near, [even] at the doors.

label: Matthew
text: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.

label: Matthew
text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

label: Matthew
text: But of that day and hour knoweth no [man], no, not the angels of heaven, but my Father only.

label: Matthew
text: But as the days of Noe [were], so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

label: Matthew
text: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark,

label: Matthew
text: And knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

label: Matthew
text: Then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

label: Matthew
text: Two [women shall be] grinding at the mill; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

label: Matthew
text: Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.

label: Matthew
text: But know this, that if the goodman of the house had known in what watch the thief would come, he would have watched, and would not have suffered his house to be broken up.

label: Matthew
text: Therefore be ye also ready: for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh.

label: Mark
text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God;

label: Mark
text: As it is written in the prophets, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.

label: Mark
text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

label: Mark
text: John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.

label: Mark
text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea, and they of Jerusalem, and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.

label: Mark
text: And John was clothed with camel’s hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he did eat locusts and wild honey;

label: Mark
text: And preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.

label: Mark
text: I indeed have baptized you with water: but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.

label: Mark
text: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.

label: Mark
text: And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him:

label: Mark
text: And there came a voice from heaven, [saying], Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

label: Mark
text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.

label: Mark
text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan; and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.

label: Mark
text: Now after that John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,

label: Mark
text: And saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.

label: Mark
text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus said unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.

label: Mark
text: And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.

label: Mark
text: And when he had gone a little further thence, he saw James the [son] of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.

label: Mark
text: And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went after him.

label: Mark
text: And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.

label: Mark
text: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.

label: Mark
text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,

label: Mark
text: Saying, Let [us] alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth?

label: Mark
text: art thou come to destroy us?

label: Mark
text: I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.

label: Mark
text: And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.

label: Mark
text: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this?

label: Mark
text: what new doctrine [is] this?

label: Mark
text: for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do obey him.

label: Mark
text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.

label: Mark
text: And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

label: Mark
text: But Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.

label: Mark
text: And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.

label: Mark
text: And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.

label: Mark
text: And all the city was gathered together at the door.

label: Mark
text: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.

label: Mark
text: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.

label: Mark
text: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.

label: Mark
text: And when they had found him, they said unto him, All [men] seek for thee.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.

label: Mark
text: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.

label: Mark
text: And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forth [his] hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou clean.

label: Mark
text: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.

label: Mark
text: And he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;

label: Mark
text: And saith unto him, See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

label: Mark
text: But he went out, and began to publish [it] much, and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.

label: Mark
text: And again he entered into Capernaum, after [some] days; and it was noised that he was in the house.

label: Mark
text: And straightway many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receive [them], no, not so much as about the door: and he preached the word unto them.

label: Mark
text: And they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.

label: Mark
text: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken [it] up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.

label: Mark
text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.

label: Mark
text: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

label: Mark
text: Why doth this [man] thus speak blasphemies?

label: Mark
text: who can forgive sins but God only?

label: Mark
text: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, he said unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?

label: Mark
text: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy, [Thy] sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?

label: Mark
text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (he saith to the sick of the palsy,)

label: Mark
text: I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and go thy way into thine house.

label: Mark
text: And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.

label: Mark
text: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.

label: Mark
text: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the [son] of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me.

label: Mark
text: And he arose and followed him.

label: Mark
text: And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.

label: Mark
text: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?

label: Mark
text: When Jesus heard [it], he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

label: Mark
text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?

label: Mark
text: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

label: Mark
text: as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.

label: Mark
text: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

label: Mark
text: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment: else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old, and the rent is made worse.

label: Mark
text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: else the new wine doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.

label: Mark
text: And it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.

label: Mark
text: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?

label: Mark
text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to them which were with him?

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:

label: Mark
text: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

label: Mark
text: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.

label: Mark
text: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.

label: Mark
text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand, Stand forth.

label: Mark
text: And he saith unto them, Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil?

label: Mark
text: to save life, or to kill?

label: Mark
text: But they held their peace.

label: Mark
text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand.

label: Mark
text: And he stretched [it] out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

label: Mark
text: And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

label: Mark
text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea,

label: Mark
text: And from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and [from] beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.

label: Mark
text: And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.

label: Mark
text: For he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.

label: Mark
text: And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.

label: Mark
text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.

label: Mark
text: And he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth [unto him] whom he would: and they came unto him.

label: Mark
text: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,

label: Mark
text: And to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:

label: Mark
text: And Simon he surnamed Peter;

label: Mark
text: And James the [son] of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:

label: Mark
text: And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the [son] of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Canaanite,

label: Mark
text: And Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.

label: Mark
text: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

label: Mark
text: And when his friends heard [of it], they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.

label: Mark
text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.

label: Mark
text: And he called them [unto him], and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?

label: Mark
text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

label: Mark
text: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

label: Mark
text: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.

label: Mark
text: No man can enter into a strong man’s house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.

label: Mark
text: Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:

label: Mark
text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:

label: Mark
text: Because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.

label: Mark
text: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.

label: Mark
text: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

label: Mark
text: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, or my brethren?

label: Mark
text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!

label: Mark
text: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.

label: Mark
text: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.

label: Mark
text: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,

label: Mark
text: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:

label: Mark
text: And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

label: Mark
text: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:

label: Mark
text: But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

label: Mark
text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

label: Mark
text: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

label: Mark
text: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all [these] things are done in parables:

label: Mark
text: That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and [their] sins should be forgiven them.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable?

label: Mark
text: and how then will ye know all parables?

label: Mark
text: The sower soweth the word.

label: Mark
text: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.

label: Mark
text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;

label: Mark
text: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word’s sake, immediately they are offended.

label: Mark
text: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,

label: Mark
text: And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

label: Mark
text: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive [it], and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed?

label: Mark
text: and not to be set on a candlestick?

label: Mark
text: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.

label: Mark
text: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.

label: Mark
text: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.

label: Mark
text: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;

label: Mark
text: And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.

label: Mark
text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.

label: Mark
text: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.

label: Mark
text: And he said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God?

label: Mark
text: or with what comparison shall we compare it?

label: Mark
text: [It is] like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:

label: Mark
text: But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.

label: Mark
text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear [it].

label: Mark
text: But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.

label: Mark
text: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.

label: Mark
text: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship.

label: Mark
text: And there were also with him other little ships.

label: Mark
text: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.

label: Mark
text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?

label: Mark
text: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still.

label: Mark
text: And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful?

label: Mark
text: how is it that ye have no faith?

label: Mark
text: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?

label: Mark
text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

label: Mark
text: And when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,

label: Mark
text: Who had [his] dwelling among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with chains:

label: Mark
text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any [man] tame him.

label: Mark
text: And always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.

label: Mark
text: But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him,

label: Mark
text: And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, [thou] Son of the most high God?

label: Mark
text: I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.

label: Mark
text: For he said unto him, Come out of the man, [thou] unclean spirit.

label: Mark
text: And he asked him, What [is] thy name?

label: Mark
text: And he answered, saying, My name [is] Legion: for we are many.

label: Mark
text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

label: Mark
text: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.

label: Mark
text: And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.

label: Mark
text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave.

label: Mark
text: And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea.

label: Mark
text: And they that fed the swine fled, and told [it] in the city, and in the country.

label: Mark
text: And they went out to see what it was that was done.

label: Mark
text: And they come to Jesus, and see him that was possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.

label: Mark
text: And they that saw [it] told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, and [also] concerning the swine.

label: Mark
text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.

label: Mark
text: And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.

label: Mark
text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go home to thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee.

label: Mark
text: And he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all [men] did marvel.

label: Mark
text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him: and he was nigh unto the sea.

label: Mark
text: And, behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet,

label: Mark
text: And besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death: [I pray thee], come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.

label: Mark
text: And [Jesus] went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.

label: Mark
text: And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,

label: Mark
text: And had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,

label: Mark
text: When she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.

label: Mark
text: For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.

label: Mark
text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in [her] body that she was healed of that plague.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?

label: Mark
text: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?

label: Mark
text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.

label: Mark
text: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.

label: Mark
text: While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue’s [house certain] which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?

label: Mark
text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only believe.

label: Mark
text: And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.

label: Mark
text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.

label: Mark
text: And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep?

label: Mark
text: the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.

label: Mark
text: And they laughed him to scorn.

label: Mark
text: But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.

label: Mark
text: And he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.

label: Mark
text: And straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she was [of the age] of twelve years.

label: Mark
text: And they were astonished with a great astonishment.

label: Mark
text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.

label: Mark
text: And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.

label: Mark
text: And when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing [him] were astonished, saying, From whence hath this [man] these things?

label: Mark
text: and what wisdom [is] this which is given unto him, that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands?

label: Mark
text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon?

label: Mark
text: and are not his sisters here with us?

label: Mark
text: And they were offended at him.

label: Mark
text: But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.

label: Mark
text: And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed [them].

label: Mark
text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief.

label: Mark
text: And he went round about the villages, teaching.

label: Mark
text: And he called [unto him] the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits;

label: Mark
text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for [their] journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in [their] purse:

label: Mark
text: But [be] shod with sandals; and not put on two coats.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, In what place soever ye enter into an house, there abide till ye depart from that place.

label: Mark
text: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them.

label: Mark
text: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

label: Mark
text: And they went out, and preached that men should repent.

label: Mark
text: And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed [them].

label: Mark
text: And king Herod heard [of him]; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.

label: Mark
text: Others said, That it is Elias.

label: Mark
text: And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.

label: Mark
text: But when Herod heard [thereof], he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.

label: Mark
text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias’ sake, his brother Philip’s wife: for he had married her.

label: Mark
text: For John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother’s wife.

label: Mark
text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:

label: Mark
text: For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man and an holy, and observed him; and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.

label: Mark
text: And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, high captains, and chief [estates] of Galilee;

label: Mark
text: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod and them that sat with him, the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give [it] thee.

label: Mark
text: And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give [it] thee, unto the half of my kingdom.

label: Mark
text: And she went forth, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask?

label: Mark
text: And she said, The head of John the Baptist.

label: Mark
text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist.

label: Mark
text: And the king was exceeding sorry; [yet] for his oath’s sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.

label: Mark
text: And immediately the king sent an executioner, and commanded his head to be brought: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,

label: Mark
text: And brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.

label: Mark
text: And when his disciples heard [of it], they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

label: Mark
text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while: for there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

label: Mark
text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.

label: Mark
text: And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.

label: Mark
text: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the time [is] far passed:

label: Mark
text: Send them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.

label: Mark
text: He answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat.

label: Mark
text: And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?

label: Mark
text: He saith unto them, How many loaves have ye?

label: Mark
text: go and see.

label: Mark
text: And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.

label: Mark
text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.

label: Mark
text: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.

label: Mark
text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave [them] to his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.

label: Mark
text: And they did all eat, and were filled.

label: Mark
text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.

label: Mark
text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.

label: Mark
text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.

label: Mark
text: And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.

label: Mark
text: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.

label: Mark
text: And he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.

label: Mark
text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:

label: Mark
text: For they all saw him, and were troubled.

label: Mark
text: And immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.

label: Mark
text: And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.

label: Mark
text: For they considered not [the miracle] of the loaves: for their heart was hardened.

label: Mark
text: And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.

label: Mark
text: And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,

label: Mark
text: And ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.

label: Mark
text: And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.

label: Mark
text: Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.

label: Mark
text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.

label: Mark
text: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash [their] hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.

label: Mark
text: And [when they come] from the market, except they wash, they eat not.

label: Mark
text: And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, [as] the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.

label: Mark
text: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?

label: Mark
text: He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with [their] lips, but their heart is far from me.

label: Mark
text: Howbeit in vain do they worship me, teaching [for] doctrines the commandments of men.

label: Mark
text: For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men, [as] the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.

label: Mark
text: For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:

label: Mark
text: But ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, [It is] Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; [he shall be free].

label: Mark
text: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;

label: Mark
text: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.

label: Mark
text: And when he had called all the people [unto him], he said unto them, Hearken unto me every one [of you], and understand:

label: Mark
text: There is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.

label: Mark
text: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

label: Mark
text: And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.

label: Mark
text: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also?

label: Mark
text: Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, [it] cannot defile him;

label: Mark
text: Because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?

label: Mark
text: And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.

label: Mark
