text: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,

label: Mark
text: Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:

label: Mark
text: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.

label: Mark
text: And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know [it]: but he could not be hid.

label: Mark
text: For a [certain] woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:

label: Mark
text: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.

label: Mark
text: But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children’s bread, and to cast [it] unto the dogs.

label: Mark
text: And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children’s crumbs.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.

label: Mark
text: And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.

label: Mark
text: And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.

label: Mark
text: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.

label: Mark
text: And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;

label: Mark
text: And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.

label: Mark
text: And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.

label: Mark
text: And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published [it];

label: Mark
text: And were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.

label: Mark
text: In those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples [unto him], and saith unto them,

label: Mark
text: I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:

label: Mark
text: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.

label: Mark
text: And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these [men] with bread here in the wilderness?

label: Mark
text: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye?

label: Mark
text: And they said, Seven.

label: Mark
text: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before [them]; and they did set [them] before the people.

label: Mark
text: And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before [them].

label: Mark
text: So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken [meat] that was left seven baskets.

label: Mark
text: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.

label: Mark
text: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.

label: Mark
text: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.

label: Mark
text: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign?

label: Mark
text: verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.

label: Mark
text: And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.

label: Mark
text: Now [the disciples] had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.

label: Mark
text: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and [of] the leaven of Herod.

label: Mark
text: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, [It is] because we have no bread.

label: Mark
text: And when Jesus knew [it], he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread?

label: Mark
text: perceive ye not yet, neither understand?

label: Mark
text: have ye your heart yet hardened?

label: Mark
text: Having eyes, see ye not?

label: Mark
text: and having ears, hear ye not?

label: Mark
text: and do ye not remember?

label: Mark
text: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up?

label: Mark
text: They say unto him, Twelve.

label: Mark
text: And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up?

label: Mark
text: And they said, Seven.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?

label: Mark
text: And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.

label: Mark
text: And he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes, and put his hands upon him, he asked him if he saw ought.

label: Mark
text: And he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.

label: Mark
text: After that he put [his] hands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.

label: Mark
text: And he sent him away to his house, saying, Neither go into the town, nor tell [it] to any in the town.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus went out, and his disciples, into the towns of Caesarea Philippi: and by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Whom do men say that I am?

label: Mark
text: And they answered, John the Baptist: but some [say], Elias; and others, One of the prophets.

label: Mark
text: And he saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am?

label: Mark
text: And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.

label: Mark
text: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.

label: Mark
text: And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders, and [of] the chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.

label: Mark
text: And he spake that saying openly.

label: Mark
text: And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

label: Mark
text: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples, he rebuked Peter, saying, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but the things that be of men.

label: Mark
text: And when he had called the people [unto him] with his disciples also, he said unto them, Whosoever will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

label: Mark
text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel’s, the same shall save it.

label: Mark
text: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?

label: Mark
text: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?

label: Mark
text: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.

label: Mark
text: And after six days Jesus taketh [with him] Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.

label: Mark
text: And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.

label: Mark
text: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.

label: Mark
text: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.

label: Mark
text: For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.

label: Mark
text: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.

label: Mark
text: And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.

label: Mark
text: And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.

label: Mark
text: And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.

label: Mark
text: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?

label: Mark
text: And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.

label: Mark
text: But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.

label: Mark
text: And when he came to [his] disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.

label: Mark
text: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to [him] saluted him.

label: Mark
text: And he asked the scribes, What question ye with them?

label: Mark
text: And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;

label: Mark
text: And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.

label: Mark
text: He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you?

label: Mark
text: how long shall I suffer you?

label: Mark
text: bring him unto me.

label: Mark
text: And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.

label: Mark
text: And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him?

label: Mark
text: And he said, Of a child.

label: Mark
text: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.

label: Mark
text: Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things [are] possible to him that believeth.

label: Mark
text: And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.

label: Mark
text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him, [Thou] dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.

label: Mark
text: And [the spirit] cried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.

label: Mark
text: But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.

label: Mark
text: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.

label: Mark
text: And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know [it].

label: Mark
text: For he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and after that he is killed, he shall rise the third day.

label: Mark
text: But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.

label: Mark
text: And he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them, What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?

label: Mark
text: But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, who [should be] the greatest.

label: Mark
text: And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If any man desire to be first, [the same] shall be last of all, and servant of all.

label: Mark
text: And he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,

label: Mark
text: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.

label: Mark
text: And John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.

label: Mark
text: But Jesus said, Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.

label: Mark
text: For he that is not against us is on our part.

label: Mark
text: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.

label: Mark
text: And whosoever shall offend one of [these] little ones that believe in me, it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were cast into the sea.

label: Mark
text: And if thy hand offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having two hands to go into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:

label: Mark
text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

label: Mark
text: And if thy foot offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter halt into life, than having two feet to be cast into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:

label: Mark
text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

label: Mark
text: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out: it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire:

label: Mark
text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

label: Mark
text: For every one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.

label: Mark
text: Salt [is] good: but if the salt have lost his saltness, wherewith will ye season it?

label: Mark
text: Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.

label: Mark
text: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.

label: Mark
text: And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away [his] wife?

label: Mark
text: tempting him.

label: Mark
text: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?

label: Mark
text: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put [her] away.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.

label: Mark
text: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.

label: Mark
text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;

label: Mark
text: And they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.

label: Mark
text: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

label: Mark
text: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same [matter].

label: Mark
text: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.

label: Mark
text: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.

label: Mark
text: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and [his] disciples rebuked those that brought [them].

label: Mark
text: But when Jesus saw [it], he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

label: Mark
text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.

label: Mark
text: And he took them up in his arms, put [his] hands upon them, and blessed them.

label: Mark
text: And when he was gone forth into the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?

label: Mark
text: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good?

label: Mark
text: [there is] none good but one, [that is], God.

label: Mark
text: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Defraud not, Honour thy father and mother.

label: Mark
text: And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.

label: Mark
text: Then Jesus beholding him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go thy way, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, take up the cross, and follow me.

label: Mark
text: And he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had great possessions.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

label: Mark
text: And the disciples were astonished at his words.

label: Mark
text: But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!

label: Mark
text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

label: Mark
text: And they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?

label: Mark
text: And Jesus looking upon them saith, With men [it is] impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.

label: Mark
text: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answered and said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel’s,

label: Mark
text: But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.

label: Mark
text: But many [that are] first shall be last; and the last first.

label: Mark
text: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid.

label: Mark
text: And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,

label: Mark
text: [Saying], Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles:

label: Mark
text: And they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.

label: Mark
text: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?

label: Mark
text: They said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.

label: Mark
text: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink of the cup that I drink of?

label: Mark
text: and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?

label: Mark
text: And they said unto him, We can.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus said unto them, Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:

label: Mark
text: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but [it shall be given to them] for whom it is prepared.

label: Mark
text: And when the ten heard [it], they began to be much displeased with James and John.

label: Mark
text: But Jesus called them [to him], and saith unto them, Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and their great ones exercise authority upon them.

label: Mark
text: But so shall it not be among you: but whosoever will be great among you, shall be your minister:

label: Mark
text: And whosoever of you will be the chiefest, shall be servant of all.

label: Mark
text: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.

label: Mark
text: And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the highway side begging.

label: Mark
text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, [thou] Son of David, have mercy on me.

label: Mark
text: And many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal, [Thou] Son of David, have mercy on me.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called.

label: Mark
text: And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good comfort, rise; he calleth thee.

label: Mark
text: And he, casting away his garment, rose, and came to Jesus.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee?

label: Mark
text: The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus said unto him, Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole.

label: Mark
text: And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

label: Mark
text: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth forth two of his disciples,

label: Mark
text: And saith unto them, Go your way into the village over against you: and as soon as ye be entered into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat; loose him, and bring [him].

label: Mark
text: And if any man say unto you, Why do ye this?

label: Mark
text: say ye that the Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither.

label: Mark
text: And they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.

label: Mark
text: And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?

label: Mark
text: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded: and they let them go.

label: Mark
text: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him; and he sat upon him.

label: Mark
text: And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches off the trees, and strawed [them] in the way.

label: Mark
text: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessed [is] he that cometh in the name of the Lord:

label: Mark
text: Blessed [be] the kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and when he had looked round about upon all things, and now the eventide was come, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.

label: Mark
text: And on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:

label: Mark
text: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was not [yet].

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever.

label: Mark
text: And his disciples heard [it].

label: Mark
text: And they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves;

label: Mark
text: And would not suffer that any man should carry [any] vessel through the temple.

label: Mark
text: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer?

label: Mark
text: but ye have made it a den of thieves.

label: Mark
text: And the scribes and chief priests heard [it], and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.

label: Mark
text: And when even was come, he went out of the city.

label: Mark
text: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.

label: Mark
text: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.

label: Mark
text: For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.

label: Mark
text: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive [them], and ye shall have [them].

label: Mark
text: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

label: Mark
text: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.

label: Mark
text: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,

label: Mark
text: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things?

label: Mark
text: and who gave thee this authority to do these things?

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I will also ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

label: Mark
text: The baptism of John, was [it] from heaven, or of men?

label: Mark
text: answer me.

label: Mark
text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?

label: Mark
text: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all [men] counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.

label: Mark
text: And they answered and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answering saith unto them, Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.

label: Mark
text: And he began to speak unto them by parables.

label: Mark
text: A [certain] man planted a vineyard, and set an hedge about [it], and digged [a place for] the winefat, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country.

label: Mark
text: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.

label: Mark
text: And they caught [him], and beat him, and sent [him] away empty.

label: Mark
text: And again he sent unto them another servant; and at him they cast stones, and wounded [him] in the head, and sent [him] away shamefully handled.

label: Mark
text: And again he sent another; and him they killed, and many others; beating some, and killing some.

label: Mark
text: Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.

label: Mark
text: But those husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.

label: Mark
text: And they took him, and killed [him], and cast [him] out of the vineyard.

label: Mark
text: What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do?

label: Mark
text: he will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.

label: Mark
text: And have ye not read this scripture; The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner:

label: Mark
text: This was the Lord’s doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?

label: Mark
text: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.

label: Mark
text: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in [his] words.

label: Mark
text: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?

label: Mark
text: Shall we give, or shall we not give?

label: Mark
text: But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me?

label: Mark
text: bring me a penny, that I may see [it].

label: Mark
text: And they brought [it].

label: Mark
text: And he saith unto them, Whose [is] this image and superscription?

label: Mark
text: And they said unto him, Caesar’s.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answering said unto them, Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.

label: Mark
text: And they marvelled at him.

label: Mark
text: Then come unto him the Sadducees, which say there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,

label: Mark
text: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man’s brother die, and leave [his] wife [behind him], and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

label: Mark
text: Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.

label: Mark
text: And the second took her, and died, neither left he any seed: and the third likewise.

label: Mark
text: And the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman died also.

label: Mark
text: In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be of them?

label: Mark
text: for the seven had her to wife.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answering said unto them, Do ye not therefore err, because ye know not the scriptures, neither the power of God?

label: Mark
text: For when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage; but are as the angels which are in heaven.

label: Mark
text: And as touching the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spake unto him, saying, I [am] the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

label: Mark
text: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living: ye therefore do greatly err.

label: Mark
text: And one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, and perceiving that he had answered them well, asked him, Which is the first commandment of all?

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answered him, The first of all the commandments [is], Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:

label: Mark
text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength: this [is] the first commandment.

label: Mark
text: And the second [is] like, [namely] this, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

label: Mark
text: There is none other commandment greater than these.

label: Mark
text: And the scribe said unto him, Well, Master, thou hast said the truth: for there is one God; and there is none other but he:

label: Mark
text: And to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love [his] neighbour as himself, is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.

label: Mark
text: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou art not far from the kingdom of God.

label: Mark
text: And no man after that durst ask him [any question].

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David?

label: Mark
text: For David himself said by the Holy Ghost, The LORD said to my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

label: Mark
text: David therefore himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he [then] his son?

label: Mark
text: And the common people heard him gladly.

label: Mark
text: And he said unto them in his doctrine, Beware of the scribes, which love to go in long clothing, and [love] salutations in the marketplaces,

label: Mark
text: And the chief seats in the synagogues, and the uppermost rooms at feasts:

label: Mark
text: Which devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.

label: Mark
text: And Jesus sat over against the treasury, and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.

label: Mark
text: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

label: Mark
text: And he called [unto him] his disciples, and saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That this poor widow hath cast more in, than all they which have cast into the treasury:

label: Mark
text: For all [they] did cast in of their abundance; but she of her want did cast in all that she had, [even] all her living.

label: Mark
text: And as he went out of the temple, one of his disciples saith unto him, Master, see what manner of stones and what buildings [are here]!

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answering said unto him, Seest thou these great buildings?

label: Mark
text: there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

label: Mark
text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,

label: Mark
text: Tell us, when shall these things be?

label: Mark
text: and what [shall be] the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?

label: Mark
text: And Jesus answering them began to say, Take heed lest any [man] deceive you:

label: Mark
text: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am [Christ]; and shall deceive many.

label: Mark
text: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be ye not troubled: for [such things] must needs be; but the end [shall] not [be] yet.

label: Mark
text: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these [are] the beginnings of sorrows.

label: Mark
text: But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.

label: Mark
text: And the gospel must first be published among all nations.

label: Mark
text: But when they shall lead [you], and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

label: Mark
text: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up against [their] parents, and shall cause them to be put to death.

label: Mark
text: And ye shall be hated of all [men] for my name’s sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

label: Mark
text: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not, (let him that readeth understand,) then let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains:

label: Mark
text: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither enter [therein], to take any thing out of his house:

label: Mark
text: And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.

label: Mark
text: But woe to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

label: Mark
text: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter.

label: Mark
text: For [in] those days shall be affliction, such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.

label: Mark
text: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect’s sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.

label: Mark
text: And then if any man shall say to you, Lo, here [is] Christ; or, lo, [he is] there; believe [him] not:

label: Mark
text: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce, if [it were] possible, even the elect.

label: Mark
text: But take ye heed: behold, I have foretold you all things.

label: Mark
text: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,

label: Mark
text: And the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.

label: Mark
text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.

label: Mark
text: And then shall he send his angels, and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.

label: Mark
text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When her branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near:

label: Mark
text: So ye in like manner, when ye shall see these things come to pass, know that it is nigh, [even] at the doors.

label: Mark
text: Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all these things be done.

label: Mark
text: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

label: Mark
text: But of that day and [that] hour knoweth no man, no, not the angels which are in heaven, neither the Son, but the Father.

label: Mark
text: Take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.

label: Mark
text: [For the Son of man is] as a man taking a far journey, who left his house, and gave authority to his servants, and to every man his work, and commanded the porter to watch.

label: Mark
text: Watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning:

label: Mark
text: Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.

label: Mark
text: And what I say unto you I say unto all, Watch.

label: Mark
text: After two days was [the feast of] the passover, and of unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft, and put [him] to death.

label: Mark
text: But they said, Not on the feast [day], lest there be an uproar of the people.

label: Mark
text: And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard very precious; and she brake the box, and poured [it] on his head.

label: Mark
text: And there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said, Why was this waste of the ointment made?

label: Luke
text: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us,

label: Luke
text: Even as they delivered them unto us, which from the beginning were eyewitnesses, and ministers of the word;

label: Luke
text: It seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,

label: Luke
text: That thou mightest know the certainty of those things, wherein thou hast been instructed.

label: Luke
text: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judaea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the course of Abia: and his wife [was] of the daughters of Aaron, and her name [was] Elisabeth.

label: Luke
text: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.

label: Luke
text: And they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and they both were [now] well stricken in years.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his course,

label: Luke
text: According to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.

label: Luke
text: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense.

label: Luke
text: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

label: Luke
text: And when Zacharias saw [him], he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.

label: Luke
text: But the angel said unto him, Fear not, Zacharias: for thy prayer is heard; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.

label: Luke
text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.

label: Luke
text: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother’s womb.

label: Luke
text: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God.

label: Luke
text: And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.

label: Luke
text: And Zacharias said unto the angel, Whereby shall I know this?

label: Luke
text: for I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.

label: Luke
text: And the angel answering said unto him, I am Gabriel, that stand in the presence of God; and am sent to speak unto thee, and to shew thee these glad tidings.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.

label: Luke
text: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.

label: Luke
text: And when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple: for he beckoned unto them, and remained speechless.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished, he departed to his own house.

label: Luke
text: And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,

label: Luke
text: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on [me], to take away my reproach among men.

label: Luke
text: And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,

label: Luke
text: To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin’s name [was] Mary.

label: Luke
text: And the angel came in unto her, and said, Hail, [thou that art] highly favoured, the Lord [is] with thee: blessed [art] thou among women.

label: Luke
text: And when she saw [him], she was troubled at his saying, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be.

label: Luke
text: And the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favour with God.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bring forth a son, and shalt call his name JESUS.

label: Luke
text: He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Highest: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:

label: Luke
text: And he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of his kingdom there shall be no end.

label: Luke
text: Then said Mary unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?

label: Luke
text: And the angel answered and said unto her, The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee: therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, thy cousin Elisabeth, she hath also conceived a son in her old age: and this is the sixth month with her, who was called barren.

label: Luke
text: For with God nothing shall be impossible.

label: Luke
text: And Mary said, Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word.

label: Luke
text: And the angel departed from her.

label: Luke
text: And Mary arose in those days, and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Juda;

label: Luke
text: And entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elisabeth.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost:

label: Luke
text: And she spake out with a loud voice, and said, Blessed [art] thou among women, and blessed [is] the fruit of thy womb.

label: Luke
text: And whence [is] this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

label: Luke
text: For, lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.

label: Luke
text: And blessed [is] she that believed: for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord.

label: Luke
text: And Mary said, My soul doth magnify the Lord,

label: Luke
text: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

label: Luke
text: For he hath regarded the low estate of his handmaiden: for, behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.

label: Luke
text: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things; and holy [is] his name.

label: Luke
text: And his mercy [is] on them that fear him from generation to generation.

label: Luke
text: He hath shewed strength with his arm; he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

label: Luke
text: He hath put down the mighty from [their] seats, and exalted them of low degree.

label: Luke
text: He hath filled the hungry with good things; and the rich he hath sent empty away.

label: Luke
text: He hath holpen his servant Israel, in remembrance of [his] mercy;

label: Luke
text: As he spake to our fathers, to Abraham, and to his seed for ever.

label: Luke
text: And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned to her own house.

label: Luke
text: Now Elisabeth’s full time came that she should be delivered; and she brought forth a son.

label: Luke
text: And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her; and they rejoiced with her.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child; and they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.

label: Luke
text: And his mother answered and said, Not [so]; but he shall be called John.

label: Luke
text: And they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.

label: Luke
text: And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.

label: Luke
text: And he asked for a writing table, and wrote, saying, His name is John.

label: Luke
text: And they marvelled all.

label: Luke
text: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue [loosed], and he spake, and praised God.

label: Luke
text: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea.

label: Luke
text: And all they that heard [them] laid [them] up in their hearts, saying, What manner of child shall this be!

label: Luke
text: And the hand of the Lord was with him.

label: Luke
text: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,

label: Luke
text: Blessed [be] the Lord God of Israel; for he hath visited and redeemed his people,

label: Luke
text: And hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David;

label: Luke
text: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets, which have been since the world began:

label: Luke
text: That we should be saved from our enemies, and from the hand of all that hate us;

label: Luke
text: To perform the mercy [promised] to our fathers, and to remember his holy covenant;

label: Luke
text: The oath which he sware to our father Abraham,

label: Luke
text: That he would grant unto us, that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear,

label: Luke
text: In holiness and righteousness before him, all the days of our life.

label: Luke
text: And thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Highest: for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;

label: Luke
text: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins,

label: Luke
text: Through the tender mercy of our God; whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us,

label: Luke
text: To give light to them that sit in darkness and [in] the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace.

label: Luke
text: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world should be taxed.

label: Luke
text: ([And] this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)

label: Luke
text: And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.

label: Luke
text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)

label: Luke
text: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.

label: Luke
text: And so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.

label: Luke
text: And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.

label: Luke
text: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.

label: Luke
text: And, lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.

label: Luke
text: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.

label: Luke
text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.

label: Luke
text: And this [shall be] a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.

label: Luke
text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,

label: Luke
text: Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing which is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.

label: Luke
text: And they came with haste, and found Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in a manger.

label: Luke
text: And when they had seen [it], they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.

label: Luke
text: And all they that heard [it] wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.

label: Luke
text: But Mary kept all these things, and pondered [them] in her heart.

label: Luke
text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.

label: Luke
text: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child, his name was called JESUS, which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

label: Luke
text: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present [him] to the Lord;

label: Luke
text: (As it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord;)

label: Luke
text: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name [was] Simeon; and the same man [was] just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon him.

label: Luke
text: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.

label: Luke
text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,

label: Luke
text: Then took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,

label: Luke
text: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word:

label: Luke
text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,

label: Luke
text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people;

label: Luke
text: A light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel.

label: Luke
text: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.

label: Luke
text: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this [child] is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;

label: Luke
text: (Yea, a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also,) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.

label: Luke
text: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser: she was of a great age, and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity;

label: Luke
text: And she [was] a widow of about fourscore and four years, which departed not from the temple, but served [God] with fastings and prayers night and day.

label: Luke
text: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.

label: Luke
text: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.

label: Luke
text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.

label: Luke
text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.

label: Luke
text: And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew not [of it].

label: Luke
text: But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day’s journey; and they sought him among [their] kinsfolk and acquaintance.

label: Luke
text: And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.

label: Luke
text: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.

label: Luke
text: And when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us?

label: Luke
text: behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me?

label: Luke
text: wist ye not that I must be about my Father’s business?

label: Luke
text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.

label: Luke
text: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.

label: Luke
text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,

label: Luke
text: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.

label: Luke
text: And he came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins;

label: Luke
text: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

label: Luke
text: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low; and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways [shall be] made smooth;

label: Luke
text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

label: Luke
text: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

label: Luke
text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to [our] father: for I say unto you, That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

label: Luke
text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

label: Luke
text: And the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?

label: Luke
text: He answereth and saith unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none; and he that hath meat, let him do likewise.

label: Luke
text: Then came also publicans to be baptized, and said unto him, Master, what shall we do?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Exact no more than that which is appointed you.

label: Luke
text: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him, saying, And what shall we do?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Do violence to no man, neither accuse [any] falsely; and be content with your wages.

label: Luke
text: And as the people were in expectation, and all men mused in their hearts of John, whether he were the Christ, or not;

label: Luke
text: John answered, saying unto [them] all, I indeed baptize you with water; but one mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:

label: Luke
text: Whose fan [is] in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and will gather the wheat into his garner; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable.

label: Luke
text: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people.

label: Luke
text: But Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,

label: Luke
text: Added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.

label: Luke
text: Now when all the people were baptized, it came to pass, that Jesus also being baptized, and praying, the heaven was opened,

label: Luke
text: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven, which said, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, which was [the son] of Heli,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Matthat, which was [the son] of Levi, which was [the son] of Melchi, which was [the son] of Janna, which was [the son] of Joseph,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Mattathias, which was [the son] of Amos, which was [the son] of Naum, which was [the son] of Esli, which was [the son] of Nagge,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Maath, which was [the son] of Mattathias, which was [the son] of Semei, which was [the son] of Joseph, which was [the son] of Juda,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Joanna, which was [the son] of Rhesa, which was [the son] of Zorobabel, which was [the son] of Salathiel, which was [the son] of Neri,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Melchi, which was [the son] of Addi, which was [the son] of Cosam, which was [the son] of Elmodam, which was [the son] of Er,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Jose, which was [the son] of Eliezer, which was [the son] of Jorim, which was [the son] of Matthat, which was [the son] of Levi,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Simeon, which was [the son] of Juda, which was [the son] of Joseph, which was [the son] of Jonan, which was [the son] of Eliakim,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Melea, which was [the son] of Menan, which was [the son] of Mattatha, which was [the son] of Nathan, which was [the son] of David,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Jesse, which was [the son] of Obed, which was [the son] of Booz, which was [the son] of Salmon, which was [the son] of Naasson,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Aminadab, which was [the son] of Aram, which was [the son] of Esrom, which was [the son] of Phares, which was [the son] of Juda,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Jacob, which was [the son] of Isaac, which was [the son] of Abraham, which was [the son] of Thara, which was [the son] of Nachor,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Saruch, which was [the son] of Ragau, which was [the son] of Phalec, which was [the son] of Heber, which was [the son] of Sala,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Cainan, which was [the son] of Arphaxad, which was [the son] of Sem, which was [the son] of Noe, which was [the son] of Lamech,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Mathusala, which was [the son] of Enoch, which was [the son] of Jared, which was [the son] of Maleleel, which was [the son] of Cainan,

label: Luke
text: Which was [the son] of Enos, which was [the son] of Seth, which was [the son] of Adam, which was [the son] of God.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,

label: Luke
text: Being forty days tempted of the devil.

label: Luke
text: And in those days he did eat nothing: and when they were ended, he afterward hungered.

label: Luke
text: And the devil said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, command this stone that it be made bread.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answered him, saying, It is written, That man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.

label: Luke
text: And the devil, taking him up into an high mountain, shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.

label: Luke
text: And the devil said unto him, All this power will I give thee, and the glory of them: for that is delivered unto me; and to whomsoever I will I give it.

label: Luke
text: If thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be thine.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answered and said unto him, Get thee behind me, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

label: Luke
text: And he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence:

label: Luke
text: For it is written, He shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee:

label: Luke
text: And in [their] hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering said unto him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

label: Luke
text: And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from him for a season.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee: and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about.

label: Luke
text: And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.

label: Luke
text: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and, as his custom was, he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up for to read.

label: Luke
text: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias.

label: Luke
text: And when he had opened the book, he found the place where it was written,

label: Luke
text: The Spirit of the Lord [is] upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised,

label: Luke
text: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord.

label: Luke
text: And he closed the book, and he gave [it] again to the minister, and sat down.

label: Luke
text: And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him.

label: Luke
text: And he began to say unto them, This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.

label: Luke
text: And all bare him witness, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth.

label: Luke
text: And they said, Is not this Joseph’s son?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Ye will surely say unto me this proverb, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country.

label: Luke
text: And he said, Verily I say unto you, No prophet is accepted in his own country.

label: Luke
text: But I tell you of a truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land;

label: Luke
text: But unto none of them was Elias sent, save unto Sarepta, [a city] of Sidon, unto a woman [that was] a widow.

label: Luke
text: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet; and none of them was cleansed, saving Naaman the Syrian.

label: Luke
text: And all they in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,

label: Luke
text: And rose up, and thrust him out of the city, and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might cast him down headlong.

label: Luke
text: But he passing through the midst of them went his way,

label: Luke
text: And came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the sabbath days.

label: Luke
text: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for his word was with power.

label: Luke
text: And in the synagogue there was a man, which had a spirit of an unclean devil, and cried out with a loud voice,

label: Luke
text: Saying, Let [us] alone; what have we to do with thee, [thou] Jesus of Nazareth?

label: Luke
text: art thou come to destroy us?

label: Luke
text: I know thee who thou art; the Holy One of God.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.

label: Luke
text: And when the devil had thrown him in the midst, he came out of him, and hurt him not.

label: Luke
text: And they were all amazed, and spake among themselves, saying, What a word [is] this!

label: Luke
text: for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.

label: Luke
text: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about.

label: Luke
text: And he arose out of the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house.

label: Luke
text: And Simon’s wife’s mother was taken with a great fever; and they besought him for her.

label: Luke
text: And he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she arose and ministered unto them.

label: Luke
text: Now when the sun was setting, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.

label: Luke
text: And devils also came out of many, crying out, and saying, Thou art Christ the Son of God.

label: Luke
text: And he rebuking [them] suffered them not to speak: for they knew that he was Christ.

label: Luke
text: And when it was day, he departed and went into a desert place: and the people sought him, and came unto him, and stayed him, that he should not depart from them.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also: for therefore am I sent.

label: Luke
text: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God, he stood by the lake of Gennesaret,

label: Luke
text: And saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washing [their] nets.

label: Luke
text: And he entered into one of the ships, which was Simon’s, and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land.

label: Luke
text: And he sat down, and taught the people out of the ship.

label: Luke
text: Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.

label: Luke
text: And Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.

label: Luke
text: And when they had this done, they inclosed a great multitude of fishes: and their net brake.

label: Luke
text: And they beckoned unto [their] partners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them.

label: Luke
text: And they came, and filled both the ships, so that they began to sink.

label: Luke
text: When Simon Peter saw [it], he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

label: Luke
text: For he was astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken:

label: Luke
text: And so [was] also James, and John, the sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.

label: Luke
text: And when they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy: who seeing Jesus fell on [his] face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

label: Luke
text: And he put forth [his] hand, and touched him, saying, I will: be thou clean.

label: Luke
text: And immediately the leprosy departed from him.

label: Luke
text: And he charged him to tell no man: but go, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

label: Luke
text: But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.

label: Luke
text: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judaea, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was [present] to heal them.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy: and they sought [means] to bring him in, and to lay [him] before him.

label: Luke
text: And when they could not find by what [way] they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling with [his] couch into the midst before Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.

label: Luke
text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies?

label: Luke
text: Who can forgive sins, but God alone?

label: Luke
text: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?

label: Luke
text: Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk?

label: Luke
text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins, (he said unto the sick of the palsy,) I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go into thine house.

label: Luke
text: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.

label: Luke
text: And they were all amazed, and they glorified God, and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to day.

label: Luke
text: And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him, Follow me.

label: Luke
text: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.

label: Luke
text: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house: and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them.

label: Luke
text: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners?

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering said unto them, They that are whole need not a physician; but they that are sick.

label: Luke
text: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

label: Luke
text: And they said unto him, Why do the disciples of John fast often, and make prayers, and likewise [the disciples] of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

label: Luke
text: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

label: Luke
text: And he spake also a parable unto them; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that was [taken] out of the new agreeth not with the old.

label: Luke
text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles; else the new wine will burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottles shall perish.

label: Luke
text: But new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are preserved.

label: Luke
text: No man also having drunk old [wine] straightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is better.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing [them] in [their] hands.

label: Luke
text: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;

label: Luke
text: How he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.

label: Luke
text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.

label: Luke
text: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst.

label: Luke
text: And he arose and stood forth.

label: Luke
text: Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil?

label: Luke
text: to save life, or to destroy [it]?

label: Luke
text: And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand.

label: Luke
text: And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

label: Luke
text: And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.

label: Luke
text: And when it was day, he called [unto him] his disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;

label: Luke
text: Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

label: Luke
text: Matthew and Thomas, James the [son] of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,

label: Luke
text: And Judas [the brother] of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.

label: Luke
text: And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;

label: Luke
text: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.

label: Luke
text: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed [them] all.

label: Luke
text: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed [be ye] poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: Blessed [are ye] that hunger now: for ye shall be filled.

label: Luke
text: Blessed [are ye] that weep now: for ye shall laugh.

label: Luke
text: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you [from their company], and shall reproach [you], and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man’s sake.

label: Luke
text: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward [is] great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

label: Luke
text: But woe unto you that are rich!

label: Luke
text: for ye have received your consolation.

label: Luke
text: Woe unto you that are full!

label: Luke
text: for ye shall hunger.

label: Luke
text: Woe unto you that laugh now!

label: Luke
text: for ye shall mourn and weep.

label: Luke
text: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you!

label: Luke
text: for so did their fathers to the false prophets.

label: Luke
text: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,

label: Luke
text: Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.

label: Luke
text: And unto him that smiteth thee on the [one] cheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid not [to take thy] coat also.

label: Luke
text: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask [them] not again.

label: Luke
text: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.

label: Luke
text: For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye?

label: Luke
text: for sinners also love those that love them.

label: Luke
text: And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye?

label: Luke
text: for sinners also do even the same.

label: Luke
text: And if ye lend [to them] of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye?

label: Luke
text: for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.

label: Luke
text: But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and [to] the evil.

label: Luke
text: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.

label: Luke
text: Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:

label: Luke
text: Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom.

label: Luke
text: For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.

label: Luke
text: And he spake a parable unto them, Can the blind lead the blind?

label: Luke
