text: shall they not both fall into the ditch?

label: Luke
text: The disciple is not above his master: but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.

label: Luke
text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

label: Luke
text: Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

label: Luke
text: Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother’s eye.

label: Luke
text: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

label: Luke
text: For every tree is known by his own fruit.

label: Luke
text: For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.

label: Luke
text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.

label: Luke
text: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?

label: Luke
text: Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:

label: Luke
text: He is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.

label: Luke
text: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.

label: Luke
text: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

label: Luke
text: And a certain centurion’s servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.

label: Luke
text: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.

label: Luke
text: And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:

label: Luke
text: For he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.

label: Luke
text: Then Jesus went with them.

label: Luke
text: And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:

label: Luke
text: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.

label: Luke
text: For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth [it].

label: Luke
text: When Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

label: Luke
text: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.

label: Luke
text: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.

label: Luke
text: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.

label: Luke
text: And he came and touched the bier: and they that bare [him] stood still.

label: Luke
text: And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.

label: Luke
text: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak.

label: Luke
text: And he delivered him to his mother.

label: Luke
text: And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.

label: Luke
text: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea, and throughout all the region round about.

label: Luke
text: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.

label: Luke
text: And John calling [unto him] two of his disciples sent [them] to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come?

label: Luke
text: or look we for another?

label: Luke
text: When the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come?

label: Luke
text: or look we for another?

label: Luke
text: And in that same hour he cured many of [their] infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many [that were] blind he gave sight.

label: Luke
text: Then Jesus answering said unto them, Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to the poor the gospel is preached.

label: Luke
text: And blessed is [he], whosoever shall not be offended in me.

label: Luke
text: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness for to see?

label: Luke
text: A reed shaken with the wind?

label: Luke
text: But what went ye out for to see?

label: Luke
text: A man clothed in soft raiment?

label: Luke
text: Behold, they which are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.

label: Luke
text: But what went ye out for to see?

label: Luke
text: A prophet?

label: Luke
text: Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.

label: Luke
text: This is [he], of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.

label: Luke
text: For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

label: Luke
text: And all the people that heard [him], and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.

label: Luke
text: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized of him.

label: Luke
text: And the Lord said, Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation?

label: Luke
text: and to what are they like?

label: Luke
text: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace, and calling one to another, and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.

label: Luke
text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.

label: Luke
text: The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!

label: Luke
text: But wisdom is justified of all her children.

label: Luke
text: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him.

label: Luke
text: And he went into the Pharisee’s house, and sat down to meat.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew that [Jesus] sat at meat in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,

label: Luke
text: And stood at his feet behind [him] weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe [them] with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed [them] with the ointment.

label: Luke
text: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw [it], he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman [this is] that toucheth him: for she is a sinner.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee.

label: Luke
text: And he saith, Master, say on.

label: Luke
text: There was a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty.

label: Luke
text: And when they had nothing to pay, he frankly forgave them both.

label: Luke
text: Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most?

label: Luke
text: Simon answered and said, I suppose that [he], to whom he forgave most.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.

label: Luke
text: And he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman?

label: Luke
text: I entered into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath washed my feet with tears, and wiped [them] with the hairs of her head.

label: Luke
text: Thou gavest me no kiss: but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet.

label: Luke
text: My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment.

label: Luke
text: Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven, [the same] loveth little.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven.

label: Luke
text: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?

label: Luke
text: And he said to the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass afterward, that he went throughout every city and village, preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God: and the twelve [were] with him,

label: Luke
text: And certain women, which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,

label: Luke
text: And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto him of their substance.

label: Luke
text: And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:

label: Luke
text: A sower went out to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.

label: Luke
text: And some fell upon a rock; and as soon as it was sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.

label: Luke
text: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it.

label: Luke
text: And other fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bare fruit an hundredfold.

label: Luke
text: And when he had said these things, he cried, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

label: Luke
text: And his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?

label: Luke
text: And he said, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to others in parables; that seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.

label: Luke
text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

label: Luke
text: Those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.

label: Luke
text: They on the rock [are they], which, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.

label: Luke
text: And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of [this] life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

label: Luke
text: But that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep [it], and bring forth fruit with patience.

label: Luke
text: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth [it] under a bed; but setteth [it] on a candlestick, that they which enter in may see the light.

label: Luke
text: For nothing is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neither [any thing] hid, that shall not be known and come abroad.

label: Luke
text: Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have.

label: Luke
text: Then came to him [his] mother and his brethren, and could not come at him for the press.

label: Luke
text: And it was told him [by certain] which said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.

label: Luke
text: And he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.

label: Luke
text: Now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake.

label: Luke
text: And they launched forth.

label: Luke
text: But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled [with water], and were in jeopardy.

label: Luke
text: And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish.

label: Luke
text: Then he arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Where is your faith?

label: Luke
text: And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this!

label: Luke
text: for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.

label: Luke
text: And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.

label: Luke
text: And when he went forth to land, there met him out of the city a certain man, which had devils long time, and ware no clothes, neither abode in [any] house, but in the tombs.

label: Luke
text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, [thou] Son of God most high?

label: Luke
text: I beseech thee, torment me not.

label: Luke
text: (For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man.

label: Luke
text: For oftentimes it had caught him: and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and was driven of the devil into the wilderness.)

label: Luke
text: And Jesus asked him, saying, What is thy name?

label: Luke
text: And he said, Legion: because many devils were entered into him.

label: Luke
text: And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep.

label: Luke
text: And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them.

label: Luke
text: And he suffered them.

label: Luke
text: Then went the devils out of the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake, and were choked.

label: Luke
text: When they that fed [them] saw what was done, they fled, and went and told [it] in the city and in the country.

label: Luke
text: Then they went out to see what was done; and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.

label: Luke
text: They also which saw [it] told them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed.

label: Luke
text: Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great fear: and he went up into the ship, and returned back again.

label: Luke
text: Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him: but Jesus sent him away, saying,

label: Luke
text: Return to thine own house, and shew how great things God hath done unto thee.

label: Luke
text: And he went his way, and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the people [gladly] received him: for they were all waiting for him.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus’ feet, and besought him that he would come into his house:

label: Luke
text: For he had one only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying.

label: Luke
text: But as he went the people thronged him.

label: Luke
text: And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, which had spent all her living upon physicians, neither could be healed of any,

label: Luke
text: Came behind [him], and touched the border of his garment: and immediately her issue of blood stanched.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said, Who touched me?

label: Luke
text: When all denied, Peter and they that were with him said, Master, the multitude throng thee and press [thee], and sayest thou, Who touched me?

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said, Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.

label: Luke
text: And when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him, she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto her, Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.

label: Luke
text: While he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue’s [house], saying to him, Thy daughter is dead; trouble not the Master.

label: Luke
text: But when Jesus heard [it], he answered him, saying, Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole.

label: Luke
text: And when he came into the house, he suffered no man to go in, save Peter, and James, and John, and the father and the mother of the maiden.

label: Luke
text: And all wept, and bewailed her: but he said, Weep not; she is not dead, but sleepeth.

label: Luke
text: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.

label: Luke
text: And he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying, Maid, arise.

label: Luke
text: And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.

label: Luke
text: And her parents were astonished: but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done.

label: Luke
text: Then he called his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.

label: Luke
text: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Take nothing for [your] journey, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two coats apiece.

label: Luke
text: And whatsoever house ye enter into, there abide, and thence depart.

label: Luke
text: And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.

label: Luke
text: And they departed, and went through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing every where.

label: Luke
text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him: and he was perplexed, because that it was said of some, that John was risen from the dead;

label: Luke
text: And of some, that Elias had appeared; and of others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.

label: Luke
text: And Herod said, John have I beheaded: but who is this, of whom I hear such things?

label: Luke
text: And he desired to see him.

label: Luke
text: And the apostles, when they were returned, told him all that they had done.

label: Luke
text: And he took them, and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.

label: Luke
text: And the people, when they knew [it], followed him: and he received them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of God, and healed them that had need of healing.

label: Luke
text: And when the day began to wear away, then came the twelve, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the towns and country round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are here in a desert place.

label: Luke
text: But he said unto them, Give ye them to eat.

label: Luke
text: And they said, We have no more but five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy meat for all this people.

label: Luke
text: For they were about five thousand men.

label: Luke
text: And he said to his disciples, Make them sit down by fifties in a company.

label: Luke
text: And they did so, and made them all sit down.

label: Luke
text: Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, and brake, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.

label: Luke
text: And they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Whom say the people that I am?

label: Luke
text: They answering said, John the Baptist; but some [say], Elias; and others [say], that one of the old prophets is risen again.

label: Luke
text: He said unto them, But whom say ye that I am?

label: Luke
text: Peter answering said, The Christ of God.

label: Luke
text: And he straitly charged them, and commanded [them] to tell no man that thing;

label: Luke
text: Saying, The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be slain, and be raised the third day.

label: Luke
text: And he said to [them] all, If any [man] will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.

label: Luke
text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.

label: Luke
text: For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and lose himself, or be cast away?

label: Luke
text: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his own glory, and [in his] Father’s, and of the holy angels.

label: Luke
text: But I tell you of a truth, there be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings, he took Peter and John and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.

label: Luke
text: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment [was] white [and] glistering.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elias:

label: Luke
text: Who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.

label: Luke
text: While he thus spake, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.

label: Luke
text: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.

label: Luke
text: And when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone.

label: Luke
text: And they kept [it] close, and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, a man of the company cried out, saying, Master, I beseech thee, look upon my son: for he is mine only child.

label: Luke
text: And, lo, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenly crieth out; and it teareth him that he foameth again, and bruising him hardly departeth from him.

label: Luke
text: And I besought thy disciples to cast him out; and they could not.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you, and suffer you?

label: Luke
text: Bring thy son hither.

label: Luke
text: And as he was yet a coming, the devil threw him down, and tare [him].

label: Luke
text: And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him again to his father.

label: Luke
text: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God.

label: Luke
text: But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,

label: Luke
text: Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.

label: Luke
text: But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.

label: Luke
text: Then there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,

label: Luke
text: And said unto them, Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the same shall be great.

label: Luke
text: And John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name; and we forbad him, because he followeth not with us.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto him, Forbid [him] not: for he that is not against us is for us.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, when the time was come that he should be received up, he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,

label: Luke
text: And sent messengers before his face: and they went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.

label: Luke
text: And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: And when his disciples James and John saw [this], they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them, even as Elias did?

label: Luke
text: But he turned, and rebuked them, and said, Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.

label: Luke
text: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men’s lives, but to save [them].

label: Luke
text: And they went to another village.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certain [man] said unto him, Lord, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto him, Foxes have holes, and birds of the air [have] nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay [his] head.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto another, Follow me.

label: Luke
text: But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.

label: Luke
text: Jesus said unto him, Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: And another also said, Lord, I will follow thee; but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place, whither he himself would come.

label: Luke
text: Therefore said he unto them, The harvest truly [is] great, but the labourers [are] few: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth labourers into his harvest.

label: Luke
text: Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.

label: Luke
text: Carry neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salute no man by the way.

label: Luke
text: And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace [be] to this house.

label: Luke
text: And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: if not, it shall turn to you again.

label: Luke
text: And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the labourer is worthy of his hire.

label: Luke
text: Go not from house to house.

label: Luke
text: And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you:

label: Luke
text: And heal the sick that are therein, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

label: Luke
text: But into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you not, go your ways out into the streets of the same, and say,

label: Luke
text: Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

label: Luke
text: But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.

label: Luke
text: Woe unto thee, Chorazin!

label: Luke
text: woe unto thee, Bethsaida!

label: Luke
text: for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

label: Luke
text: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment, than for you.

label: Luke
text: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted to heaven, shalt be thrust down to hell.

label: Luke
text: He that heareth you heareth me; and he that despiseth you despiseth me; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me.

label: Luke
text: And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.

label: Luke
text: Behold, I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall by any means hurt you.

label: Luke
text: Notwithstanding in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subject unto you; but rather rejoice, because your names are written in heaven.

label: Luke
text: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit, and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes: even so, Father; for so it seemed good in thy sight.

label: Luke
text: All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the Son is, but the Father; and who the Father is, but the Son, and [he] to whom the Son will reveal [him].

label: Luke
text: And he turned him unto [his] disciples, and said privately, Blessed [are] the eyes which see the things that ye see:

label: Luke
text: For I tell you, that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen [them]; and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard [them].

label: Luke
text: And, behold, a certain lawyer stood up, and tempted him, saying, Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

label: Luke
text: He said unto him, What is written in the law?

label: Luke
text: how readest thou?

label: Luke
text: And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.

label: Luke
text: But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering said, A certain [man] went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, which stripped him of his raiment, and wounded [him], and departed, leaving [him] half dead.

label: Luke
text: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

label: Luke
text: And likewise a Levite, when he was at the place, came and looked [on him], and passed by on the other side.

label: Luke
text: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion [on him],

label: Luke
text: And went to [him], and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine, and set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

label: Luke
text: And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and gave [them] to the host, and said unto him, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.

label: Luke
text: Which now of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves?

label: Luke
text: And he said, He that shewed mercy on him.

label: Luke
text: Then said Jesus unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.

label: Luke
text: Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

label: Luke
text: And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard his word.

label: Luke
text: But Martha was cumbered about much serving, and came to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone?

label: Luke
text: bid her therefore that she help me.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answered and said unto her, Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things:

label: Luke
text: But one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

label: Luke
text: Thy kingdom come.

label: Luke
text: Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.

label: Luke
text: Give us day by day our daily bread.

label: Luke
text: And forgive us our sins; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us.

label: Luke
text: And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;

label: Luke
text: For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?

label: Luke
text: And he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.

label: Luke
text: I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.

label: Luke
text: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

label: Luke
text: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

label: Luke
text: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone?

label: Luke
text: or if [he ask] a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?

label: Luke
text: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?

label: Luke
text: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shall [your] heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?

label: Luke
text: And he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.

label: Luke
text: But some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.

label: Luke
text: And others, tempting [him], sought of him a sign from heaven.

label: Luke
text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house [divided] against a house falleth.

label: Luke
text: If Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand?

label: Luke
text: because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub.

label: Luke
text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons cast [them] out?

label: Luke
text: therefore shall they be your judges.

label: Luke
text: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils, no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you.

label: Luke
text: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:

label: Luke
text: But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.

label: Luke
text: He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.

label: Luke
text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.

label: Luke
text: And when he cometh, he findeth [it] swept and garnished.

label: Luke
text: Then goeth he, and taketh [to him] seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last [state] of that man is worse than the first.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed [is] the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.

label: Luke
text: But he said, Yea rather, blessed [are] they that hear the word of God, and keep it.

label: Luke
text: And when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say, This is an evil generation: they seek a sign; and there shall no sign be given it, but the sign of Jonas the prophet.

label: Luke
text: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.

label: Luke
text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them: for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon [is] here.

label: Luke
text: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas [is] here.

label: Luke
text: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, putteth [it] in a secret place, neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they which come in may see the light.

label: Luke
text: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when [thine eye] is evil, thy body also [is] full of darkness.

label: Luke
text: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.

label: Luke
text: If thy whole body therefore [be] full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light.

label: Luke
text: And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.

label: Luke
text: And when the Pharisee saw [it], he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.

label: Luke
text: And the Lord said unto him, Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.

label: Luke
text: [Ye] fools, did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also?

label: Luke
text: But rather give alms of such things as ye have; and, behold, all things are clean unto you.

label: Luke
text: But woe unto you, Pharisees!

label: Luke
text: for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

label: Luke
text: Woe unto you, Pharisees!

label: Luke
text: for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues, and greetings in the markets.

label: Luke
text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!

label: Luke
text: for ye are as graves which appear not, and the men that walk over [them] are not aware [of them].

label: Luke
text: Then answered one of the lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou reproachest us also.

label: Luke
text: And he said, Woe unto you also, [ye] lawyers!

label: Luke
text: for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.

label: Luke
text: Woe unto you!

label: Luke
text: for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

label: Luke
text: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.

label: Luke
text: Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send them prophets and apostles, and [some] of them they shall slay and persecute:

label: Luke
text: That the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

label: Luke
text: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.

label: Luke
text: Woe unto you, lawyers!

label: Luke
text: for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.

label: Luke
text: And as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge [him] vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:

label: Luke
text: Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.

label: Luke
text: In the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

label: Luke
text: For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.

label: Luke
text: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.

label: Luke
text: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.

label: Luke
text: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.

label: Luke
text: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?

label: Luke
text: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

label: Luke
text: Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.

label: Luke
text: Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:

label: Luke
text: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.

label: Luke
text: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.

label: Luke
text: And when they bring you unto the synagogues, and [unto] magistrates, and powers, take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:

label: Luke
text: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.

label: Luke
text: And one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man’s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.

label: Luke
text: And he spake a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:

label: Luke
text: And he thought within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?

label: Luke
text: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.

label: Luke
text: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink, [and] be merry.

label: Luke
text: But God said unto him, [Thou] fool, this night thy soul shall be required of thee: then whose shall those things be, which thou hast provided?

label: Luke
text: So [is] he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.

label: Luke
text: The life is more than meat, and the body [is more] than raiment.

label: Luke
text: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?

label: Luke
text: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?

label: Luke
text: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?

label: Luke
text: Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

label: Luke
text: If then God so clothe the grass, which is to day in the field, and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much more [will he clothe] you, O ye of little faith?

label: Luke
text: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.

label: Luke
text: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.

label: Luke
text: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God; and all these things shall be added unto you.

label: Luke
text: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

label: Luke
text: Sell that ye have, and give alms; provide yourselves bags which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.

label: Luke
text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

label: Luke
text: Let your loins be girded about, and [your] lights burning;

label: Luke
text: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord, when he will return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.

label: Luke
text: Blessed [are] those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.

label: Luke
text: And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and find [them] so, blessed are those servants.

label: Luke
text: And this know, that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched, and not have suffered his house to be broken through.

label: Luke
text: Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.

label: Luke
text: Then Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?

label: Luke
text: And the Lord said, Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom [his] lord shall make ruler over his household, to give [them their] portion of meat in due season?

label: Luke
text: Blessed [is] that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

label: Luke
text: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.

label: Luke
text: But and if that servant say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;

label: Luke
text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for [him], and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.

label: Luke
text: And that servant, which knew his lord’s will, and prepared not [himself], neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many [stripes].

label: Luke
text: But he that knew not, and did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few [stripes].

label: Luke
text: For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.

label: Luke
text: I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be already kindled?

label: Luke
text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!

label: Luke
text: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth?

label: Luke
text: I tell you, Nay; but rather division:

label: Luke
text: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.

label: Luke
text: The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother in law against her daughter in law, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.

label: Luke
text: And he said also to the people, When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it is.

label: Luke
text: And when [ye see] the south wind blow, ye say, There will be heat; and it cometh to pass.

label: Luke
text: [Ye] hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth; but how is it that ye do not discern this time?

label: Luke
text: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?

label: Luke
text: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate, [as thou art] in the way, give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him; lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.

label: Luke
text: I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the very last mite.

label: Luke
text: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering said unto them, Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans, because they suffered such things?

label: Luke
text: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

label: Luke
text: Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and slew them, think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem?

label: Luke
text: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

label: Luke
text: He spake also this parable; A certain [man] had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.

label: Luke
text: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard, Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none: cut it down; why cumbereth it the ground?

label: Luke
text: And he answering said unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dung [it]:

label: Luke
text: And if it bear fruit, [well]: and if not, [then] after that thou shalt cut it down.

label: Luke
text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could in no wise lift up [herself].

label: Luke
text: And when Jesus saw her, he called [her to him], and said unto her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.

label: Luke
text: And he laid [his] hands on her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.

label: Luke
text: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day, and said unto the people, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the sabbath day.

label: Luke
text: The Lord then answered him, and said, [Thou] hypocrite, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or [his] ass from the stall, and lead [him] away to watering?

label: Luke
text: And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?

label: Luke
text: And when he had said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed: and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.

label: Luke
text: Then said he, Unto what is the kingdom of God like?

label: Luke
text: and whereunto shall I resemble it?

label: Luke
text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his garden; and it grew, and waxed a great tree; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it.

label: Luke
text: And again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?

label: Luke
text: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.

label: Luke
text: And he went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: Then said one unto him, Lord, are there few that be saved?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them,

label: Luke
text: Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.

label: Luke
text: When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence ye are:

label: Luke
text: Then shall ye begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and thou hast taught in our streets.

label: Luke
text: But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, all [ye] workers of iniquity.

label: Luke
text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and you [yourselves] thrust out.

label: Luke
text: And they shall come from the east, and [from] the west, and from the north, and [from] the south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.

label: Luke
text: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto him, Get thee out, and depart hence: for Herod will kill thee.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Go ye, and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and I do cures to day and to morrow, and the third [day] I shall be perfected.

label: Luke
text: Nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and the [day] following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the prophets, and stonest them that are sent unto thee; how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hen [doth gather] her brood under [her] wings, and ye would not!

label: Luke
text: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and verily I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until [the time] come when ye shall say, Blessed [is] he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day, that they watched him.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?

label: Luke
text: And they held their peace.

label: Luke
text: And he took [him], and healed him, and let him go;

label: Luke
text: And answered them, saying, Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day?

label: Luke
text: And they could not answer him again to these things.

label: Luke
text: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms; saying unto them,

label: Luke
text: When thou art bidden of any [man] to a wedding, sit not down in the highest room; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him;

label: Luke
text: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, Give this man place; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room.

label: Luke
text: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room; that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee.

label: Luke
text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

label: Luke
text: Then said he also to him that bade him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, nor [thy] rich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again, and a recompence be made thee.

label: Luke
text: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:

label: Luke
text: And thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.

label: Luke
text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed [is] he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: Then said he unto him, A certain man made a great supper, and bade many:

label: Luke
text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.

label: Luke
text: And they all with one [consent] began to make excuse.

label: Luke
text: The first said unto him, I have bought a piece of ground, and I must needs go and see it: I pray thee have me excused.

label: Luke
text: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.

label: Luke
text: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.

label: Luke
text: So that servant came, and shewed his lord these things.

label: Luke
text: Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.

label: Luke
text: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.

label: Luke
text: And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel [them] to come in, that my house may be filled.

label: Luke
text: For I say unto you, That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.

label: Luke
text: And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,

label: Luke
text: If any [man] come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.

label: Luke
text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.

label: Luke
text: For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have [sufficient] to finish [it]?

label: Luke
text: Lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to finish [it], all that behold [it] begin to mock him,

label: Luke
text: Saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.

label: Luke
text: Or what king, going to make war against another king, sitteth not down first, and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?

label: Luke
text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth conditions of peace.

label: Luke
text: So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.

label: Luke
text: Salt [is] good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?

label: Luke
text: It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill; [but] men cast it out.

label: Luke
text: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

label: Luke
text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.

label: Luke
text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.

label: Luke
text: And he spake this parable unto them, saying,

label: Luke
text: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?

label: Luke
text: And when he hath found [it], he layeth [it] on his shoulders, rejoicing.

label: Luke
text: And when he cometh home, he calleth together [his] friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.

label: Luke
text: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.

label: Luke
text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she find [it]?

label: Luke
text: And when she hath found [it], she calleth [her] friends and [her] neighbours together, saying, Rejoice with me; for I have found the piece which I had lost.

label: Luke
text: Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.

label: Luke
text: And he said, A certain man had two sons:

label: Luke
text: And the younger of them said to [his] father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth [to me].

label: Luke
text: And he divided unto them [his] living.

label: Luke
text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.

label: Luke
text: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.

label: Luke
text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.

label: Luke
text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.

label: Luke
text: And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!

label: Luke
text: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,

label: Luke
text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

label: Luke
text: And he arose, and came to his father.

label: Luke
text: But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

label: Luke
text: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.

label: Luke
text: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put [it] on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on [his] feet:

label: Luke
text: And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill [it]; and let us eat, and be merry:

label: Luke
text: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found.

label: Luke
text: And they began to be merry.

label: Luke
text: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.

label: Luke
text: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.

label: Luke
text: And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.

label: Luke
text: And he answering said to [his] father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:

label: Luke
text: But as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.

label: Luke
text: It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.

label: Luke
text: And he said also unto his disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.

label: Luke
text: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee?

label: Luke
text: give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.

label: Luke
text: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do?

label: Luke
text: for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.

label: Luke
text: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

label: Luke
text: So he called every one of his lord’s debtors [unto him], and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?

label: Luke
text: And he said, An hundred measures of oil.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.

label: Luke
text: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou?

label: Luke
text: And he said, An hundred measures of wheat.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.

label: Luke
text: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.

label: Luke
text: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.

label: Luke
text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.

label: Luke
text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true [riches]?

label: Luke
text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man’s, who shall give you that which is your own?

label: Luke
text: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other.

label: Luke
text: Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

label: Luke
text: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.

label: Luke
text: The law and the prophets [were] until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.

label: Luke
text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.

label: Luke
text: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from [her] husband committeth adultery.

label: Luke
text: There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:

label: Luke
text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,

label: Luke
text: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man’s table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham’s bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;

label: Luke
text: And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.

label: Luke
text: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.

label: Luke
text: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.

label: Luke
text: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that [would come] from thence.

label: Luke
text: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house:

label: Luke
text: For I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.

label: Luke
text: Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.

label: Luke
text: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.

label: Luke
text: Then said he unto the disciples, It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe [unto him], through whom they come!

label: Luke
text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.

label: Luke
text: Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.

label: Luke
text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.

label: Luke
text: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.

label: Luke
text: And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.

label: Luke
text: But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?

label: Luke
text: And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?

label: Luke
text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him?

label: Luke
text: I trow not.

label: Luke
text: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

label: Luke
text: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:

label: Luke
text: And they lifted up [their] voices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.

label: Luke
text: And when he saw [them], he said unto them, Go shew yourselves unto the priests.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, as they went, they were cleansed.

label: Luke
text: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,

label: Luke
text: And fell down on [his] face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed?

label: Luke
text: but where [are] the nine?

label: Luke
text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.

label: Luke
text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:

label: Luke
text: Neither shall they say, Lo here!

label: Luke
text: or, lo there!

label: Luke
text: for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see [it].

label: Luke
text: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not after [them], nor follow [them].

label: Luke
text: For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one [part] under heaven, shineth unto the other [part] under heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day.

label: Luke
text: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.

label: Luke
text: And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.

label: Luke
text: They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

label: Luke
text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;

label: Luke
text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed [them] all.

label: Luke
text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.

label: Luke
text: In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back.

label: Luke
text: Remember Lot’s wife.

label: Luke
text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.

label: Luke
text: I tell you, in that night there shall be two [men] in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.

label: Luke
text: Two [women] shall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

label: Luke
text: Two [men] shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

label: Luke
text: And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body [is], thither will the eagles be gathered together.

label: Luke
text: And he spake a parable unto them [to this end], that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;

label: Luke
text: Saying, There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:

label: Luke
text: And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

label: Luke
text: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;

label: Luke
text: Yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.

label: Luke
text: And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge saith.

label: Luke
text: And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day and night unto him, though he bear long with them?

label: Luke
text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily.

label: Luke
text: Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?

label: Luke
text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:

label: Luke
text: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

label: Luke
text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men [are], extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

label: Luke
text: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.

label: Luke
text: And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as [his] eyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.

label: Luke
text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified [rather] than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

label: Luke
text: And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but when [his] disciples saw [it], they rebuked them.

label: Luke
text: But Jesus called them [unto him], and said, Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.

label: Luke
text: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good?

label: Luke
text: none [is] good, save one, [that is], God.

label: Luke
text: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.

label: Luke
text: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

label: Luke
text: Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

label: Luke
text: And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.

label: Luke
text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

label: Luke
text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: And they that heard [it] said, Who then can be saved?

label: Luke
text: And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

label: Luke
text: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God’s sake,

label: Luke
text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

label: Luke
text: Then he took [unto him] the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.

label: Luke
text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:

label: Luke
text: And they shall scourge [him], and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.

label: Luke
text: And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:

label: Luke
text: And hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.

label: Luke
text: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.

label: Luke
text: And he cried, saying, Jesus, [thou] Son of David, have mercy on me.

label: Luke
text: And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, [Thou] Son of David, have mercy on me.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,

label: Luke
text: Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee?

label: Luke
text: And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.

label: Luke
text: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw [it], gave praise unto God.

label: Luke
text: And [Jesus] entered and passed through Jericho.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, [there was] a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.

label: Luke
text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the press, because he was little of stature.

label: Luke
text: And he ran before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass that [way].
