label: Luke
text: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him, Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.

label: Luke
text: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.

label: Luke
text: And when they saw [it], they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.

label: Luke
text: And Zacchaeus stood, and said unto the Lord; Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restore [him] fourfold.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto him, This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.

label: Luke
text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.

label: Luke
text: And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear.

label: Luke
text: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

label: Luke
text: And he called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pounds, and said unto them, Occupy till I come.

label: Luke
text: But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, We will not have this [man] to reign over us.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that when he was returned, having received the kingdom, then he commanded these servants to be called unto him, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.

label: Luke
text: Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Well, thou good servant: because thou hast been faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.

label: Luke
text: And the second came, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained five pounds.

label: Luke
text: And he said likewise to him, Be thou also over five cities.

label: Luke
text: And another came, saying, Lord, behold, [here is] thy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:

label: Luke
text: For I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.

label: Luke
text: And he saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, [thou] wicked servant.

label: Luke
text: Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow:

label: Luke
text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them that stood by, Take from him the pound, and give [it] to him that hath ten pounds.

label: Luke
text: (And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.)

label: Luke
text: For I say unto you, That unto every one which hath shall be given; and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away from him.

label: Luke
text: But those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay [them] before me.

label: Luke
text: And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up to Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount called [the mount] of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,

label: Luke
text: Saying, Go ye into the village over against [you]; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied, whereon yet never man sat: loose him, and bring [him hither].

label: Luke
text: And if any man ask you, Why do ye loose [him]?

label: Luke
text: thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.

label: Luke
text: And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.

label: Luke
text: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?

label: Luke
text: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.

label: Luke
text: And they brought him to Jesus: and they cast their garments upon the colt, and they set Jesus thereon.

label: Luke
text: And as he went, they spread their clothes in the way.

label: Luke
text: And when he was come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen;

label: Luke
text: Saying, Blessed [be] the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.

label: Luke
text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.

label: Luke
text: And he answered and said unto them, I tell you that, if these should hold their peace, the stones would immediately cry out.

label: Luke
text: And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,

label: Luke
text: Saying, If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things [which belong] unto thy peace!

label: Luke
text: but now they are hid from thine eyes.

label: Luke
text: For the days shall come upon thee, that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,

label: Luke
text: And shall lay thee even with the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.

label: Luke
text: And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought;

label: Luke
text: Saying unto them, It is written, My house is the house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of thieves.

label: Luke
text: And he taught daily in the temple.

label: Luke
text: But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him,

label: Luke
text: And could not find what they might do: for all the people were very attentive to hear him.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, [that] on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon [him] with the elders,

label: Luke
text: And spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things?

label: Luke
text: or who is he that gave thee this authority?

label: Luke
text: And he answered and said unto them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:

label: Luke
text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?

label: Luke
text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?

label: Luke
text: But and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.

label: Luke
text: And they answered, that they could not tell whence [it was].

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

label: Luke
text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable; A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a far country for a long time.

label: Luke
text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent [him] away empty.

label: Luke
text: And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreated [him] shamefully, and sent [him] away empty.

label: Luke
text: And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and cast [him] out.

label: Luke
text: Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do?

label: Luke
text: I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence [him] when they see him.

label: Luke
text: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.

label: Luke
text: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed [him].

label: Luke
text: What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?

label: Luke
text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others.

label: Luke
text: And when they heard [it], they said, God forbid.

label: Luke
text: And he beheld them, and said, What is this then that is written, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner?

label: Luke
text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

label: Luke
text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.

label: Luke
text: And they watched [him], and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.

label: Luke
text: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person [of any], but teachest the way of God truly:

label: Luke
text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or no?

label: Luke
text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me?

label: Luke
text: Shew me a penny.

label: Luke
text: Whose image and superscription hath it?

label: Luke
text: They answered and said, Caesar’s.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar’s, and unto God the things which be God’s.

label: Luke
text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.

label: Luke
text: Then came to [him] certain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,

label: Luke
text: Saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man’s brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

label: Luke
text: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.

label: Luke
text: And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.

label: Luke
text: And the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.

label: Luke
text: Last of all the woman died also.

label: Luke
text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she?

label: Luke
text: for seven had her to wife.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answering said unto them, The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:

label: Luke
text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:

label: Luke
text: Neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.

label: Luke
text: Now that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

label: Luke
text: For he is not a God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.

label: Luke
text: Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.

label: Luke
text: And after that they durst not ask him any [question at all].

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, How say they that Christ is David’s son?

label: Luke
text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

label: Luke
text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

label: Luke
text: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?

label: Luke
text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,

label: Luke
text: Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and the chief rooms at feasts;

label: Luke
text: Which devour widows’ houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive greater damnation.

label: Luke
text: And he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.

label: Luke
text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.

label: Luke
text: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:

label: Luke
text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.

label: Luke
text: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,

label: Luke
text: [As for] these things which ye behold, the days will come, in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

label: Luke
text: And they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be?

label: Luke
text: and what sign [will there be] when these things shall come to pass?

label: Luke
text: And he said, Take heed that ye be not deceived: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am [Christ]; and the time draweth near: go ye not therefore after them.

label: Luke
text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions, be not terrified: for these things must first come to pass; but the end [is] not by and by.

label: Luke
text: Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:

label: Luke
text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places, and famines, and pestilences; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven.

label: Luke
text: But before all these, they shall lay their hands on you, and persecute [you], delivering [you] up to the synagogues, and into prisons, being brought before kings and rulers for my name’s sake.

label: Luke
text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony.

label: Luke
text: Settle [it] therefore in your hearts, not to meditate before what ye shall answer:

label: Luke
text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist.

label: Luke
text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolks, and friends; and [some] of you shall they cause to be put to death.

label: Luke
text: And ye shall be hated of all [men] for my name’s sake.

label: Luke
text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish.

label: Luke
text: In your patience possess ye your souls.

label: Luke
text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that the desolation thereof is nigh.

label: Luke
text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto.

label: Luke
text: For these be the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

label: Luke
text: But woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck, in those days!

label: Luke
text: for there shall be great distress in the land, and wrath upon this people.

label: Luke
text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and shall be led away captive into all nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled.

label: Luke
text: And there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, with perplexity; the sea and the waves roaring;

label: Luke
text: Men’s hearts failing them for fear, and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth: for the powers of heaven shall be shaken.

label: Luke
text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

label: Luke
text: And when these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads; for your redemption draweth nigh.

label: Luke
text: And he spake to them a parable; Behold the fig tree, and all the trees;

label: Luke
text: When they now shoot forth, ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand.

label: Luke
text: So likewise ye, when ye see these things come to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand.

label: Luke
text: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.

label: Luke
text: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

label: Luke
text: And take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and [so] that day come upon you unawares.

label: Luke
text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth.

label: Luke
text: Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.

label: Luke
text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at night he went out, and abode in the mount that is called [the mount] of Olives.

label: Luke
text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.

label: Luke
text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.

label: Luke
text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.

label: Luke
text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.

label: Luke
text: And he went his way, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray him unto them.

label: Luke
text: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.

label: Luke
text: And he promised, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude.

label: Luke
text: Then came the day of unleavened bread, when the passover must be killed.

label: Luke
text: And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and prepare us the passover, that we may eat.

label: Luke
text: And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.

label: Luke
text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house, The Master saith unto thee, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?

label: Luke
text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished: there make ready.

label: Luke
text: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

label: Luke
text: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:

label: Luke
text: For I say unto you, I will not any more eat thereof, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, Take this, and divide [it] among yourselves:

label: Luke
text: For I say unto you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.

label: Luke
text: And he took bread, and gave thanks, and brake [it], and gave unto them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.

label: Luke
text: Likewise also the cup after supper, saying, This cup [is] the new testament in my blood, which is shed for you.

label: Luke
text: But, behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me [is] with me on the table.

label: Luke
text: And truly the Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!

label: Luke
text: And they began to inquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.

label: Luke
text: And there was also a strife among them, which of them should be accounted the greatest.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors.

label: Luke
text: But ye [shall] not [be] so: but he that is greatest among you, let him be as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.

label: Luke
text: For whether [is] greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth?

label: Luke
text: [is] not he that sitteth at meat?

label: Luke
text: but I am among you as he that serveth.

label: Luke
text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations.

label: Luke
text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me;

label: Luke
text: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

label: Luke
text: And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desired [to have] you, that he may sift [you] as wheat:

label: Luke
text: But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison, and to death.

label: Luke
text: And he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, When I sent you without purse, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye any thing?

label: Luke
text: And they said, Nothing.

label: Luke
text: Then said he unto them, But now, he that hath a purse, let him take [it], and likewise [his] scrip: and he that hath no sword, let him sell his garment, and buy one.

label: Luke
text: For I say unto you, that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me, And he was reckoned among the transgressors: for the things concerning me have an end.

label: Luke
text: And they said, Lord, behold, here [are] two swords.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, It is enough.

label: Luke
text: And he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.

label: Luke
text: And when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation.

label: Luke
text: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone’s cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,

label: Luke
text: Saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.

label: Luke
text: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.

label: Luke
text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.

label: Luke
text: And when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,

label: Luke
text: And said unto them, Why sleep ye?

label: Luke
text: rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.

label: Luke
text: And while he yet spake, behold a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them, and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.

label: Luke
text: But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?

label: Luke
text: When they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?

label: Luke
text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus answered and said, Suffer ye thus far.

label: Luke
text: And he touched his ear, and healed him.

label: Luke
text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and the elders, which were come to him, Be ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and staves?

label: Luke
text: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.

label: Luke
text: Then took they him, and led [him], and brought him into the high priest’s house.

label: Luke
text: And Peter followed afar off.

label: Luke
text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.

label: Luke
text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and earnestly looked upon him, and said, This man was also with him.

label: Luke
text: And he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.

label: Luke
text: And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou art also of them.

label: Luke
text: And Peter said, Man, I am not.

label: Luke
text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this [fellow] also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.

label: Luke
text: And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest.

label: Luke
text: And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.

label: Luke
text: And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter.

label: Luke
text: And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

label: Luke
text: And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.

label: Luke
text: And the men that held Jesus mocked him, and smote [him].

label: Luke
text: And when they had blindfolded him, they struck him on the face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy, who is it that smote thee?

label: Luke
text: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him.

label: Luke
text: And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together, and led him into their council, saying,

label: Luke
text: Art thou the Christ?

label: Luke
text: tell us.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, If I tell you, ye will not believe:

label: Luke
text: And if I also ask [you], ye will not answer me, nor let [me] go.

label: Luke
text: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God.

label: Luke
text: Then said they all, Art thou then the Son of God?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Ye say that I am.

label: Luke
text: And they said, What need we any further witness?

label: Luke
text: for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth.

label: Luke
text: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.

label: Luke
text: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this [fellow] perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ a King.

label: Luke
text: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews?

label: Luke
text: And he answered him and said, Thou sayest [it].

label: Luke
text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and [to] the people, I find no fault in this man.

label: Luke
text: And they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place.

label: Luke
text: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.

label: Luke
text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.

label: Luke
text: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was desirous to see him of a long [season], because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him.

label: Luke
text: Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.

label: Luke
text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.

label: Luke
text: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought, and mocked [him], and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.

label: Luke
text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.

label: Luke
text: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

label: Luke
text: Said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examined [him] before you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:

label: Luke
text: No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.

label: Luke
text: I will therefore chastise him, and release [him].

label: Luke
text: (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)

label: Luke
text: And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this [man], and release unto us Barabbas:

label: Luke
text: (Who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)

label: Luke
text: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.

label: Luke
text: But they cried, saying, Crucify [him], crucify him.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done?

label: Luke
text: I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and let [him] go.

label: Luke
text: And they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified.

label: Luke
text: And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.

label: Luke
text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.

label: Luke
text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.

label: Luke
text: And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear [it] after Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.

label: Luke
text: But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.

label: Luke
text: For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessed [are] the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.

label: Luke
text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.

label: Luke
text: For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?

label: Luke
text: And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.

label: Luke
text: And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.

label: Luke
text: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do.

label: Luke
text: And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.

label: Luke
text: And the people stood beholding.

label: Luke
text: And the rulers also with them derided [him], saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.

label: Luke
text: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,

label: Luke
text: And saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.

label: Luke
text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

label: Luke
text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.

label: Luke
text: But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?

label: Luke
text: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.

label: Luke
text: And Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.

label: Luke
text: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.

label: Luke
text: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.

label: Luke
text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.

label: Luke
text: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.

label: Luke
text: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.

label: Luke
text: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, [there was] a man named Joseph, a counseller; [and he was] a good man, and a just:

label: Luke
text: (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) [he was] of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: This [man] went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.

label: Luke
text: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

label: Luke
text: And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.

label: Luke
text: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.

label: Luke
text: Now upon the first [day] of the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certain [others] with them.

label: Luke
text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.

label: Luke
text: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:

label: Luke
text: And as they were afraid, and bowed down [their] faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?

label: Luke
text: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,

label: Luke
text: Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

label: Luke
text: And they remembered his words,

label: Luke
text: And returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the rest.

label: Luke
text: It was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary [the mother] of James, and other [women that were] with them, which told these things unto the apostles.

label: Luke
text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.

label: Luke
text: Then arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed, wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem [about] threescore furlongs.

label: Luke
text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, while they communed [together] and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.

label: Luke
text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, What manner of communications [are] these that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?

label: Luke
text: And the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass there in these days?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, What things?

label: Luke
text: And they said unto him, Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:

label: Luke
text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.

label: Luke
text: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.

label: Luke
text: Yea, and certain women also of our company made us astonished, which were early at the sepulchre;

label: Luke
text: And when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.

label: Luke
text: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre, and found [it] even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.

label: Luke
text: Then he said unto them, O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken:

label: Luke
text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?

label: Luke
text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.

label: Luke
text: And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he made as though he would have gone further.

label: Luke
text: But they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent.

label: Luke
text: And he went in to tarry with them.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took bread, and blessed [it], and brake, and gave to them.

label: Luke
text: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.

label: Luke
text: And they said one to another, Did not our heart burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us the scriptures?

label: Luke
text: And they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,

label: Luke
text: Saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.

label: Luke
text: And they told what things [were done] in the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.

label: Luke
text: And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace [be] unto you.

label: Luke
text: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled?

label: Luke
text: and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?

label: Luke
text: Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.

label: Luke
text: And when he had thus spoken, he shewed them [his] hands and [his] feet.

label: Luke
text: And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have ye here any meat?

label: Luke
text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.

label: Luke
text: And he took [it], and did eat before them.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, These [are] the words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and [in] the prophets, and [in] the psalms, concerning me.

label: Luke
text: Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures,

label: Luke
text: And said unto them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:

label: Luke
text: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: And ye are witnesses of these things.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.

label: Luke
text: And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven.

label: Luke
text: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:

label: Luke
text: And were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God.

label: Luke
text: Amen.

label: Luke
text: The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,

label: Luke
text: Until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen:

label: Luke
text: To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God:

label: Luke
text: And, being assembled together with [them], commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which, [saith he], ye have heard of me.

label: Luke
text: For John truly baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence.

label: Luke
text: When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.

label: Luke
text: But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.

label: Luke
text: And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.

label: Luke
text: And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel;

label: Luke
text: Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven?

label: Luke
text: this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.

label: Luke
text: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Jerusalem a sabbath day’s journey.

label: Luke
text: And when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode both Peter, and James, and John, and Andrew, Philip, and Thomas, Bartholomew, and Matthew, James [the son] of Alphaeus, and Simon Zelotes, and Judas [the brother] of James.

label: Luke
text: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.

label: Luke
text: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples, and said, (the number of names together were about an hundred and twenty,)

label: Luke
text: Men [and] brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.

label: Luke
text: For he was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.

label: Luke
text: Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.

label: Luke
text: And it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem; insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, Aceldama, that is to say, The field of blood.

label: Luke
text: For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be desolate, and let no man dwell therein: and his bishoprick let another take.

label: Luke
text: Wherefore of these men which have companied with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

label: Luke
text: Beginning from the baptism of John, unto that same day that he was taken up from us, must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection.

label: Luke
text: And they appointed two, Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.

label: Luke
text: And they prayed, and said, Thou, Lord, which knowest the hearts of all [men], shew whether of these two thou hast chosen,

label: Luke
text: That he may take part of this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.

label: Luke
text: And they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

label: Luke
text: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.

label: Luke
text: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

label: Luke
text: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.

label: Luke
text: And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.

label: Luke
text: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.

label: Luke
text: Now when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language.

label: Luke
text: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilaeans?

label: Luke
text: And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?

label: Luke
text: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Judaea, and Cappadocia, in Pontus, and Asia,

label: Luke
text: Phrygia, and Pamphylia, in Egypt, and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, Jews and proselytes,

label: Luke
text: Cretes and Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God.

label: Luke
text: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?

label: Luke
text: Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.

label: Luke
text: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Judaea, and all [ye] that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words:

label: Luke
text: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is [but] the third hour of the day.

label: Luke
text: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel;

label: Luke
text: And it shall come to pass in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh: and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams:

label: Luke
text: And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy:

label: Luke
text: And I will shew wonders in heaven above, and signs in the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:

label: Luke
text: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the Lord come:

label: Luke
text: And it shall come to pass, [that] whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

label: Luke
text: Ye men of Israel, hear these words; Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know:

label: Luke
text: Him, being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye have taken, and by wicked hands have crucified and slain:

label: Luke
text: Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.

label: Luke
text: For David speaketh concerning him, I foresaw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:

label: Luke
text: Therefore did my heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope:

label: Luke
text: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

label: Luke
text: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.

label: Luke
text: Men [and] brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.

label: Luke
text: Therefore being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne;

label: Luke
text: He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ, that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption.

label: Luke
text: This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.

label: Luke
text: Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see and hear.

label: Luke
text: For David is not ascended into the heavens: but he saith himself, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

label: Luke
text: Until I make thy foes thy footstool.

label: Luke
text: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that God hath made that same Jesus, whom ye have crucified, both Lord and Christ.

label: Luke
text: Now when they heard [this], they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, Men [and] brethren, what shall we do?

label: Luke
text: Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.

label: Luke
text: For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, [even] as many as the Lord our God shall call.

label: Luke
text: And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation.

label: Luke
text: Then they that gladly received his word were baptized: and the same day there were added [unto them] about three thousand souls.

label: Luke
text: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.

label: Luke
text: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.

label: Luke
text: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;

label: Luke
text: And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all [men], as every man had need.

label: Luke
text: And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,

label: Luke
text: Praising God, and having favour with all the people.

label: Luke
text: And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.

label: Luke
text: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, [being] the ninth [hour].

label: Luke
text: And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;

label: Luke
text: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.

label: Luke
text: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.

label: Luke
text: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.

label: Luke
text: Then Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.

label: Luke
text: And he took him by the right hand, and lifted [him] up: and immediately his feet and ancle bones received strength.

label: Luke
text: And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.

label: Luke
text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:

label: Luke
text: And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.

label: Luke
text: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.

label: Luke
text: And when Peter saw [it], he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this?

label: Luke
text: or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?

label: Luke
text: The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let [him] go.

label: Luke
text: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;

label: Luke
text: And killed the Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.

label: Luke
text: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

label: Luke
text: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did [it], as [did] also your rulers.

label: Luke
text: But those things, which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.

label: Luke
text: Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;

label: Luke
text: And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:

label: Luke
text: Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.

label: Luke
text: For Moses truly said unto the fathers, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.

label: Luke
text: And it shall come to pass, [that] every soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.

label: Luke
text: Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.

label: Luke
text: Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.

label: Luke
text: Unto you first God, having raised up his Son Jesus, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.

label: Luke
text: And as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees, came upon them,

label: Luke
text: Being grieved that they taught the people, and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

label: Luke
text: And they laid hands on them, and put [them] in hold unto the next day: for it was now eventide.

label: Luke
text: Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed; and the number of the men was about five thousand.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders, and scribes,

label: Luke
text: And Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?

label: Luke
text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,

label: Luke
text: If we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man, by what means he is made whole;

label: Luke
text: Be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead, [even] by him doth this man stand here before you whole.

label: Luke
text: This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.

label: Luke
text: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.

label: Luke
text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marvelled; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And beholding the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

label: Luke
text: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,

label: Luke
text: Saying, What shall we do to these men?

label: Luke
text: for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them [is] manifest to all them that dwell in Jerusalem; and we cannot deny [it].

label: Luke
text: But that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.

label: Luke
text: And they called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.

label: Luke
text: But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God, judge ye.

label: Luke
text: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.

label: Luke
text: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people: for all [men] glorified God for that which was done.

label: Luke
text: For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.

label: Luke
text: And being let go, they went to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.

label: Luke
text: And when they heard that, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, Lord, thou [art] God, which hast made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all that in them is:

label: Luke
text: Who by the mouth of thy servant David hast said, Why did the heathen rage, and the people imagine vain things?

label: Luke
text: The kings of the earth stood up, and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord, and against his Christ.

label: Luke
text: For of a truth against thy holy child Jesus, whom thou hast anointed, both Herod, and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles, and the people of Israel, were gathered together,

label: Luke
text: For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.

label: Luke
text: And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,

label: Luke
text: By stretching forth thine hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And when they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and they spake the word of God with boldness.

label: Luke
text: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul: neither said any [of them] that ought of the things which he possessed was his own; but they had all things common.

label: Luke
text: And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus: and great grace was upon them all.

label: Luke
text: Neither was there any among them that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,

label: Luke
text: And laid [them] down at the apostles’ feet: and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.

label: Luke
text: And Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas, (which is, being interpreted, The son of consolation,) a Levite, [and] of the country of Cyprus,

label: Luke
text: Having land, sold [it], and brought the money, and laid [it] at the apostles’ feet.

label: Luke
text: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,

label: Luke
text: And kept back [part] of the price, his wife also being privy [to it], and brought a certain part, and laid [it] at the apostles’ feet.

label: Luke
text: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back [part] of the price of the land?

label: Luke
text: Whiles it remained, was it not thine own?

label: Luke
text: and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power?

label: Luke
text: why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart?

label: Luke
text: thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.

label: Luke
text: And Ananias hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.

label: Luke
text: And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried [him] out, and buried [him].

label: Luke
text: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.

label: Luke
text: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much?

label: Luke
text: And she said, Yea, for so much.

label: Luke
text: Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord?

label: Luke
text: behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband [are] at the door, and shall carry thee out.

label: Luke
text: Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying [her] forth, buried [her] by her husband.

label: Luke
text: And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.

label: Luke
text: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.

label: Luke
text: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.

label: Luke
text: And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)

label: Luke
text: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laid [them] on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.

label: Luke
text: There came also a multitude [out] of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.

label: Luke
text: Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with indignation,

label: Luke
text: And laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.

label: Luke
text: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,

label: Luke
text: Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.

label: Luke
text: And when they heard [that], they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught.

label: Luke
text: But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.

label: Luke
text: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,

label: Luke
text: Saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.

label: Luke
text: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.

label: Luke
text: Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.

label: Luke
text: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.

label: Luke
text: And when they had brought them, they set [them] before the council: and the high priest asked them,

label: Luke
text: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name?

label: Luke
text: and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.

label: Luke
text: Then Peter and the [other] apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.

label: Luke
text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.

label: Luke
text: Him hath God exalted with his right hand [to be] a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.

label: Luke
text: And we are his witnesses of these things; and [so is] also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.

label: Luke
text: When they heard [that], they were cut [to the heart], and took counsel to slay them.

label: Luke
text: Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space;

label: Luke
text: And said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.

label: Luke
text: For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.

label: Luke
text: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all, [even] as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.

label: Luke
text: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought:

label: Luke
text: But if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.

label: Luke
text: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles, and beaten [them], they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

label: Luke
text: And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.

label: Luke
text: And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.

label: Luke
text: And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.

label: Luke
text: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples [unto them], and said, It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables.

label: Luke
text: Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

label: Luke
text: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.

label: Luke
text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:

label: Luke
text: Whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laid [their] hands on them.

label: Luke
text: And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.

label: Luke
text: And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.

label: Luke
text: Then there arose certain of the synagogue, which is called [the synagogue] of the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and of Asia, disputing with Stephen.

label: Luke
text: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.

label: Luke
text: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and [against] God.

label: Luke
text: And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon [him], and caught him, and brought [him] to the council,

label: Luke
text: And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law:

label: Luke
text: For we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered us.

label: Luke
text: And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.

label: Luke
text: Then said the high priest, Are these things so?

label: Luke
text: And he said, Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charran,

label: Luke
text: And said unto him, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.

label: Luke
text: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and dwelt in Charran: and from thence, when his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell.

label: Luke
text: And he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not [so much as] to set his foot on: yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when [as yet] he had no child.

label: Luke
text: And God spake on this wise, That his seed should sojourn in a strange land; and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreat [them] evil four hundred years.

label: Luke
text: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God: and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.

label: Luke
text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and so [Abraham] begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac [begat] Jacob; and Jacob [begat] the twelve patriarchs.

label: Luke
text: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,

label: Luke
text: And delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.

label: Luke
text: Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan, and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.

label: Luke
text: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.

label: Luke
text: And at the second [time] Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph’s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.

label: Luke
text: Then sent Joseph, and called his father Jacob to [him], and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.

label: Luke
text: So Jacob went down into Egypt, and died, he, and our fathers,

label: Luke
text: And were carried over into Sychem, and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor [the father] of Sychem.

label: Luke
text: But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,

label: Luke
text: Till another king arose, which knew not Joseph.

label: Luke
text: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.

label: Luke
text: In which time Moses was born, and was exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father’s house three months:

label: Luke
text: And when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.

label: Luke
text: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.

label: Luke
text: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.

label: Luke
text: And seeing one [of them] suffer wrong, he defended [him], and avenged him that was oppressed, and smote the Egyptian:

label: Luke
text: For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them: but they understood not.

label: Luke
text: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?

label: Luke
text: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?

label: Luke
text: Wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday?

label: Luke
text: Then fled Moses at this saying, and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.

label: Luke
text: And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush.

label: Luke
text: When Moses saw [it], he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold [it], the voice of the Lord came unto him,

label: Luke
text: [Saying], I [am] the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

label: Luke
text: Then Moses trembled, and durst not behold.

label: Luke
text: Then said the Lord to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest is holy ground.

label: Luke
text: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver them.

label: Luke
text: And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.

label: Luke
text: This Moses whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge?

label: Luke
text: the same did God send [to be] a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush.

label: Luke
text: He brought them out, after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red sea, and in the wilderness forty years.

label: Luke
text: This is that Moses, which said unto the children of Israel, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear.

label: Luke
text: This is he, that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina, and [with] our fathers: who received the lively oracles to give unto us:

label: Luke
text: To whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust [him] from them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,

label: Luke
text: Saying unto Aaron, Make us gods to go before us: for [as for] this Moses, which brought us out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.

label: Luke
text: And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.

label: Luke
text: Then God turned, and gave them up to worship the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices [by the space of] forty years in the wilderness?

label: Luke
text: Yea, ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan, figures which ye made to worship them: and I will carry you away beyond Babylon.

label: Luke
text: Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto Moses, that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen.

label: Luke
text: Which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles, whom God drave out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David;

label: Luke
text: Who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.

label: Luke
text: But Solomon built him an house.

label: Luke
text: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands; as saith the prophet,

label: Luke
text: Heaven [is] my throne, and earth [is] my footstool: what house will ye build me?

label: Luke
text: saith the Lord: or what [is] the place of my rest?

label: Luke
text: Hath not my hand made all these things?

label: Luke
text: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers [did], so [do] ye.

label: Luke
text: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted?

label: Luke
text: and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers:

label: Luke
text: Who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not kept [it].

label: Luke
text: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with [their] teeth.

label: Luke
text: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,

label: Luke
text: And said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.

label: Luke
text: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,

label: Luke
text: And cast [him] out of the city, and stoned [him]: and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man’s feet, whose name was Saul.

label: Luke
text: And they stoned Stephen, calling upon [God], and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.

label: Luke
text: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge.

label: Luke
text: And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

label: Luke
text: And Saul was consenting unto his death.

label: Luke
text: And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria, except the apostles.

label: Luke
text: And devout men carried Stephen [to his burial], and made great lamentation over him.

label: Luke
text: As for Saul, he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed [them] to prison.

label: Luke
text: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.

label: Luke
text: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.

label: Luke
text: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.

label: Luke
text: For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed [with them]: and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.

label: Luke
text: And there was great joy in that city.

label: Luke
text: But there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:

label: Luke
text: To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.

label: Luke
text: And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.

label: Luke
text: But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God, and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

label: Luke
text: Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.

label: Luke
text: Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:

label: Luke
text: Who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:

label: Luke
text: (For as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)

label: Luke
text: Then laid they [their] hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.

label: Luke
text: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,

label: Luke
text: Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.

label: Luke
text: But Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.

label: Luke
text: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.

label: Luke
text: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.

label: Luke
text: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and [in] the bond of iniquity.
