label: Luke
text: Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.

label: Luke
text: And they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.

label: Luke
text: And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.

label: Luke
text: And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,

label: Luke
text: Was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.

label: Luke
text: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.

label: Luke
text: And Philip ran thither to [him], and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?

label: Luke
text: And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me?

label: Luke
text: And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.

label: Luke
text: The place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:

label: Luke
text: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation?

label: Luke
text: for his life is taken from the earth.

label: Luke
text: And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this?

label: Luke
text: of himself, or of some other man?

label: Luke
text: Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And as they went on [their] way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, [here is] water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?

label: Luke
text: And Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest.

label: Luke
text: And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.

label: Luke
text: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.

label: Luke
text: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.

label: Luke
text: But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.

label: Luke
text: And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,

label: Luke
text: And desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: And as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:

label: Luke
text: And he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

label: Luke
text: And he said, Who art thou, Lord?

label: Luke
text: And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest: [it is] hard for thee to kick against the pricks.

label: Luke
text: And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do?

label: Luke
text: And the Lord [said] unto him, Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.

label: Luke
text: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.

label: Luke
text: And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and brought [him] into Damascus.

label: Luke
text: And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.

label: Luke
text: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and to him said the Lord in a vision, Ananias.

label: Luke
text: And he said, Behold, I [am here], Lord.

label: Luke
text: And the Lord [said] unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judas for [one] called Saul, of Tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth,

label: Luke
text: And hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in, and putting [his] hand on him, that he might receive his sight.

label: Luke
text: Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem:

label: Luke
text: And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name.

label: Luke
text: But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, and kings, and the children of Israel:

label: Luke
text: For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name’s sake.

label: Luke
text: And Ananias went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, [even] Jesus, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.

label: Luke
text: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.

label: Luke
text: And when he had received meat, he was strengthened.

label: Luke
text: Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.

label: Luke
text: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.

label: Luke
text: But all that heard [him] were amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?

label: Luke
text: But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ.

label: Luke
text: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:

label: Luke
text: But their laying await was known of Saul.

label: Luke
text: And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.

label: Luke
text: Then the disciples took him by night, and let [him] down by the wall in a basket.

label: Luke
text: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.

label: Luke
text: But Barnabas took him, and brought [him] to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.

label: Luke
text: [Which] when the brethren knew, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.

label: Luke
text: Then had the churches rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria, and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout all [quarters], he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.

label: Luke
text: And there he found a certain man named AEneas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.

label: Luke
text: And Peter said unto him, AEneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed.

label: Luke
text: And he arose immediately.

label: Luke
text: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.

label: Luke
text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laid [her] in an upper chamber.

label: Luke
text: And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring [him] that he would not delay to come to them.

label: Luke
text: Then Peter arose and went with them.

label: Luke
text: When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.

label: Luke
text: But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning [him] to the body said, Tabitha, arise.

label: Luke
text: And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

label: Luke
text: And he gave her [his] hand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.

label: Luke
text: And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.

label: Luke
text: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian [band],

label: Luke
text: [A] devout [man], and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.

label: Luke
text: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.

label: Luke
text: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord?

label: Luke
text: And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.

label: Luke
text: And now send men to Joppa, and call for [one] Simon, whose surname is Peter:

label: Luke
text: He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.

label: Luke
text: And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;

label: Luke
text: And when he had declared all [these] things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.

label: Luke
text: On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:

label: Luke
text: And he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,

label: Luke
text: And saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:

label: Luke
text: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

label: Luke
text: And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.

label: Luke
text: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.

label: Luke
text: And the voice [spake] unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, [that] call not thou common.

label: Luke
text: This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.

label: Luke
text: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made inquiry for Simon’s house, and stood before the gate,

label: Luke
text: And called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.

label: Luke
text: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.

label: Luke
text: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.

label: Luke
text: Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what [is] the cause wherefore ye are come?

label: Luke
text: And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.

label: Luke
text: Then called he them in, and lodged [them].

label: Luke
text: And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.

label: Luke
text: And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea.

label: Luke
text: And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.

label: Luke
text: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped [him].

label: Luke
text: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.

label: Luke
text: And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.

label: Luke
text: Therefore came I [unto you] without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?

label: Luke
text: And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

label: Luke
text: And said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.

label: Luke
text: Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of [one] Simon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.

label: Luke
text: Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come.

label: Luke
text: Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.

label: Luke
text: Then Peter opened [his] mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:

label: Luke
text: But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.

label: Luke
text: The word which [God] sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)

label: Luke
text: That word, [I say], ye know, which was published throughout all Judaea, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;

label: Luke
text: How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.

label: Luke
text: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:

label: Luke
text: Him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;

label: Luke
text: Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, [even] to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.

label: Luke
text: And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God [to be] the Judge of quick and dead.

label: Luke
text: To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.

label: Luke
text: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.

label: Luke
text: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.

label: Luke
text: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God.

label: Luke
text: Then answered Peter,

label: Luke
text: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?

label: Luke
text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord.

label: Luke
text: Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.

label: Luke
text: And the apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

label: Luke
text: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,

label: Luke
text: Saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.

label: Luke
text: But Peter rehearsed [the matter] from the beginning, and expounded [it] by order unto them, saying,

label: Luke
text: I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:

label: Luke
text: Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

label: Luke
text: And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, Peter; slay and eat.

label: Luke
text: But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.

label: Luke
text: But the voice answered me again from heaven, What God hath cleansed, [that] call not thou common.

label: Luke
text: And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Caesarea unto me.

label: Luke
text: And the spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting.

label: Luke
text: Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man’s house:

label: Luke
text: And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;

label: Luke
text: Who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.

label: Luke
text: And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.

label: Luke
text: Then remembered I the word of the Lord, how that he said, John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.

label: Luke
text: Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as [he did] unto us, who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ; what was I, that I could withstand God?

label: Luke
text: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.

label: Luke
text: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.

label: Luke
text: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, which, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, preaching the Lord Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.

label: Luke
text: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.

label: Luke
text: Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord.

label: Luke
text: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.

label: Luke
text: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:

label: Luke
text: And when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people.

label: Luke
text: And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.

label: Luke
text: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.

label: Luke
text: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.

label: Luke
text: Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judaea:

label: Luke
text: Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.

label: Luke
text: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth [his] hands to vex certain of the church.

label: Luke
text: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.

label: Luke
text: And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also.

label: Luke
text: (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)

label: Luke
text: And when he had apprehended him, he put [him] in prison, and delivered [him] to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.

label: Luke
text: Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.

label: Luke
text: And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.

label: Luke
text: And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon [him], and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly.

label: Luke
text: And his chains fell off from [his] hands.

label: Luke
text: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals.

label: Luke
text: And so he did.

label: Luke
text: And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.

label: Luke
text: And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.

label: Luke
text: When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.

label: Luke
text: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the Lord hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and [from] all the expectation of the people of the Jews.

label: Luke
text: And when he had considered [the thing], he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.

label: Luke
text: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.

label: Luke
text: And when she knew Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.

label: Luke
text: And they said unto her, Thou art mad.

label: Luke
text: But she constantly affirmed that it was even so.

label: Luke
text: Then said they, It is his angel.

label: Luke
text: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened [the door], and saw him, they were astonished.

label: Luke
text: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison.

label: Luke
text: And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren.

label: Luke
text: And he departed, and went into another place.

label: Luke
text: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.

label: Luke
text: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that [they] should be put to death.

label: Luke
text: And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea, and [there] abode.

label: Luke
text: And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king’s chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king’s [country].

label: Luke
text: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.

label: Luke
text: And the people gave a shout, [saying, It is] the voice of a god, and not of a man.

label: Luke
text: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.

label: Luke
text: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

label: Luke
text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled [their] ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.

label: Luke
text: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

label: Luke
text: As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.

label: Luke
text: And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid [their] hands on them, they sent [them] away.

label: Luke
text: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.

label: Luke
text: And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to [their] minister.

label: Luke
text: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name [was] Barjesus:

label: Luke
text: Which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.

label: Luke
text: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.

label: Luke
text: Then Saul, (who also [is called] Paul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,

label: Luke
text: And said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, [thou] child of the devil, [thou] enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

label: Luke
text: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord [is] upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season.

label: Luke
text: And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.

label: Luke
text: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.

label: Luke
text: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.

label: Luke
text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, [Ye] men [and] brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.

label: Luke
text: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with [his] hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.

label: Luke
text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought he them out of it.

label: Luke
text: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.

label: Luke
text: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.

label: Luke
text: And after that he gave [unto them] judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.

label: Luke
text: And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.

label: Luke
text: And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David the [son] of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.

label: Luke
text: Of this man’s seed hath God according to [his] promise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:

label: Luke
text: When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

label: Luke
text: And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am?

label: Luke
text: I am not [he].

label: Luke
text: But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of [his] feet I am not worthy to loose.

label: Luke
text: Men [and] brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.

label: Luke
text: For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled [them] in condemning [him].

label: Luke
text: And though they found no cause of death [in him], yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.

label: Luke
text: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took [him] down from the tree, and laid [him] in a sepulchre.

label: Luke
text: But God raised him from the dead:

label: Luke
text: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.

label: Luke
text: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,

label: Luke
text: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

label: Luke
text: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, [now] no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of David.

label: Luke
text: Wherefore he saith also in another [psalm], Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

label: Luke
text: For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:

label: Luke
text: But he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.

label: Luke
text: Be it known unto you therefore, men [and] brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins:

label: Luke
text: And by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.

label: Luke
text: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;

label: Luke
text: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.

label: Luke
text: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.

label: Luke
text: Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.

label: Luke
text: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.

label: Luke
text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.

label: Luke
text: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.

label: Luke
text: For so hath the Lord commanded us, [saying], I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.

label: Luke
text: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.

label: Luke
text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.

label: Luke
text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.

label: Luke
text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.

label: Luke
text: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.

label: Luke
text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.

label: Luke
text: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

label: Luke
text: But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

label: Luke
text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use [them] despitefully, and to stone them,

label: Luke
text: They were ware of [it], and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:

label: Luke
text: And there they preached the gospel.

label: Luke
text: And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked:

label: Luke
text: The same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,

label: Luke
text: Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet.

label: Luke
text: And he leaped and walked.

label: Luke
text: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.

label: Luke
text: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.

label: Luke
text: Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.

label: Luke
text: [Which] when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard [of], they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,

label: Luke
text: And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things?

label: Luke
text: We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:

label: Luke
text: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.

label: Luke
text: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.

label: Luke
text: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.

label: Luke
text: And there came thither [certain] Jews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drew [him] out of the city, supposing he had been dead.

label: Luke
text: Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.

label: Luke
text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, and [to] Iconium, and Antioch,

label: Luke
text: Confirming the souls of the disciples, [and] exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.

label: Luke
text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

label: Luke
text: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:

label: Luke
text: And thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.

label: Luke
text: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.

label: Luke
text: And there they abode long time with the disciples.

label: Luke
text: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren, [and said], Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.

label: Luke
text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.

label: Luke
text: And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.

label: Luke
text: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, and [of] the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.

label: Luke
text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command [them] to keep the law of Moses.

label: Luke
text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.

label: Luke
text: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Men [and] brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.

label: Luke
text: And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as [he did] unto us;

label: Luke
text: And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.

label: Luke
text: Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

label: Luke
text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.

label: Luke
text: Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.

label: Luke
text: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Men [and] brethren, hearken unto me:

label: Luke
text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.

label: Luke
text: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,

label: Luke
text: After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up:

label: Luke
text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.

label: Luke
text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.

label: Luke
text: Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:

label: Luke
text: But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and [from] fornication, and [from] things strangled, and [from] blood.

label: Luke
text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.

label: Luke
text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; [namely], Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:

label: Luke
text: And they wrote [letters] by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren [send] greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:

label: Luke
text: Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, [Ye must] be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no [such] commandment:

label: Luke
text: It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

label: Luke
text: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Luke
text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell [you] the same things by mouth.

label: Luke
text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;

label: Luke
text: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well.

label: Luke
text: Fare ye well.

label: Luke
text: So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:

label: Luke
text: [Which] when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.

label: Luke
text: And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed [them].

label: Luke
text: And after they had tarried [there] a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.

label: Luke
text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.

label: Luke
text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.

label: Luke
text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, [and see] how they do.

label: Luke
text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.

label: Luke
text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.

label: Luke
text: And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;

label: Luke
text: And Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.

label: Luke
text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.

label: Luke
text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father [was] a Greek:

label: Luke
text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.

label: Luke
text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.

label: John
text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

label: John
text: The same was in the beginning with God.

label: John
text: All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.

label: John
text: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.

label: John
text: And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.

label: John
text: There was a man sent from God, whose name [was] John.

label: John
text: The same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all [men] through him might believe.

label: John
text: He was not that Light, but [was sent] to bear witness of that Light.

label: John
text: [That] was the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.

label: John
text: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.

label: John
text: He came unto his own, and his own received him not.

label: John
text: But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, [even] to them that believe on his name:

label: John
text: Which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

label: John
text: And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.

label: John
text: John bare witness of him, and cried, saying, This was he of whom I spake, He that cometh after me is preferred before me: for he was before me.

label: John
text: And of his fulness have all we received, and grace for grace.

label: John
text: For the law was given by Moses, [but] grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.

label: John
text: No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared [him].

label: John
text: And this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, Who art thou?

label: John
text: And he confessed, and denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ.

label: John
text: And they asked him, What then?

label: John
text: Art thou Elias?

label: John
text: And he saith, I am not.

label: John
text: Art thou that prophet?

label: John
text: And he answered, No.

label: John
text: Then said they unto him, Who art thou?

label: John
text: that we may give an answer to them that sent us.

label: John
text: What sayest thou of thyself?

label: John
text: He said, I [am] the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Esaias.

label: John
text: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees.

label: John
text: And they asked him, and said unto him, Why baptizest thou then, if thou be not that Christ, nor Elias, neither that prophet?

label: John
text: John answered them, saying, I baptize with water: but there standeth one among you, whom ye know not;

label: John
text: He it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe’s latchet I am not worthy to unloose.

label: John
text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.

label: John
text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world.

label: John
text: This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is preferred before me: for he was before me.

label: John
text: And I knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water.

label: John
text: And John bare record, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him.

label: John
text: And I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize with water, the same said unto me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost.

label: John
text: And I saw, and bare record that this is the Son of God.

label: John
text: Again the next day after John stood, and two of his disciples;

label: John
text: And looking upon Jesus as he walked, he saith, Behold the Lamb of God!

label: John
text: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.

label: John
text: Then Jesus turned, and saw them following, and saith unto them, What seek ye?

label: John
text: They said unto him, Rabbi, (which is to say, being interpreted, Master,) where dwellest thou?

label: John
text: He saith unto them, Come and see.

label: John
text: They came and saw where he dwelt, and abode with him that day: for it was about the tenth hour.

label: John
text: One of the two which heard John [speak], and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.

label: John
text: He first findeth his own brother Simon, and saith unto him, We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ.

label: John
text: And he brought him to Jesus.

label: John
text: And when Jesus beheld him, he said, Thou art Simon the son of Jona: thou shalt be called Cephas, which is by interpretation, A stone.

label: John
text: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee, and findeth Philip, and saith unto him, Follow me.

label: John
text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

label: John
text: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.

label: John
text: And Nathanael said unto him, Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth?

label: John
text: Philip saith unto him, Come and see.

label: John
text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him, Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!

label: John
text: Nathanael saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me?

label: John
text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.

label: John
text: Nathanael answered and saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.

label: John
text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, believest thou?

label: John
text: thou shalt see greater things than these.

label: John
text: And he saith unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.

label: John
text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:

label: John
text: And both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.

label: John
text: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee?

label: John
text: mine hour is not yet come.

label: John
text: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do [it].

label: John
text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water.

label: John
text: And they filled them up to the brim.

label: John
text: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast.

label: John
text: And they bare [it].

label: John
text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,

label: John
text: And saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: [but] thou hast kept the good wine until now.

label: John
text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.

label: John
text: After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.

label: John
text: And the Jews’ passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,

label: John
text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:

label: John
text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew the tables;

label: John
text: And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father’s house an house of merchandise.

label: John
text: And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.

label: John
text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?

label: John
text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.

label: John
text: Then said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?

label: John
text: But he spake of the temple of his body.

label: John
text: When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

label: John
text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast [day], many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.

label: John
text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all [men],

label: John
text: And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.

label: John
text: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

label: John
text: The same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.

label: John
text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

label: John
text: Nicodemus saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old?

label: John
text: can he enter the second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?

label: John
text: Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and [of] the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

label: John
text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

label: John
text: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.

label: John
text: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.

label: John
text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?

label: John
text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?

label: John
text: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.

label: John
text: If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you [of] heavenly things?

label: John
text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, [even] the Son of man which is in heaven.

label: John
text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up:

label: John
text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

label: John
text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

label: John
text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.

label: John
text: He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.

label: John
text: And this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.

label: John
text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.

label: John
text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.

label: John
text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.

label: John
text: And John also was baptizing in AEnon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.

label: John
text: For John was not yet cast into prison.

label: John
text: Then there arose a question between [some] of John’s disciples and the Jews about purifying.

label: John
text: And they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all [men] come to him.

label: John
text: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.

label: John
text: Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.

label: John
text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.

label: John
text: He must increase, but I [must] decrease.

label: John
text: He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all.

label: John
text: And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.

label: John
text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.

label: John
text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure [unto him].

label: John
text: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.

label: John
text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.

label: John
text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,

label: John
text: (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)

label: John
text: He left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.

label: John
text: And he must needs go through Samaria.

label: John
text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

label: John
text: Now Jacob’s well was there.

label: John
text: Jesus therefore, being wearied with [his] journey, sat thus on the well: [and] it was about the sixth hour.

label: John
text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.

label: John
text: (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)

label: John
text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria?

label: John
text: for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

label: John
text: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.

label: John
text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?

label: John
text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?

label: John
text: Jesus answered and said unto her, Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:

label: John
text: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.

label: John
text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

label: John
text: The woman answered and said, I have no husband.

label: John
text: Jesus said unto her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband:

label: John
text: For thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly.

label: John
text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

label: John
text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.

label: John
text: Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.

label: John
text: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.

label: John
text: God [is] a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship [him] in spirit and in truth.

label: John
text: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am [he].

label: John
text: And upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou?

label: John
text: or, Why talkest thou with her?

label: John
text: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,

label: John
text: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?

label: John
text: Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.

label: John
text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.

label: John
text: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.

label: John
text: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him [ought] to eat?

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.

label: John
text: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and [then] cometh harvest?

label: John
text: behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.

label: John
text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.

label: John
text: And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.

label: John
text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.

label: John
text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.

label: John
text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.

label: John
text: And many more believed because of his own word;

label: John
text: And said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard [him] ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.

label: John
text: Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.

label: John
text: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.

label: John
text: Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.

label: John
text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine.

label: John
text: And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

label: John
text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.

label: John
text: Then said Jesus unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.

label: John
text: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth.

label: John
text: And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.

label: John
text: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told [him], saying, Thy son liveth.

label: John
text: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend.

label: John
text: And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

label: John
text: So the father knew that [it was] at the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.

label: John
text: This [is] again the second miracle [that] Jesus did, when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.

label: John
text: After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

label: John
text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep [market] a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.

label: John
text: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.

label: John
text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.

label: John
text: And a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.

label: John
text: When Jesus saw him lie, and knew that he had been now a long time [in that case], he saith unto him, Wilt thou be made whole?

label: John
text: The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto him, Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.

label: John
text: And immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and walked: and on the same day was the sabbath.

label: John
text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day: it is not lawful for thee to carry [thy] bed.

label: John
text: He answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, and walk.

label: John
text: Then asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take up thy bed, and walk?

label: John
text: And he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in [that] place.

label: John
text: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.

label: John
text: The man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.

label: John
text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day.

label: John
text: But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.

label: John
text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.

label: John
text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.

label: John
text: For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.

label: John
text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneth [them]; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will.

label: John
text: For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son:

label: John
text: That all [men] should honour the Son, even as they honour the Father.

label: John
text: He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him.

label: John
text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.

label: John
text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.

label: John
text: For as the Father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself;

label: John
text: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man.

label: John
text: Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,

label: John
text: And shall come forth; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.

label: John
text: I can of mine own self do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my judgment is just; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of the Father which hath sent me.

label: John
text: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

label: John
text: There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.

label: John
text: Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth.

label: John
text: But I receive not testimony from man: but these things I say, that ye might be saved.

label: John
text: He was a burning and a shining light: and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.

label: John
text: But I have greater witness than [that] of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.

label: John
text: And the Father himself, which hath sent me, hath borne witness of me.

label: John
text: Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape.

label: John
text: And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.

label: John
text: Search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.

label: John
text: And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.

label: John
text: I receive not honour from men.

label: John
text: But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.

label: John
text: I am come in my Father’s name, and ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.

label: John
text: How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, and seek not the honour that [cometh] from God only?

label: John
text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father: there is [one] that accuseth you, [even] Moses, in whom ye trust.

label: John
text: For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me.

label: John
text: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

label: John
text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is [the sea] of Tiberias.

label: John
text: And a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.

label: John
text: And Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.

label: John
text: And the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.

label: John
text: When Jesus then lifted up [his] eyes, and saw a great company come unto him, he saith unto Philip, Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?

label: John
text: And this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.

label: John
text: Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.

label: John
text: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, saith unto him,

label: John
text: There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many?

label: John
text: And Jesus said, Make the men sit down.

label: John
text: Now there was much grass in the place.

label: John
text: So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.

label: John
text: And Jesus took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.

label: John
text: When they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.

label: John
text: Therefore they gathered [them] together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.

label: John
text: Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.

label: John
text: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force, to make him a king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.

label: John
text: And when even was [now] come, his disciples went down unto the sea,

label: John
text: And entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum.

label: John
text: And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.

label: John
text: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.

label: John
text: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the ship: and they were afraid.

label: John
text: But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.

label: John
text: Then they willingly received him into the ship: and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.

label: John
text: The day following, when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save that one whereinto his disciples were entered, and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat, but [that] his disciples were gone away alone;

label: John
text: (Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread, after that the Lord had given thanks:)

label: John
text: When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they also took shipping, and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.

label: John
text: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?

label: John
text: Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye did eat of the loaves, and were filled.

label: John
text: Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: for him hath God the Father sealed.

label: John
text: Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?

label: John
text: Jesus answered and said unto them, This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.

label: John
text: They said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee?

label: John
text: what dost thou work?

label: John
text: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

label: John
text: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from heaven; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.

label: John
text: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.

label: John
text: Then said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.

label: John
text: And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.

label: John
text: But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.

label: John
text: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.

label: John
text: For I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.

label: John
text: And this is the Father’s will which hath sent me, that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day.

label: John
text: And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life: and I will raise him up at the last day.

label: John
text: The Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I am the bread which came down from heaven.

label: John
text: And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know?

label: John
text: how is it then that he saith, I came down from heaven?

label: John
text: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Murmur not among yourselves.

label: John
text: No man can come to me, except the Father which hath sent me draw him: and I will raise him up at the last day.

label: John
text: It is written in the prophets, And they shall be all taught of God.

label: John
text: Every man therefore that hath heard, and hath learned of the Father, cometh unto me.

label: John
text: Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.

label: John
text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.

label: John
text: I am that bread of life.

label: John
text: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.

label: John
text: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.

label: John
text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven: if any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever: and the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.

label: John
text: The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give us [his] flesh to eat?

label: John
text: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.

label: John
text: Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.

label: John
text: For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.

label: John
text: He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.

label: John
text: As the living Father hath sent me, and I live by the Father: so he that eateth me, even he shall live by me.

label: John
text: This is that bread which came down from heaven: not as your fathers did eat manna, and are dead: he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever.

label: John
text: These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.

label: John
text: Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heard [this], said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?

label: John
text: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them, Doth this offend you?

label: John
text: [What] and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?

label: John
text: It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you, [they] are spirit, and [they] are life.

label: John
text: But there are some of you that believe not.

label: John
text: For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who should betray him.

label: John
text: And he said, Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.

label: John
text: From that [time] many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.

label: John
text: Then said Jesus unto the twelve, Will ye also go away?

label: John
text: Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go?

label: John
text: thou hast the words of eternal life.

label: John
text: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.

label: John
text: Jesus answered them, Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?

label: John
text: He spake of Judas Iscariot [the son] of Simon: for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.

label: John
text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.

label: John
text: Now the Jews’ feast of tabernacles was at hand.

label: John
text: His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.

label: John
text: For [there is] no man [that] doeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly.

label: John
text: If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.

label: John
text: For neither did his brethren believe in him.

label: John
