text: Then Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?

label: John
text: Peter seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what [shall] this man [do]?

label: John
text: Jesus saith unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what [is that] to thee?

label: John
text: follow thou me.

label: John
text: Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what [is that] to thee?

label: John
text: This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.

label: John
text: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written.

label: John
text: Amen.

label: John
text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life;

label: John
text: (For the life was manifested, and we have seen [it], and bear witness, and shew unto you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested unto us;)

label: John
text: That which we have seen and heard declare we unto you, that ye also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship [is] with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ.

label: John
text: And these things write we unto you, that your joy may be full.

label: John
text: This then is the message which we have heard of him, and declare unto you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.

label: John
text: If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness, we lie, and do not the truth:

label: John
text: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.

label: John
text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.

label: John
text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us [our] sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

label: John
text: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us.

label: John
text: My little children, these things write I unto you, that ye sin not.

label: John
text: And if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:

label: John
text: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for [the sins of] the whole world.

label: John
text: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.

label: John
text: He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.

label: John
text: But whoso keepeth his word, in him verily is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in him.

label: John
text: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.

label: John
text: Brethren, I write no new commandment unto you, but an old commandment which ye had from the beginning.

label: John
text: The old commandment is the word which ye have heard from the beginning.

label: John
text: Again, a new commandment I write unto you, which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past, and the true light now shineth.

label: John
text: He that saith he is in the light, and hateth his brother, is in darkness even until now.

label: John
text: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light, and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.

label: John
text: But he that hateth his brother is in darkness, and walketh in darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, because that darkness hath blinded his eyes.

label: John
text: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name’s sake.

label: John
text: I write unto you, fathers, because ye have known him [that is] from the beginning.

label: John
text: I write unto you, young men, because ye have overcome the wicked one.

label: John
text: I write unto you, little children, because ye have known the Father.

label: John
text: I have written unto you, fathers, because ye have known him [that is] from the beginning.

label: John
text: I have written unto you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and ye have overcome the wicked one.

label: John
text: Love not the world, neither the things [that are] in the world.

label: John
text: If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

label: John
text: For all that [is] in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.

label: John
text: And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.

label: John
text: Little children, it is the last time: and as ye have heard that antichrist shall come, even now are there many antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last time.

label: John
text: They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would [no doubt] have continued with us: but [they went out], that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us.

label: John
text: But ye have an unction from the Holy One, and ye know all things.

label: John
text: I have not written unto you because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

label: John
text: Who is a liar but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ?

label: John
text: He is antichrist, that denieth the Father and the Son.

label: John
text: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father: [(but) he that acknowledgeth the Son hath the Father also].

label: John
text: Let that therefore abide in you, which ye have heard from the beginning.

label: John
text: If that which ye have heard from the beginning shall remain in you, ye also shall continue in the Son, and in the Father.

label: John
text: And this is the promise that he hath promised us, [even] eternal life.

label: John
text: These [things] have I written unto you concerning them that seduce you.

label: John
text: But the anointing which ye have received of him abideth in you, and ye need not that any man teach you: but as the same anointing teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie, and even as it hath taught you, ye shall abide in him.

label: John
text: And now, little children, abide in him; that, when he shall appear, we may have confidence, and not be ashamed before him at his coming.

label: John
text: If ye know that he is righteous, ye know that every one that doeth righteousness is born of him.

label: John
text: Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew him not.

label: John
text: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is.

label: John
text: And every man that hath this hope in him purifieth himself, even as he is pure.

label: John
text: Whosoever committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is the transgression of the law.

label: John
text: And ye know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.

label: John
text: Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not: whosoever sinneth hath not seen him, neither known him.

label: John
text: Little children, let no man deceive you: he that doeth righteousness is righteous, even as he is righteous.

label: John
text: He that committeth sin is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from the beginning.

label: John
text: For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

label: John
text: Whosoever is born of God doth not commit sin; for his seed remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.

label: John
text: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil: whosoever doeth not righteousness is not of God, neither he that loveth not his brother.

label: John
text: For this is the message that ye heard from the beginning, that we should love one another.

label: John
text: Not as Cain, [who] was of that wicked one, and slew his brother.

label: John
text: And wherefore slew he him?

label: John
text: Because his own works were evil, and his brother’s righteous.

label: John
text: Marvel not, my brethren, if the world hate you.

label: John
text: We know that we have passed from death unto life, because we love the brethren.

label: John
text: He that loveth not [his] brother abideth in death.

label: John
text: Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer: and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him.

label: John
text: Hereby perceive we the love [of God], because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down [our] lives for the brethren.

label: John
text: But whoso hath this world’s good, and seeth his brother have need, and shutteth up his bowels [of compassion] from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?

label: John
text: My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

label: John
text: And hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before him.

label: John
text: For if our heart condemn us, God is greater than our heart, and knoweth all things.

label: John
text: Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, [then] have we confidence toward God.

label: John
text: And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

label: John
text: And this is his commandment, That we should believe on the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and love one another, as he gave us commandment.

label: John
text: And he that keepeth his commandments dwelleth in him, and he in him.

label: John
text: And hereby we know that he abideth in us, by the Spirit which he hath given us.

label: John
text: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

label: John
text: Hereby know ye the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God:

label: John
text: And every spirit that confesseth not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is not of God: and this is that [spirit] of antichrist, whereof ye have heard that it should come; and even now already is it in the world.

label: John
text: Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

label: John
text: They are of the world: therefore speak they of the world, and the world heareth them.

label: John
text: We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us.

label: John
text: Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

label: John
text: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.

label: John
text: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.

label: John
text: In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him.

label: John
text: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son [to be] the propitiation for our sins.

label: John
text: Beloved, if God so loved us, we ought also to love one another.

label: John
text: No man hath seen God at any time.

label: John
text: If we love one another, God dwelleth in us, and his love is perfected in us.

label: John
text: Hereby know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he hath given us of his Spirit.

label: John
text: And we have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son [to be] the Saviour of the world.

label: John
text: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.

label: John
text: And we have known and believed the love that God hath to us.

label: John
text: God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.

label: John
text: Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.

label: John
text: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment.

label: John
text: He that feareth is not made perfect in love.

label: John
text: We love him, because he first loved us.

label: John
text: If a man say, I love God, and hateth his brother, he is a liar: for he that loveth not his brother whom he hath seen, how can he love God whom he hath not seen?

label: John
text: And this commandment have we from him, That he who loveth God love his brother also.

label: John
text: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten of him.

label: John
text: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God, and keep his commandments.

label: John
text: For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments: and his commandments are not grievous.

label: John
text: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, [even] our faith.

label: John
text: Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

label: John
text: This is he that came by water and blood, [even] Jesus Christ; not by water only, but by water and blood.

label: John
text: And it is the Spirit that beareth witness, because the Spirit is truth.

label: John
text: For there are three that bear record in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost: and these three are one.

label: John
text: And there are three that bear witness in earth, the spirit, and the water, and the blood: and these three agree in one.

label: John
text: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which he hath testified of his Son.

label: John
text: He that believeth on the Son of God hath the witness in himself: he that believeth not God hath made him a liar; because he believeth not the record that God gave of his Son.

label: John
text: And this is the record, that God hath given to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

label: John
text: He that hath the Son hath life; [and] he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.

label: John
text: These things have I written unto you that believe on the name of the Son of God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may believe on the name of the Son of God.

label: John
text: And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:

label: John
text: And if we know that he hear us, whatsoever we ask, we know that we have the petitions that we desired of him.

label: John
text: If any man see his brother sin a sin [which is] not unto death, he shall ask, and he shall give him life for them that sin not unto death.

label: John
text: There is a sin unto death: I do not say that he shall pray for it.

label: John
text: All unrighteousness is sin: and there is a sin not unto death.

label: John
text: We know that whosoever is born of God sinneth not; but he that is begotten of God keepeth himself, and that wicked one toucheth him not.

label: John
text: [And] we know that we are of God, and the whole world lieth in wickedness.

label: John
text: And we know that the Son of God is come, and hath given us an understanding, that we may know him that is true, and we are in him that is true, [even] in his Son Jesus Christ.

label: John
text: This is the true God, and eternal life.

label: John
text: Little children, keep yourselves from idols.

label: John
text: Amen.

label: John
text: The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave unto him, to shew unto his servants things which must shortly come to pass; and he sent and signified [it] by his angel unto his servant John:

label: John
text: Who bare record of the word of God, and of the testimony of Jesus Christ, and of all things that he saw.

label: John
text: Blessed [is] he that readeth, and they that hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things which are written therein: for the time [is] at hand.

label: John
text: John to the seven churches which are in Asia: Grace [be] unto you, and peace, from him which is, and which was, and which is to come; and from the seven Spirits which are before his throne;

label: John
text: And from Jesus Christ, [who is] the faithful witness, [and] the first begotten of the dead, and the prince of the kings of the earth.

label: John
text: Unto him that loved us, and washed us from our sins in his own blood,

label: John
text: And hath made us kings and priests unto God and his Father; to him [be] glory and dominion for ever and ever.

label: John
text: Amen.

label: John
text: Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they [also] which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him.

label: John
text: Even so, Amen.

label: John
text: I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the ending, saith the Lord, which is, and which was, and which is to come, the Almighty.

label: John
text: I John, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation, and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

label: John
text: I was in the Spirit on the Lord’s day, and heard behind me a great voice, as of a trumpet,

label: John
text: Saying, I am Alpha and Omega, the first and the last: and, What thou seest, write in a book, and send [it] unto the seven churches which are in Asia; unto Ephesus, and unto Smyrna, and unto Pergamos, and unto Thyatira, and unto Sardis, and unto Philadelphia, and unto Laodicea.

label: John
text: And I turned to see the voice that spake with me.

label: John
text: And being turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks;

label: John
text: And in the midst of the seven candlesticks [one] like unto the Son of man, clothed with a garment down to the foot, and girt about the paps with a golden girdle.

label: John
text: His head and [his] hairs [were] white like wool, as white as snow; and his eyes [were] as a flame of fire;

label: John
text: And his feet like unto fine brass, as if they burned in a furnace; and his voice as the sound of many waters.

label: John
text: And he had in his right hand seven stars: and out of his mouth went a sharp twoedged sword: and his countenance [was] as the sun shineth in his strength.

label: John
text: And when I saw him, I fell at his feet as dead.

label: John
text: And he laid his right hand upon me, saying unto me, Fear not; I am the first and the last:

label: John
text: [I am] he that liveth, and was dead; and, behold, I am alive for evermore, Amen; and have the keys of hell and of death.

label: John
text: Write the things which thou hast seen, and the things which are, and the things which shall be hereafter;

label: John
text: The mystery of the seven stars which thou sawest in my right hand, and the seven golden candlesticks.

label: John
text: The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches: and the seven candlesticks which thou sawest are the seven churches.

label: John
text: Unto the angel of the church of Ephesus write; These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, who walketh in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks;

label: John
text: I know thy works, and thy labour, and thy patience, and how thou canst not bear them which are evil: and thou hast tried them which say they are apostles, and are not, and hast found them liars:

label: John
text: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name’s sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.

label: John
text: Nevertheless I have [somewhat] against thee, because thou hast left thy first love.

label: John
text: Remember therefore from whence thou art fallen, and repent, and do the first works; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will remove thy candlestick out of his place, except thou repent.

label: John
text: But this thou hast, that thou hatest the deeds of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

label: John
text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the tree of life, which is in the midst of the paradise of God.

label: John
text: And unto the angel of the church in Smyrna write; These things saith the first and the last, which was dead, and is alive;

label: John
text: I know thy works, and tribulation, and poverty, (but thou art rich) and [I know] the blasphemy of them which say they are Jews, and are not, but [are] the synagogue of Satan.

label: John
text: Fear none of those things which thou shalt suffer: behold, the devil shall cast [some] of you into prison, that ye may be tried; and ye shall have tribulation ten days: be thou faithful unto death, and I will give thee a crown of life.

label: John
text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; He that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death.

label: John
text: And to the angel of the church in Pergamos write; These things saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edges;

label: John
text: I know thy works, and where thou dwellest, [even] where Satan’s seat [is]: and thou holdest fast my name, and hast not denied my faith, even in those days wherein Antipas [was] my faithful martyr, who was slain among you, where Satan dwelleth.

label: John
text: But I have a few things against thee, because thou hast there them that hold the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balac to cast a stumblingblock before the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed unto idols, and to commit fornication.

label: John
text: So hast thou also them that hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitans, which thing I hate.

label: John
text: Repent; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.

label: John
text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden manna, and will give him a white stone, and in the stone a new name written, which no man knoweth saving he that receiveth [it].

label: John
text: And unto the angel of the church in Thyatira write; These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire, and his feet [are] like fine brass;

label: John
text: I know thy works, and charity, and service, and faith, and thy patience, and thy works; and the last [to be] more than the first.

label: John
text: Notwithstanding I have a few things against thee, because thou sufferest that woman Jezebel, which calleth herself a prophetess, to teach and to seduce my servants to commit fornication, and to eat things sacrificed unto idols.

label: John
text: And I gave her space to repent of her fornication; and she repented not.

label: John
text: Behold, I will cast her into a bed, and them that commit adultery with her into great tribulation, except they repent of their deeds.

label: John
text: And I will kill her children with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts: and I will give unto every one of you according to your works.

label: John
text: But unto you I say, and unto the rest in Thyatira, as many as have not this doctrine, and which have not known the depths of Satan, as they speak; I will put upon you none other burden.

label: John
text: But that which ye have [already] hold fast till I come.

label: John
text: And he that overcometh, and keepeth my works unto the end, to him will I give power over the nations:

label: John
text: And he shall rule them with a rod of iron; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers: even as I received of my Father.

label: John
text: And I will give him the morning star.

label: John
text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

label: John
text: And unto the angel of the church in Sardis write; These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars; I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.

label: John
text: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God.

label: John
text: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and hold fast, and repent.

label: John
text: If therefore thou shalt not watch, I will come on thee as a thief, and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee.

label: John
text: Thou hast a few names even in Sardis which have not defiled their garments; and they shall walk with me in white: for they are worthy.

label: John
text: He that overcometh, the same shall be clothed in white raiment; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life, but I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.

label: John
text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

label: John
text: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write; These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth, and no man shutteth; and shutteth, and no man openeth;

label: John
text: I know thy works: behold, I have set before thee an open door, and no man can shut it: for thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name.

label: John
text: Behold, I will make them of the synagogue of Satan, which say they are Jews, and are not, but do lie; behold, I will make them to come and worship before thy feet, and to know that I have loved thee.

label: John
text: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation, which shall come upon all the world, to try them that dwell upon the earth.

label: John
text: Behold, I come quickly: hold that fast which thou hast, that no man take thy crown.

label: John
text: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go no more out: and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, [which is] new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God: and [I will write upon him] my new name.

label: John
text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

label: John
text: And unto the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write; These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God;

label: John
text: I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot: I would thou wert cold or hot.

label: John
text: So then because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will spue thee out of my mouth.

label: John
text: Because thou sayest, I am rich, and increased with goods, and have need of nothing; and knowest not that thou art wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked:

label: John
text: I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire, that thou mayest be rich; and white raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and [that] the shame of thy nakedness do not appear; and anoint thine eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.

label: John
text: As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.

label: John
text: Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.

label: John
text: To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne, even as I also overcame, and am set down with my Father in his throne.

label: John
text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

label: John
text: After this I looked, and, behold, a door [was] opened in heaven: and the first voice which I heard [was] as it were of a trumpet talking with me; which said, Come up hither, and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter.

label: John
text: And immediately I was in the spirit: and, behold, a throne was set in heaven, and [one] sat on the throne.

label: John
text: And he that sat was to look upon like a jasper and a sardine stone: and [there was] a rainbow round about the throne, in sight like unto an emerald.

label: John
text: And round about the throne [were] four and twenty seats: and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white raiment; and they had on their heads crowns of gold.

label: John
text: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices: and [there were] seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.

label: John
text: And before the throne [there was] a sea of glass like unto crystal: and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne, [were] four beasts full of eyes before and behind.

label: John
text: And the first beast [was] like a lion, and the second beast like a calf, and the third beast had a face as a man, and the fourth beast [was] like a flying eagle.

label: John
text: And the four beasts had each of them six wings about [him]; and [they were] full of eyes within: and they rest not day and night, saying, Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty, which was, and is, and is to come.

label: John
text: And when those beasts give glory and honour and thanks to him that sat on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever,

label: John
text: The four and twenty elders fall down before him that sat on the throne, and worship him that liveth for ever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, saying,

label: John
text: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honour and power: for thou hast created all things, and for thy pleasure they are and were created.

label: John
text: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.

label: John
text: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to loose the seals thereof?

label: John
text: And no man in heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, was able to open the book, neither to look thereon.

label: John
text: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book, neither to look thereon.

label: John
text: And one of the elders saith unto me, Weep not: behold, the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, hath prevailed to open the book, and to loose the seven seals thereof.

label: John
text: And I beheld, and, lo, in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.

label: John
text: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.

label: John
text: And when he had taken the book, the four beasts and four [and] twenty elders fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps, and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints.

label: John
text: And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation;

label: John
text: And hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.

label: John
text: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the beasts and the elders: and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands;

label: John
text: Saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and blessing.

label: John
text: And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, [be] unto him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.

label: John
text: And the four beasts said, Amen.

label: John
text: And the four [and] twenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth for ever and ever.

label: John
text: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying, Come and see.

label: John
text: And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.

label: John
text: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.

label: John
text: And there went out another horse [that was] red: and [power] was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.

label: John
text: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see.

label: John
text: And I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand.

label: John
text: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; and [see] thou hurt not the oil and the wine.

label: John
text: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth beast say, Come and see.

label: John
text: And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him.

label: John
text: And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.

label: John
text: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they held:

label: John
text: And they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?

label: John
text: And white robes were given unto every one of them; and it was said unto them, that they should rest yet for a little season, until their fellowservants also and their brethren, that should be killed as they [were], should be fulfilled.

label: John
text: And I beheld when he had opened the sixth seal, and, lo, there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and the moon became as blood;

label: John
text: And the stars of heaven fell unto the earth, even as a fig tree casteth her untimely figs, when she is shaken of a mighty wind.

label: John
text: And the heaven departed as a scroll when it is rolled together; and every mountain and island were moved out of their places.

label: John
text: And the kings of the earth, and the great men, and the rich men, and the chief captains, and the mighty men, and every bondman, and every free man, hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of the mountains;

label: John
text: And said to the mountains and rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb:

label: John
text: For the great day of his wrath is come; and who shall be able to stand?

label: John
text: And after these things I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.

label: John
text: And I saw another angel ascending from the east, having the seal of the living God: and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels, to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,

label: John
text: Saying, Hurt not the earth, neither the sea, nor the trees, till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads.

label: John
text: And I heard the number of them which were sealed: [and there were] sealed an hundred [and] forty [and] four thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Juda [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Reuben [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Gad [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Aser [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Nepthalim [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Manasses [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Simeon [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Levi [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Issachar [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: Paul
text: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called [to be] an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,

label: Paul
text: (Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)

label: Paul
text: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;

label: Paul
text: And declared [to be] the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:

label: Paul
text: By whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:

label: Paul
text: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:

label: Paul
text: To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called [to be] saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.

label: Paul
text: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;

label: Paul
text: Making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.

label: Paul
text: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;

label: Paul
text: That is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.

label: Paul
text: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto,) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.

label: Paul
text: I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.

label: Paul
text: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.

label: Paul
text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

label: Paul
text: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, The just shall live by faith.

label: Paul
text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

label: Paul
text: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed [it] unto them.

label: Paul
text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, [even] his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

label: Paul
text: Because that, when they knew God, they glorified [him] not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

label: Paul
text: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

label: Paul
text: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

label: Paul
text: Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

label: Paul
text: And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

label: Paul
text: And even as they did not like to retain God in [their] knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

label: Paul
text: Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

label: Paul
text: Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

label: Paul
text: Without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

label: Paul
text: Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.

label: Paul
text: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

label: Paul
text: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.

label: Paul
text: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

label: Paul
text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

label: Paul
text: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;

label: Paul
text: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:

label: Paul
text: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:

label: Paul
text: But unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,

label: Paul
text: Tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that doeth evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Gentile;

label: Paul
text: But glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:

label: Paul
text: For there is no respect of persons with God.

label: Paul
text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;

label: Paul
text: (For not the hearers of the law [are] just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.

label: Paul
text: For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:

label: Paul
text: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and [their] thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)

label: Paul
text: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

label: Paul
text: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God,

label: Paul
text: And knowest [his] will, and approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;

label: Paul
text: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,

label: Paul
text: An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.

label: Paul
text: Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself?

label: Paul
text: thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?

label: Paul
text: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery?

label: Paul
text: thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?

label: Paul
text: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?

label: Paul
text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.

label: Paul
text: For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.

label: Paul
text: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

label: Paul
text: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law?

label: Paul
text: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither [is that] circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:

label: Paul
text: But he [is] a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision [is that] of the heart, in the spirit, [and] not in the letter; whose praise [is] not of men, but of God.

label: Paul
text: What advantage then hath the Jew?

label: Paul
text: or what profit [is there] of circumcision?

label: Paul
text: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.

label: Paul
text: For what if some did not believe?

label: Paul
text: shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?

label: Paul
text: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.

label: Paul
text: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say?

label: Paul
text: [Is] God unrighteous who taketh vengeance?

label: Paul
text: (I speak as a man)

label: Paul
text: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

label: Paul
text: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

label: Paul
text: And not [rather], (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come?

label: Paul
text: whose damnation is just.

label: Paul
text: What then?

label: Paul
text: are we better [than they]?

label: Paul
text: No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;

label: Paul
text: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:

label: Paul
text: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.

label: Paul
text: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

label: Paul
text: Their throat [is] an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps [is] under their lips:

label: Paul
text: Whose mouth [is] full of cursing and bitterness:

label: Paul
text: Their feet [are] swift to shed blood:

label: Paul
text: Destruction and misery [are] in their ways:

label: Paul
text: And the way of peace have they not known:

label: Paul
text: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

label: Paul
text: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.

label: Paul
text: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law [is] the knowledge of sin.

label: Paul
text: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;

label: Paul
text: Even the righteousness of God [which is] by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:

label: Paul
text: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

label: Paul
text: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:

label: Paul
text: Whom God hath set forth [to be] a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;

label: Paul
text: To declare, [I say], at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Where [is] boasting then?

label: Paul
text: It is excluded.

label: Paul
text: By what law?

label: Paul
text: of works?

label: Paul
text: Nay: but by the law of faith.

label: Paul
text: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.

label: Paul
text: [Is he] the God of the Jews only?

label: Paul
text: [is he] not also of the Gentiles?

label: Paul
text: Yes, of the Gentiles also:

label: Paul
text: Seeing [it is] one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.

label: Paul
text: Do we then make void the law through faith?

label: Paul
text: God forbid: yea, we establish the law.

label: Paul
text: What shall we say then that Abraham our father, as pertaining to the flesh, hath found?

label: Paul
text: For if Abraham were justified by works, he hath [whereof] to glory; but not before God.

label: Paul
text: For what saith the scripture?

label: Paul
text: Abraham believed God, and it was counted unto him for righteousness.

label: Paul
text: Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace, but of debt.

label: Paul
text: But to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is counted for righteousness.

label: Paul
text: Even as David also describeth the blessedness of the man, unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works,

label: Paul
text: [Saying], Blessed [are] they whose iniquities are forgiven, and whose sins are covered.

label: Paul
text: Blessed [is] the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.

label: Paul
text: [Cometh] this blessedness then upon the circumcision [only], or upon the uncircumcision also?

label: Paul
text: for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham for righteousness.

label: Paul
text: How was it then reckoned?

label: Paul
text: when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision?

label: Paul
text: Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

label: Paul
text: And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which [he had yet] being uncircumcised: that he might be the father of all them that believe, though they be not circumcised; that righteousness might be imputed unto them also:

label: Paul
text: And the father of circumcision to them who are not of the circumcision only, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which [he had] being [yet] uncircumcised.

label: Paul
text: For the promise, that he should be the heir of the world, [was] not to Abraham, or to his seed, through the law, but through the righteousness of faith.

label: Paul
text: For if they which are of the law [be] heirs, faith is made void, and the promise made of none effect:

label: Paul
text: Because the law worketh wrath: for where no law is, [there is] no transgression.

label: Paul
text: Therefore [it is] of faith, that [it might be] by grace; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed; not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham; who is the father of us all,

label: Paul
text: (As it is written, I have made thee a father of many nations,) before him whom he believed, [even] God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.

label: Paul
text: Who against hope believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations; according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be.

label: Paul
text: And being not weak in faith, he considered not his own body now dead, when he was about an hundred years old, neither yet the deadness of Sara’s womb:

label: Paul
text: He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief; but was strong in faith, giving glory to God;

label: Paul
text: And being fully persuaded that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.

label: Paul
text: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness.

label: Paul
text: Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was imputed to him;

label: Paul
text: But for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead;

label: Paul
text: Who was delivered for our offences, and was raised again for our justification.

label: Paul
text: Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:

label: Paul
text: By whom also we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand, and rejoice in hope of the glory of God.

label: Paul
text: And not only [so], but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation worketh patience;

label: Paul
text: And patience, experience; and experience, hope:

label: Paul
text: And hope maketh not ashamed; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us.

label: Paul
text: For when we were yet without strength, in due time Christ died for the ungodly.

label: Paul
text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die: yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die.

label: Paul
text: But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

label: Paul
text: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.

label: Paul
text: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we shall be saved by his life.

label: Paul
text: And not only [so], but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the atonement.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, as by one man sin entered into the world, and death by sin; and so death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned:

label: Paul
text: (For until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over them that had not sinned after the similitude of Adam’s transgression, who is the figure of him that was to come.

label: Paul
text: But not as the offence, so also [is] the free gift.

label: Paul
text: For if through the offence of one many be dead, much more the grace of God, and the gift by grace, [which is] by one man, Jesus Christ, hath abounded unto many.

label: Paul
text: And not as [it was] by one that sinned, [so is] the gift: for the judgment [was] by one to condemnation, but the free gift [is] of many offences unto justification.

label: Paul
text: For if by one man’s offence death reigned by one; much more they which receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness shall reign in life by one, Jesus Christ.)

label: Paul
text: Therefore as by the offence of one [judgment came] upon all men to condemnation; even so by the righteousness of one [the free gift came] upon all men unto justification of life.

label: Paul
text: For as by one man’s disobedience many were made sinners, so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous.

label: Paul
text: Moreover the law entered, that the offence might abound.

label: Paul
text: But where sin abounded, grace did much more abound:

label: Paul
text: That as sin hath reigned unto death, even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord.

label: Paul
text: What shall we say then?

label: Paul
text: Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?

label: Paul
text: God forbid.

label: Paul
text: How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein?

label: Paul
text: Know ye not, that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?

label: Paul
text: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.

label: Paul
text: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death, we shall be also [in the likeness] of [his] resurrection:

label: Paul
text: Knowing this, that our old man is crucified with [him], that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.

label: Paul
text: For he that is dead is freed from sin.

label: Paul
text: Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:

label: Paul
text: Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.

label: Paul
text: For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.

label: Paul
text: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.

label: Paul
text: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.

label: Paul
text: Neither yield ye your members [as] instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members [as] instruments of righteousness unto God.

label: Paul
text: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.

label: Paul
text: What then?

label: Paul
text: shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace?

label: Paul
text: God forbid.

label: Paul
text: Know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?

label: Paul
text: But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.

label: Paul
text: Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.

label: Paul
text: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.

label: Paul
text: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness.

label: Paul
text: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed?

label: Paul
text: for the end of those things [is] death.

label: Paul
text: But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life.

label: Paul
text: For the wages of sin [is] death; but the gift of God [is] eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

label: Paul
text: Know ye not, brethren, (for I speak to them that know the law,) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth?

label: Paul
text: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to [her] husband so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loosed from the law of [her] husband.

label: Paul
text: So then if, while [her] husband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, my brethren, ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ; that ye should be married to another, [even] to him who is raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit unto God.

label: Paul
text: For when we were in the flesh, the motions of sins, which were by the law, did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.

label: Paul
text: But now we are delivered from the law, that being dead wherein we were held; that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not [in] the oldness of the letter.

label: Paul
text: What shall we say then?

label: Paul
text: [Is] the law sin?

label: Paul
text: God forbid.

label: Paul
text: Nay, I had not known sin, but by the law: for I had not known lust, except the law had said, Thou shalt not covet.

label: Paul
text: But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence.

label: Paul
text: For without the law sin [was] dead.

label: Paul
text: For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.

label: Paul
text: And the commandment, which [was ordained] to life, I found [to be] unto death.

label: Paul
text: For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew [me].

label: Paul
text: Wherefore the law [is] holy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good.

label: Paul
text: Was then that which is good made death unto me?

label: Paul
text: God forbid.

label: Paul
text: But sin, that it might appear sin, working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.

label: Paul
text: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.

label: Paul
text: For that which I do I allow not: for what I would, that do I not; but what I hate, that do I.

label: Paul
text: If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that [it is] good.

label: Paul
text: Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

label: Paul
text: For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh,) dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me; but [how] to perform that which is good I find not.

label: Paul
text: For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.

label: Paul
text: Now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

label: Paul
text: I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present with me.

label: Paul
text: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:

label: Paul
text: But I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.

label: Paul
text: O wretched man that I am!

label: Paul
text: who shall deliver me from the body of this death?

label: Paul
text: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord.

label: Paul
text: So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.

label: Paul
text: [There is] therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

label: Paul
text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.

label: Paul
text: For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:

label: Paul
text: That the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

label: Paul
text: For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit.

label: Paul
text: For to be carnally minded [is] death; but to be spiritually minded [is] life and peace.

label: Paul
text: Because the carnal mind [is] enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be.

label: Paul
text: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.

label: Paul
text: But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you.

label: Paul
text: Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

label: Paul
text: And if Christ [be] in you, the body [is] dead because of sin; but the Spirit [is] life because of righteousness.

label: Paul
text: But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you, he that raised up Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies by his Spirit that dwelleth in you.

label: Paul
text: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh.

label: Paul
text: For if ye live after the flesh, ye shall die: but if ye through the Spirit do mortify the deeds of the body, ye shall live.

label: Paul
text: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.

label: Paul
text: For ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.

label: Paul
text: The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God:

label: Paul
text: And if children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with [him], that we may be also glorified together.

label: Paul
text: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time [are] not worthy [to be compared] with the glory which shall be revealed in us.

label: Paul
text: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.

label: Paul
text: For the creature was made subject to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who hath subjected [the same] in hope,

label: Paul
text: Because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.

label: Paul
text: For we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.

label: Paul
text: And not only [they], but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, [to wit], the redemption of our body.

label: Paul
text: For we are saved by hope: but hope that is seen is not hope: for what a man seeth, why doth he yet hope for?

label: Paul
text: But if we hope for that we see not, [then] do we with patience wait for [it].

label: Paul
text: Likewise the Spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.

label: Paul
text: And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what [is] the mind of the Spirit, because he maketh intercession for the saints according to [the will of] God.

label: Paul
text: And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to [his] purpose.

label: Paul
text: For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate [to be] conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.

label: Paul
text: Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.

label: Paul
text: What shall we then say to these things?

label: Paul
text: If God [be] for us, who [can be] against us?

label: Paul
text: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not with him also freely give us all things?

label: Paul
text: Who shall lay any thing to the charge of God’s elect?

label: Paul
text: [It is] God that justifieth.

label: Paul
text: Who [is] he that condemneth?

label: Paul
text: [It is] Christ that died, yea rather, that is risen again, who is even at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us.

label: Paul
text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ?

label: Paul
text: [shall] tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?

label: Paul
text: As it is written, For thy sake we are killed all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

label: Paul
text: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.

label: Paul
text: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come,

label: Paul
text: Nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

label: Paul
text: I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost,

label: Paul
text: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.

label: Paul
text: For I could wish that myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh:

label: Paul
text: Who are Israelites; to whom [pertaineth] the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the service [of God], and the promises;

label: Paul
text: Whose [are] the fathers, and of whom as concerning the flesh Christ [came], who is over all, God blessed for ever.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Not as though the word of God hath taken none effect.

label: Paul
text: For they [are] not all Israel, which are of Israel:

label: Paul
text: Neither, because they are the seed of Abraham, [are they] all children: but, In Isaac shall thy seed be called.

label: Paul
text: That is, They which are the children of the flesh, these [are] not the children of God: but the children of the promise are counted for the seed.

label: Paul
text: For this [is] the word of promise, At this time will I come, and Sara shall have a son.

label: Paul
text: And not only [this]; but when Rebecca also had conceived by one, [even] by our father Isaac;

label: Paul
text: (For [the children] being not yet born, neither having done any good or evil, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him that calleth;)

label: Paul
text: It was said unto her, The elder shall serve the younger.

label: Paul
text: As it is written, Jacob have I loved, but Esau have I hated.

label: Paul
text: What shall we say then?

label: Paul
text: [Is there] unrighteousness with God?

label: Paul
text: God forbid.

label: Paul
text: For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.

label: Paul
text: So then [it is] not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that sheweth mercy.

label: Paul
text: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh, Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up, that I might shew my power in thee, and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth.

label: Paul
text: Therefore hath he mercy on whom he will [have mercy], and whom he will he hardeneth.

label: Paul
text: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he yet find fault?

label: Paul
text: For who hath resisted his will?

label: Paul
text: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God?

label: Paul
text: Shall the thing formed say to him that formed [it], Why hast thou made me thus?

label: Paul
text: Hath not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?

label: Paul
text: [What] if God, willing to shew [his] wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath fitted to destruction:

label: Paul
text: And that he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy, which he had afore prepared unto glory,

label: Paul
text: Even us, whom he hath called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles?

label: Paul
text: As he saith also in Osee, I will call them my people, which were not my people; and her beloved, which was not beloved.

label: Paul
text: And it shall come to pass, [that] in the place where it was said unto them, Ye [are] not my people; there shall they be called the children of the living God.

label: Paul
text: Esaias also crieth concerning Israel, Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant shall be saved:

label: Paul
text: For he will finish the work, and cut [it] short in righteousness: because a short work will the Lord make upon the earth.

label: Paul
text: And as Esaias said before, Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, we had been as Sodoma, and been made like unto Gomorrha.

label: Paul
text: What shall we say then?

label: Paul
text: That the Gentiles, which followed not after righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith.

label: Paul
text: But Israel, which followed after the law of righteousness, hath not attained to the law of righteousness.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore?

label: Paul
text: Because [they sought it] not by faith, but as it were by the works of the law.

label: Paul
text: For they stumbled at that stumblingstone;

label: Paul
text: As it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence: and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, my heart’s desire and prayer to God for Israel is, that they might be saved.

label: Paul
text: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.

label: Paul
text: For they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and going about to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God.

label: Paul
text: For Christ [is] the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth.

label: Paul
text: For Moses describeth the righteousness which is of the law, That the man which doeth those things shall live by them.

label: Paul
text: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven?

label: Paul
text: (that is, to bring Christ down [from above]:)

label: Paul
text: Or, Who shall descend into the deep?

label: Paul
text: (that is, to bring up Christ again from the dead.)

label: Paul
text: But what saith it?

label: Paul
text: The word is nigh thee, [even] in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach;

label: Paul
text: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.

label: Paul
text: For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.

label: Paul
text: For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

label: Paul
text: For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek: for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him.

label: Paul
text: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

label: Paul
text: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed?

label: Paul
text: and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard?

label: Paul
text: and how shall they hear without a preacher?

label: Paul
text: And how shall they preach, except they be sent?

label: Paul
text: as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!

label: Paul
text: But they have not all obeyed the gospel.

label: Paul
text: For Esaias saith, Lord, who hath believed our report?

label: Paul
text: So then faith [cometh] by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.

label: Paul
text: But I say, Have they not heard?

label: Paul
text: Yes verily, their sound went into all the earth, and their words unto the ends of the world.

label: Paul
text: But I say, Did not Israel know?

label: Paul
text: First Moses saith, I will provoke you to jealousy by [them that are] no people, [and] by a foolish nation I will anger you.

label: Paul
text: But Esaias is very bold, and saith, I was found of them that sought me not; I was made manifest unto them that asked not after me.

label: Paul
text: But to Israel he saith, All day long I have stretched forth my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people.

label: Paul
text: I say then, Hath God cast away his people?

label: Paul
text: God forbid.

label: Paul
text: For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, [of] the tribe of Benjamin.

label: Paul
text: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew.

label: Paul
text: Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias?

label: Paul
text: how he maketh intercession to God against Israel, saying,

label: Paul
text: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, and digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.

label: Paul
text: But what saith the answer of God unto him?

label: Paul
text: I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to [the image of] Baal.

label: Paul
text: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

label: Paul
text: And if by grace, then [is it] no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace.

label: Paul
text: But if [it be] of works, then is it no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.

label: Paul
text: What then?

label: Paul
text: Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded

label: Paul
text: (According as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.

label: Paul
text: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:

label: Paul
text: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back alway.

label: Paul
text: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall?

label: Paul
text: God forbid: but [rather] through their fall salvation [is come] unto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.

label: Paul
text: Now if the fall of them [be] the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?

label: Paul
text: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:

label: Paul
text: If by any means I may provoke to emulation [them which are] my flesh, and might save some of them.

label: Paul
text: For if the casting away of them [be] the reconciling of the world, what [shall] the receiving [of them be], but life from the dead?

label: Paul
text: For if the firstfruit [be] holy, the lump [is] also [holy]: and if the root [be] holy, so [are] the branches.

label: Paul
text: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert graffed in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;

label: Paul
text: Boast not against the branches.

label: Paul
text: But if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

label: Paul
text: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be graffed in.

label: Paul
text: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by faith.

label: Paul
text: Be not highminded, but fear:

label: Paul
text: For if God spared not the natural branches, [take heed] lest he also spare not thee.

label: Paul
text: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in [his] goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

label: Paul
text: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be graffed in: for God is able to graff them in again.

label: Paul
text: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural [branches], be graffed into their own olive tree?

label: Paul
