text: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.

label: Paul
text: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:

label: Paul
text: For this [is] my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.

label: Paul
text: As concerning the gospel, [they are] enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, [they are] beloved for the fathers’ sakes.

label: Paul
text: For the gifts and calling of God [are] without repentance.

label: Paul
text: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:

label: Paul
text: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.

label: Paul
text: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

label: Paul
text: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God!

label: Paul
text: how unsearchable [are] his judgments, and his ways past finding out!

label: Paul
text: For who hath known the mind of the Lord?

label: Paul
text: or who hath been his counseller?

label: Paul
text: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?

label: Paul
text: For of him, and through him, and to him, [are] all things: to whom [be] glory for ever.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, [which is] your reasonable service.

label: Paul
text: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what [is] that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.

label: Paul
text: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think [of himself] more highly than he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith.

label: Paul
text: For as we have many members in one body, and all members have not the same office:

label: Paul
text: So we, [being] many, are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another.

label: Paul
text: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, [let us prophesy] according to the proportion of faith;

label: Paul
text: Or ministry, [let us wait] on [our] ministering: or he that teacheth, on teaching;

label: Paul
text: Or he that exhorteth, on exhortation: he that giveth, [let him do it] with simplicity; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that sheweth mercy, with cheerfulness.

label: Paul
text: [Let] love be without dissimulation.

label: Paul
text: Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.

label: Paul
text: [Be] kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;

label: Paul
text: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

label: Paul
text: Rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;

label: Paul
text: Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.

label: Paul
text: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.

label: Paul
text: Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.

label: Paul
text: [Be] of the same mind one toward another.

label: Paul
text: Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate.

label: Paul
text: Be not wise in your own conceits.

label: Paul
text: Recompense to no man evil for evil.

label: Paul
text: Provide things honest in the sight of all men.

label: Paul
text: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.

label: Paul
text: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but [rather] give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance [is] mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.

label: Paul
text: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

label: Paul
text: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers.

label: Paul
text: For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.

label: Paul
text: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power, resisteth the ordinance of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation.

label: Paul
text: For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to the evil.

label: Paul
text: Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power?

label: Paul
text: do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same:

label: Paul
text: For he is the minister of God to thee for good.

label: Paul
text: But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minister of God, a revenger to [execute] wrath upon him that doeth evil.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore [ye] must needs be subject, not only for wrath, but also for conscience sake.

label: Paul
text: For for this cause pay ye tribute also: for they are God’s ministers, attending continually upon this very thing.

label: Paul
text: Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute [is due]; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.

label: Paul
text: Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.

label: Paul
text: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Thou shalt not covet; and if [there be] any other commandment, it is briefly comprehended in this saying, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

label: Paul
text: Love worketh no ill to his neighbour: therefore love [is] the fulfilling of the law.

label: Paul
text: And that, knowing the time, that now [it is] high time to awake out of sleep: for now [is] our salvation nearer than when we believed.

label: Paul
text: The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light.

label: Paul
text: Let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.

label: Paul
text: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to [fulfil] the lusts [thereof].

label: Paul
text: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye, [but] not to doubtful disputations.

label: Paul
text: For one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is weak, eateth herbs.

label: Paul
text: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.

label: Paul
text: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant?

label: Paul
text: to his own master he standeth or falleth.

label: Paul
text: Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.

label: Paul
text: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day [alike].

label: Paul
text: Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind.

label: Paul
text: He that regardeth the day, regardeth [it] unto the Lord; and he that regardeth not the day, to the Lord he doth not regard [it].

label: Paul
text: He that eateth, eateth to the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, to the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.

label: Paul
text: For none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.

label: Paul
text: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord’s.

label: Paul
text: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.

label: Paul
text: But why dost thou judge thy brother?

label: Paul
text: or why dost thou set at nought thy brother?

label: Paul
text: for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

label: Paul
text: For it is written, [As] I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.

label: Paul
text: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.

label: Paul
text: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in [his] brother’s way.

label: Paul
text: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that [there is] nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him [it is] unclean.

label: Paul
text: But if thy brother be grieved with [thy] meat, now walkest thou not charitably.

label: Paul
text: Destroy not him with thy meat, for whom Christ died.

label: Paul
text: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:

label: Paul
text: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.

label: Paul
text: For he that in these things serveth Christ [is] acceptable to God, and approved of men.

label: Paul
text: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

label: Paul
text: For meat destroy not the work of God.

label: Paul
text: All things indeed [are] pure; but [it is] evil for that man who eateth with offence.

label: Paul
text: [It is] good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor [any thing] whereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.

label: Paul
text: Hast thou faith?

label: Paul
text: have [it] to thyself before God.

label: Paul
text: Happy [is] he that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.

label: Paul
text: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because [he eateth] not of faith: for whatsoever [is] not of faith is sin.

label: Paul
text: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

label: Paul
text: Let every one of us please [his] neighbour for [his] good to edification.

label: Paul
text: For even Christ pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.

label: Paul
text: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope.

label: Paul
text: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus:

label: Paul
text: That ye may with one mind [and] one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore receive ye one another, as Christ also received us to the glory of God.

label: Paul
text: Now I say that Jesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promises [made] unto the fathers:

label: Paul
text: And that the Gentiles might glorify God for [his] mercy; as it is written, For this cause I will confess to thee among the Gentiles, and sing unto thy name.

label: Paul
text: And again he saith, Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.

label: Paul
text: And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; and laud him, all ye people.

label: Paul
text: And again, Esaias saith, There shall be a root of Jesse, and he that shall rise to reign over the Gentiles; in him shall the Gentiles trust.

label: Paul
text: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.

label: Paul
text: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless, brethren, I have written the more boldly unto you in some sort, as putting you in mind, because of the grace that is given to me of God,

label: Paul
text: That I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Ghost.

label: Paul
text: I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.

label: Paul
text: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me, to make the Gentiles obedient, by word and deed,

label: Paul
text: Through mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God; so that from Jerusalem, and round about unto Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.

label: Paul
text: Yea, so have I strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build upon another man’s foundation:

label: Paul
text: But as it is written, To whom he was not spoken of, they shall see: and they that have not heard shall understand.

label: Paul
text: For which cause also I have been much hindered from coming to you.

label: Paul
text: But now having no more place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come unto you;

label: Paul
text: Whensoever I take my journey into Spain, I will come to you: for I trust to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first I be somewhat filled with your [company].

label: Paul
text: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints.

label: Paul
text: For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem.

label: Paul
text: It hath pleased them verily; and their debtors they are.

label: Paul
text: For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things.

label: Paul
text: When therefore I have performed this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come by you into Spain.

label: Paul
text: And I am sure that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.

label: Paul
text: Now I beseech you, brethren, for the Lord Jesus Christ’s sake, and for the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in [your] prayers to God for me;

label: Paul
text: That I may be delivered from them that do not believe in Judaea; and that my service which [I have] for Jerusalem may be accepted of the saints;

label: Paul
text: That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.

label: Paul
text: Now the God of peace [be] with you all.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: I commend unto you Phebe our sister, which is a servant of the church which is at Cenchrea:

label: Paul
text: That ye receive her in the Lord, as becometh saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever business she hath need of you: for she hath been a succourer of many, and of myself also.

label: Paul
text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila my helpers in Christ Jesus:

label: Paul
text: Who have for my life laid down their own necks: unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.

label: Paul
text: Likewise [greet] the church that is in their house.

label: Paul
text: Salute my wellbeloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ.

label: Paul
text: Greet Mary, who bestowed much labour on us.

label: Paul
text: Salute Andronicus and Junia, my kinsmen, and my fellowprisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

label: Paul
text: Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Salute Urbane, our helper in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.

label: Paul
text: Salute Apelles approved in Christ.

label: Paul
text: Salute them which are of Aristobulus’ [household].

label: Paul
text: Salute Herodion my kinsman.

label: Paul
text: Greet them that be of the [household] of Narcissus, which are in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labour in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Salute the beloved Persis, which laboured much in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Salute Rufus chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

label: Paul
text: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren which are with them.

label: Paul
text: Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints which are with them.

label: Paul
text: Salute one another with an holy kiss.

label: Paul
text: The churches of Christ salute you.

label: Paul
text: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned; and avoid them.

label: Paul
text: For they that are such serve not our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

label: Paul
text: For your obedience is come abroad unto all [men].

label: Paul
text: I am glad therefore on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple concerning evil.

label: Paul
text: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly.

label: Paul
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Timotheus my workfellow, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.

label: Paul
text: I Tertius, who wrote [this] epistle, salute you in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Gaius mine host, and of the whole church, saluteth you.

label: Paul
text: Erastus the chamberlain of the city saluteth you, and Quartus a brother.

label: Paul
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you all.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret since the world began,

label: Paul
text: But now is made manifest, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, made known to all nations for the obedience of faith:

label: Paul
text: To God only wise, [be] glory through Jesus Christ for ever.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Paul, called [to be] an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes [our] brother,

label: Paul
text: Unto the church of God which is at Corinth, to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called [to be] saints, with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours:

label: Paul
text: Grace [be] unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;

label: Paul
text: That in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, and [in] all knowledge;

label: Paul
text: Even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:

label: Paul
text: So that ye come behind in no gift; waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:

label: Paul
text: Who shall also confirm you unto the end, [that ye may be] blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: God [is] faithful, by whom ye were called unto the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

label: Paul
text: Now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and [that] there be no divisions among you; but [that] ye be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.

label: Paul
text: For it hath been declared unto me of you, my brethren, by them [which are of the house] of Chloe, that there are contentions among you.

label: Paul
text: Now this I say, that every one of you saith, I am of Paul; and I of Apollos; and I of Cephas; and I of Christ.

label: Paul
text: Is Christ divided?

label: Paul
text: was Paul crucified for you?

label: Paul
text: or were ye baptized in the name of Paul?

label: Paul
text: I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius;

label: Paul
text: Lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name.

label: Paul
text: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas: besides, I know not whether I baptized any other.

label: Paul
text: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.

label: Paul
text: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.

label: Paul
text: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.

label: Paul
text: Where [is] the wise?

label: Paul
text: where [is] the scribe?

label: Paul
text: where [is] the disputer of this world?

label: Paul
text: hath not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?

label: Paul
text: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.

label: Paul
text: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom:

label: Paul
text: But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness;

label: Paul
text: But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.

label: Paul
text: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.

label: Paul
text: For ye see your calling, brethren, how that not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble, [are called]:

label: Paul
text: But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;

label: Paul
text: And base things of the world, and things which are despised, hath God chosen, [yea], and things which are not, to bring to nought things that are:

label: Paul
text: That no flesh should glory in his presence.

label: Paul
text: But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:

label: Paul
text: That, according as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: And I, brethren, when I came to you, came not with excellency of speech or of wisdom, declaring unto you the testimony of God.

label: Paul
text: For I determined not to know any thing among you, save Jesus Christ, and him crucified.

label: Paul
text: And I was with you in weakness, and in fear, and in much trembling.

label: Paul
text: And my speech and my preaching [was] not with enticing words of man’s wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power:

label: Paul
text: That your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.

label: Paul
text: Howbeit we speak wisdom among them that are perfect: yet not the wisdom of this world, nor of the princes of this world, that come to nought:

label: Paul
text: But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, [even] the hidden [wisdom], which God ordained before the world unto our glory:

label: Paul
text: Which none of the princes of this world knew: for had they known [it], they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

label: Paul
text: But as it is written, Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that love him.

label: Paul
text: But God hath revealed [them] unto us by his Spirit: for the Spirit searcheth all things, yea, the deep things of God.

label: Paul
text: For what man knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him?

label: Paul
text: even so the things of God knoweth no man, but the Spirit of God.

label: Paul
text: Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the spirit which is of God; that we might know the things that are freely given to us of God.

label: Paul
text: Which things also we speak, not in the words which man’s wisdom teacheth, but which the Holy Ghost teacheth; comparing spiritual things with spiritual.

label: Paul
text: But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know [them], because they are spiritually discerned.

label: Paul
text: But he that is spiritual judgeth all things, yet he himself is judged of no man.

label: Paul
text: For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct him?

label: Paul
text: But we have the mind of Christ.

label: Paul
text: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, [even] as unto babes in Christ.

label: Paul
text: I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able [to bear it], neither yet now are ye able.

label: Paul
text: For ye are yet carnal: for whereas [there is] among you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?

label: Paul
text: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I [am] of Apollos; are ye not carnal?

label: Paul
text: Who then is Paul, and who [is] Apollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?

label: Paul
text: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

label: Paul
text: So then neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.

label: Paul
text: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.

label: Paul
text: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God’s husbandry, [ye are] God’s building.

label: Paul
text: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon.

label: Paul
text: But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.

label: Paul
text: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: Now if any man build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;

label: Paul
text: Every man’s work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man’s work of what sort it is.

label: Paul
text: If any man’s work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.

label: Paul
text: If any man’s work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.

label: Paul
text: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and [that] the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?

label: Paul
text: If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which [temple] ye are.

label: Paul
text: Let no man deceive himself.

label: Paul
text: If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.

label: Paul
text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God.

label: Paul
text: For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

label: Paul
text: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.

label: Paul
text: Therefore let no man glory in men.

label: Paul
text: For all things are yours;

label: Paul
text: Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;

label: Paul
text: And ye are Christ’s; and Christ [is] God’s.

label: Paul
text: Let a man so account of us, as of the ministers of Christ, and stewards of the mysteries of God.

label: Paul
text: Moreover it is required in stewards, that a man be found faithful.

label: Paul
text: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged of you, or of man’s judgment: yea, I judge not mine own self.

label: Paul
text: For I know nothing by myself; yet am I not hereby justified: but he that judgeth me is the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord come, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then shall every man have praise of God.

label: Paul
text: And these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself and [to] Apollos for your sakes; that ye might learn in us not to think [of men] above that which is written, that no one of you be puffed up for one against another.

label: Paul
text: For who maketh thee to differ [from another]?

label: Paul
text: and what hast thou that thou didst not receive?

label: Paul
text: now if thou didst receive [it], why dost thou glory, as if thou hadst not received [it]?

label: Paul
text: Now ye are full, now ye are rich, ye have reigned as kings without us: and I would to God ye did reign, that we also might reign with you.

label: Paul
text: For I think that God hath set forth us the apostles last, as it were appointed to death: for we are made a spectacle unto the world, and to angels, and to men.

label: Paul
text: We [are] fools for Christ’s sake, but ye [are] wise in Christ; we [are] weak, but ye [are] strong; ye [are] honourable, but we [are] despised.

label: Paul
text: Even unto this present hour we both hunger, and thirst, and are naked, and are buffeted, and have no certain dwellingplace;

label: Paul
text: And labour, working with our own hands: being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we suffer it:

label: Paul
text: Being defamed, we intreat: we are made as the filth of the world, [and are] the offscouring of all things unto this day.

label: Paul
text: I write not these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn [you].

label: Paul
text: For though ye have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet [have ye] not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.

label: Paul
text: For this cause have I sent unto you Timotheus, who is my beloved son, and faithful in the Lord, who shall bring you into remembrance of my ways which be in Christ, as I teach every where in every church.

label: Paul
text: Now some are puffed up, as though I would not come to you.

label: Paul
text: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord will, and will know, not the speech of them which are puffed up, but the power.

label: Paul
text: For the kingdom of God [is] not in word, but in power.

label: Paul
text: What will ye?

label: Paul
text: shall I come unto you with a rod, or in love, and [in] the spirit of meekness?

label: Paul
text: It is reported commonly [that there is] fornication among you, and such fornication as is not so much as named among the Gentiles, that one should have his father’s wife.

label: Paul
text: And ye are puffed up, and have not rather mourned, that he that hath done this deed might be taken away from among you.

label: Paul
text: For I verily, as absent in body, but present in spirit, have judged already, as though I were present, [concerning] him that hath so done this deed,

label: Paul
text: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when ye are gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,

label: Paul
text: To deliver such an one unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Your glorying [is] not good.

label: Paul
text: Know ye not that a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump?

label: Paul
text: Purge out therefore the old leaven, that ye may be a new lump, as ye are unleavened.

label: Paul
text: For even Christ our passover is sacrificed for us:

label: Paul
text: Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old leaven, neither with the leaven of malice and wickedness; but with the unleavened [bread] of sincerity and truth.

label: Paul
text: I wrote unto you in an epistle not to company with fornicators:

label: Paul
text: Yet not altogether with the fornicators of this world, or with the covetous, or extortioners, or with idolaters; for then must ye needs go out of the world.

label: Paul
text: But now I have written unto you not to keep company, if any man that is called a brother be a fornicator, or covetous, or an idolater, or a railer, or a drunkard, or an extortioner; with such an one no not to eat.

label: Paul
text: For what have I to do to judge them also that are without?

label: Paul
text: do not ye judge them that are within?

label: Paul
text: But them that are without God judgeth.

label: Paul
text: Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.

label: Paul
text: Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to law before the unjust, and not before the saints?

label: Paul
text: Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world?

label: Paul
text: and if the world shall be judged by you, are ye unworthy to judge the smallest matters?

label: Paul
text: Know ye not that we shall judge angels?

label: Paul
text: how much more things that pertain to this life?

label: Paul
text: If then ye have judgments of things pertaining to this life, set them to judge who are least esteemed in the church.

label: Paul
text: I speak to your shame.

label: Paul
text: Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you?

label: Paul
text: no, not one that shall be able to judge between his brethren?

label: Paul
text: But brother goeth to law with brother, and that before the unbelievers.

label: Paul
text: Now therefore there is utterly a fault among you, because ye go to law one with another.

label: Paul
text: Why do ye not rather take wrong?

label: Paul
text: why do ye not rather [suffer yourselves to] be defrauded?

label: Paul
text: Nay, ye do wrong, and defraud, and that [your] brethren.

label: Paul
text: Know ye not that the unrighteous shall not inherit the kingdom of God?

label: Paul
text: Be not deceived: neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor effeminate, nor abusers of themselves with mankind,

label: Paul
text: Nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners, shall inherit the kingdom of God.

label: Paul
text: And such were some of you: but ye are washed, but ye are sanctified, but ye are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus, and by the Spirit of our God.

label: Paul
text: All things are lawful unto me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.

label: Paul
text: Meats for the belly, and the belly for meats: but God shall destroy both it and them.

label: Paul
text: Now the body [is] not for fornication, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.

label: Paul
text: And God hath both raised up the Lord, and will also raise up us by his own power.

label: Paul
text: Know ye not that your bodies are the members of Christ?

label: Paul
text: shall I then take the members of Christ, and make [them] the members of an harlot?

label: Paul
text: God forbid.

label: Paul
text: What?

label: Paul
text: know ye not that he which is joined to an harlot is one body?

label: Paul
text: for two, saith he, shall be one flesh.

label: Paul
text: But he that is joined unto the Lord is one spirit.

label: Paul
text: Flee fornication.

label: Paul
text: Every sin that a man doeth is without the body; but he that committeth fornication sinneth against his own body.

label: Paul
text: What?

label: Paul
text: know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost [which is] in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own?

label: Paul
text: For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God’s.

label: Paul
text: Now concerning the things whereof ye wrote unto me: [It is] good for a man not to touch a woman.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless, [to avoid] fornication, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.

label: Paul
text: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise also the wife unto the husband.

label: Paul
text: The wife hath not power of her own body, but the husband: and likewise also the husband hath not power of his own body, but the wife.

label: Paul
text: Defraud ye not one the other, except [it be] with consent for a time, that ye may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and come together again, that Satan tempt you not for your incontinency.

label: Paul
text: But I speak this by permission, [and] not of commandment.

label: Paul
text: For I would that all men were even as I myself.

label: Paul
text: But every man hath his proper gift of God, one after this manner, and another after that.

label: Paul
text: I say therefore to the unmarried and widows, It is good for them if they abide even as I.

label: Paul
text: But if they cannot contain, let them marry: for it is better to marry than to burn.

label: Paul
text: And unto the married I command, [yet] not I, but the Lord, Let not the wife depart from [her] husband:

label: Paul
text: But and if she depart, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to [her] husband: and let not the husband put away [his] wife.

label: Paul
text: But to the rest speak I, not the Lord: If any brother hath a wife that believeth not, and she be pleased to dwell with him, let him not put her away.

label: Paul
text: And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he be pleased to dwell with her, let her not leave him.

label: Paul
text: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband: else were your children unclean; but now are they holy.

label: Paul
text: But if the unbelieving depart, let him depart.

label: Paul
text: A brother or a sister is not under bondage in such [cases]: but God hath called us to peace.

label: Paul
text: For what knowest thou, O wife, whether thou shalt save [thy] husband?

label: Paul
text: or how knowest thou, O man, whether thou shalt save [thy] wife?

label: Paul
text: But as God hath distributed to every man, as the Lord hath called every one, so let him walk.

label: Paul
text: And so ordain I in all churches.

label: Paul
text: Is any man called being circumcised?

label: Paul
text: let him not become uncircumcised.

label: Paul
text: Is any called in uncircumcision?

label: Paul
text: let him not be circumcised.

label: Paul
text: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.

label: Paul
text: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called.

label: Paul
text: Art thou called [being] a servant?

label: Paul
text: care not for it: but if thou mayest be made free, use [it] rather.

label: Paul
text: For he that is called in the Lord, [being] a servant, is the Lord’s freeman: likewise also he that is called, [being] free, is Christ’s servant.

label: Paul
text: Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, let every man, wherein he is called, therein abide with God.

label: Paul
text: Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet I give my judgment, as one that hath obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.

label: Paul
text: I suppose therefore that this is good for the present distress, [I say], that [it is] good for a man so to be.

label: Paul
text: Art thou bound unto a wife?

label: Paul
text: seek not to be loosed.

label: Paul
text: Art thou loosed from a wife?

label: Paul
text: seek not a wife.

label: Paul
text: But and if thou marry, thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin marry, she hath not sinned.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless such shall have trouble in the flesh: but I spare you.

label: Paul
text: But this I say, brethren, the time [is] short: it remaineth, that both they that have wives be as though they had none;

label: Paul
text: And they that weep, as though they wept not; and they that rejoice, as though they rejoiced not; and they that buy, as though they possessed not;

label: Paul
text: And they that use this world, as not abusing [it]: for the fashion of this world passeth away.

label: Paul
text: But I would have you without carefulness.

label: Paul
text: He that is unmarried careth for the things that belong to the Lord, how he may please the Lord:

label: Paul
text: But he that is married careth for the things that are of the world, how he may please [his] wife.

label: Paul
text: There is difference [also] between a wife and a virgin.

label: Paul
text: The unmarried woman careth for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit: but she that is married careth for the things of the world, how she may please [her] husband.

label: Paul
text: And this I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a snare upon you, but for that which is comely, and that ye may attend upon the Lord without distraction.

label: Paul
text: But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of [her] age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in his heart, having no necessity, but hath power over his own will, and hath so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, doeth well.

label: Paul
text: So then he that giveth [her] in marriage doeth well; but he that giveth [her] not in marriage doeth better.

label: Paul
text: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: But she is happier if she so abide, after my judgment: and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.

label: Paul
text: Now as touching things offered unto idols, we know that we all have knowledge.

label: Paul
text: Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.

label: Paul
text: And if any man think that he knoweth any thing, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.

label: Paul
text: But if any man love God, the same is known of him.

label: Paul
text: As concerning therefore the eating of those things that are offered in sacrifice unto idols, we know that an idol [is] nothing in the world, and that [there is] none other God but one.

label: Paul
text: For though there be that are called gods, whether in heaven or in earth, (as there be gods many, and lords many,)

label: Paul
text: But to us [there is but] one God, the Father, of whom [are] all things, and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom [are] all things, and we by him.

label: Paul
text: Howbeit [there is] not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat [it] as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

label: Paul
text: But meat commendeth us not to God: for neither, if we eat, are we the better; neither, if we eat not, are we the worse.

label: Paul
text: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of yours become a stumblingblock to them that are weak.

label: Paul
text: For if any man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in the idol’s temple, shall not the conscience of him which is weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols;

label: Paul
text: And through thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?

label: Paul
text: But when ye sin so against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, if meat make my brother to offend, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth, lest I make my brother to offend.

label: Paul
text: Am I not an apostle?

label: Paul
text: am I not free?

label: Paul
text: have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord?

label: Paul
text: are not ye my work in the Lord?

label: Paul
text: If I be not an apostle unto others, yet doubtless I am to you: for the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Mine answer to them that do examine me is this,

label: Paul
text: Have we not power to eat and to drink?

label: Paul
text: Have we not power to lead about a sister, a wife, as well as other apostles, and [as] the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?

label: Paul
text: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?

label: Paul
text: Who goeth a warfare any time at his own charges?

label: Paul
text: who planteth a vineyard, and eateth not of the fruit thereof?

label: Paul
text: or who feedeth a flock, and eateth not of the milk of the flock?

label: Paul
text: Say I these things as a man?

label: Paul
text: or saith not the law the same also?

label: Paul
text: For it is written in the law of Moses, Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn.

label: Paul
text: Doth God take care for oxen?

label: Paul
text: Or saith he [it] altogether for our sakes?

label: Paul
text: For our sakes, no doubt, [this] is written: that he that ploweth should plow in hope; and that he that thresheth in hope should be partaker of his hope.

label: Paul
text: If we have sown unto you spiritual things, [is it] a great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?

label: Paul
text: If others be partakers of [this] power over you, [are] not we rather?

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless we have not used this power; but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.

label: Paul
text: Do ye not know that they which minister about holy things live [of the things] of the temple?

label: Paul
text: and they which wait at the altar are partakers with the altar?

label: Paul
text: Even so hath the Lord ordained that they which preach the gospel should live of the gospel.

label: Paul
text: But I have used none of these things: neither have I written these things, that it should be so done unto me: for [it were] better for me to die, than that any man should make my glorying void.

label: Paul
text: For though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to glory of: for necessity is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the gospel!

label: Paul
text: For if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward: but if against my will, a dispensation [of the gospel] is committed unto me.

label: Paul
text: What is my reward then?

label: Paul
text: [Verily] that, when I preach the gospel, I may make the gospel of Christ without charge, that I abuse not my power in the gospel.

label: Paul
text: For though I be free from all [men], yet have I made myself servant unto all, that I might gain the more.

label: Paul
text: And unto the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might gain the Jews; to them that are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain them that are under the law;

label: Paul
text: To them that are without law, as without law, (being not without law to God, but under the law to Christ,) that I might gain them that are without law.

label: Paul
text: To the weak became I as weak, that I might gain the weak: I am made all things to all [men], that I might by all means save some.

label: Paul
text: And this I do for the gospel’s sake, that I might be partaker thereof with [you].

label: Paul
text: Know ye not that they which run in a race run all, but one receiveth the prize?

label: Paul
text: So run, that ye may obtain.

label: Paul
text: And every man that striveth for the mastery is temperate in all things.

label: Paul
text: Now they [do it] to obtain a corruptible crown; but we an incorruptible.

label: Paul
text: I therefore so run, not as uncertainly; so fight I, not as one that beateth the air:

label: Paul
text: But I keep under my body, and bring [it] into subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.

label: Paul
text: Moreover, brethren, I would not that ye should be ignorant, how that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;

label: Paul
text: And were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

label: Paul
text: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;

label: Paul
text: And did all drink the same spiritual drink: for they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them: and that Rock was Christ.

label: Paul
text: But with many of them God was not well pleased: for they were overthrown in the wilderness.

label: Paul
text: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.

label: Paul
text: Neither be ye idolaters, as [were] some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.

label: Paul
text: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.

label: Paul
text: Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed of serpents.

label: Paul
text: Neither murmur ye, as some of them also murmured, and were destroyed of the destroyer.

label: Paul
text: Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

label: Paul
text: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God [is] faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear [it].

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.

label: Paul
text: I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.

label: Paul
text: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ?

label: Paul
text: The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?

label: Paul
text: For we [being] many are one bread, [and] one body: for we are all partakers of that one bread.

label: Paul
text: Behold Israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?

label: Paul
text: What say I then?

label: Paul
text: that the idol is any thing, or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is any thing?

label: Paul
text: But [I say], that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, and not to God: and I would not that ye should have fellowship with devils.

label: Paul
text: Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord, and the cup of devils: ye cannot be partakers of the Lord’s table, and of the table of devils.

label: Paul
text: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy?

label: Paul
text: are we stronger than he?

label: Paul
text: All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but all things edify not.

label: Paul
text: Let no man seek his own, but every man another’s [wealth].

label: Paul
text: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, [that] eat, asking no question for conscience sake:

label: Paul
text: For the earth [is] the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof.

label: Paul
text: If any of them that believe not bid you [to a feast], and ye be disposed to go; whatsoever is set before you, eat, asking no question for conscience sake.

label: Paul
text: But if any man say unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, eat not for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake: for the earth [is] the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof:

label: Paul
text: Conscience, I say, not thine own, but of the other: for why is my liberty judged of another [man’s] conscience?

label: Paul
text: For if I by grace be a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?

label: Paul
text: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.

label: Paul
text: Give none offence, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the church of God:

label: Paul
text: Even as I please all [men] in all [things], not seeking mine own profit, but the [profit] of many, that they may be saved.

label: Paul
text: Be ye followers of me, even as I also [am] of Christ.

label: Paul
text: Now I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I delivered [them] to you.

label: Paul
text: But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman [is] the man; and the head of Christ [is] God.

label: Paul
text: Every man praying or prophesying, having [his] head covered, dishonoureth his head.

label: Paul
text: But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with [her] head uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaven.

label: Paul
text: For if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.

label: Paul
text: For a man indeed ought not to cover [his] head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.

label: Paul
text: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.

label: Paul
text: Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.

label: Paul
text: For this cause ought the woman to have power on [her] head because of the angels.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: For as the woman [is] of the man, even so [is] the man also by the woman; but all things of God.

label: Paul
text: Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?

label: Paul
text: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?

label: Paul
text: But if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for [her] hair is given her for a covering.

label: Paul
text: But if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.

label: Paul
text: Now in this that I declare [unto you] I praise [you] not, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.

label: Paul
text: For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.

label: Paul
text: For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.

label: Paul
text: When ye come together therefore into one place, [this] is not to eat the Lord’s supper.

label: Paul
text: For in eating every one taketh before [other] his own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.

label: Paul
text: What?

label: Paul
text: have ye not houses to eat and to drink in?

label: Paul
text: or despise ye the church of God, and shame them that have not?

label: Paul
text: What shall I say to you?

label: Paul
text: shall I praise you in this?

label: Paul
text: I praise [you] not.

label: Paul
text: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the [same] night in which he was betrayed took bread:

label: Paul
text: And when he had given thanks, he brake [it], and said, Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you: this do in remembrance of me.

label: Paul
text: After the same manner also [he took] the cup, when he had supped, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as oft as ye drink [it], in remembrance of me.

label: Paul
text: For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do shew the Lord’s death till he come.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread, and drink [this] cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.

label: Paul
text: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of [that] bread, and drink of [that] cup.

label: Paul
text: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body.

label: Paul
text: For this cause many [are] weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.

label: Paul
text: For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.

label: Paul
text: But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.

label: Paul
text: And if any man hunger, let him eat at home; that ye come not together unto condemnation.

label: Paul
text: And the rest will I set in order when I come.

label: Paul
text: Now concerning spiritual [gifts], brethren, I would not have you ignorant.

label: Paul
text: Ye know that ye were Gentiles, carried away unto these dumb idols, even as ye were led.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore I give you to understand, that no man speaking by the Spirit of God calleth Jesus accursed: and [that] no man can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the Holy Ghost.

label: Paul
text: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.

label: Paul
text: And there are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.

label: Paul
text: And there are diversities of operations, but it is the same God which worketh all in all.

label: Paul
text: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal.

label: Paul
text: For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit;

label: Paul
text: To another faith by the same Spirit; to another the gifts of healing by the same Spirit;

label: Paul
text: To another the working of miracles; to another prophecy; to another discerning of spirits; to another [divers] kinds of tongues; to another the interpretation of tongues:

label: Paul
text: But all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.

label: Paul
text: For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body: so also [is] Christ.

label: Paul
text: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether [we be] Jews or Gentiles, whether [we be] bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.

label: Paul
text: For the body is not one member, but many.

label: Paul
text: If the foot shall say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

label: Paul
text: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

label: Paul
text: If the whole body [were] an eye, where [were] the hearing?

label: Paul
text: If the whole [were] hearing, where [were] the smelling?

label: Paul
text: But now hath God set the members every one of them in the body, as it hath pleased him.

label: Paul
text: And if they were all one member, where [were] the body?

label: Paul
text: But now [are they] many members, yet but one body.

label: Paul
text: And the eye cannot say unto the hand, I have no need of thee: nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

label: Paul
text: Nay, much more those members of the body, which seem to be more feeble, are necessary:

label: Paul
text: And those [members] of the body, which we think to be less honourable, upon these we bestow more abundant honour; and our uncomely [parts] have more abundant comeliness.

label: Paul
text: For our comely [parts] have no need: but God hath tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to that [part] which lacked:

label: Paul
text: That there should be no schism in the body; but [that] the members should have the same care one for another.

label: Paul
text: And whether one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; or one member be honoured, all the members rejoice with it.

label: Paul
text: Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.

label: Paul
text: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of tongues.

label: Paul
text: [Are] all apostles?

label: Paul
text: [are] all prophets?

label: Paul
text: [are] all teachers?

label: Paul
text: [are] all workers of miracles?

label: Paul
text: Have all the gifts of healing?

label: Paul
text: do all speak with tongues?

label: Paul
text: do all interpret?

label: Paul
text: But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a more excellent way.

label: Paul
text: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am become [as] sounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal.

label: Paul
text: And though I have [the gift of] prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.

label: Paul
text: And though I bestow all my goods to feed [the poor], and though I give my body to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me nothing.

label: Paul
text: Charity suffereth long, [and] is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,

label: Paul
text: Doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;

label: Paul
text: Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;

label: Paul
text: Beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.

label: Paul
text: Charity never faileth: but whether [there be] prophecies, they shall fail; whether [there be] tongues, they shall cease; whether [there be] knowledge, it shall vanish away.

label: Paul
text: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.

label: Paul
text: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.

label: Paul
text: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.

label: Paul
text: For now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.

label: Paul
text: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these [is] charity.

label: Paul
text: Follow after charity, and desire spiritual [gifts], but rather that ye may prophesy.

label: Paul
text: For he that speaketh in an [unknown] tongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God: for no man understandeth [him]; howbeit in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.

label: Paul
text: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men [to] edification, and exhortation, and comfort.

label: Paul
text: He that speaketh in an [unknown] tongue edifieth himself; but he that prophesieth edifieth the church.

label: Paul
text: I would that ye all spake with tongues, but rather that ye prophesied: for greater [is] he that prophesieth than he that speaketh with tongues, except he interpret, that the church may receive edifying.

label: Paul
text: Now, brethren, if I come unto you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, except I shall speak to you either by revelation, or by knowledge, or by prophesying, or by doctrine?

label: Paul
text: And even things without life giving sound, whether pipe or harp, except they give a distinction in the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?

label: Paul
text: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?

label: Paul
text: So likewise ye, except ye utter by the tongue words easy to be understood, how shall it be known what is spoken?

label: Paul
text: for ye shall speak into the air.

label: Paul
text: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of them [is] without signification.

label: Paul
text: Therefore if I know not the meaning of the voice, I shall be unto him that speaketh a barbarian, and he that speaketh [shall be] a barbarian unto me.

label: Paul
text: Even so ye, forasmuch as ye are zealous of spiritual [gifts], seek that ye may excel to the edifying of the church.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore let him that speaketh in an [unknown] tongue pray that he may interpret.

label: Paul
text: For if I pray in an [unknown] tongue, my spirit prayeth, but my understanding is unfruitful.

label: Paul
text: What is it then?

label: Paul
text: I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also: I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.

label: Paul
text: Else when thou shalt bless with the spirit, how shall he that occupieth the room of the unlearned say Amen at thy giving of thanks, seeing he understandeth not what thou sayest?

label: Paul
text: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.

label: Paul
text: I thank my God, I speak with tongues more than ye all:

label: Paul
text: Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that [by my voice] I might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an [unknown] tongue.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, be not children in understanding: howbeit in malice be ye children, but in understanding be men.

label: Paul
text: In the law it is written, With [men of] other tongues and other lips will I speak unto this people; and yet for all that will they not hear me, saith the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore tongues are for a sign, not to them that believe, but to them that believe not: but prophesying [serveth] not for them that believe not, but for them which believe.

label: Paul
text: If therefore the whole church be come together into one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in [those that are] unlearned, or unbelievers, will they not say that ye are mad?

label: Paul
text: But if all prophesy, and there come in one that believeth not, or [one] unlearned, he is convinced of all, he is judged of all:

label: Paul
text: And thus are the secrets of his heart made manifest; and so falling down on [his] face he will worship God, and report that God is in you of a truth.

label: Paul
text: How is it then, brethren?

label: Paul
text: when ye come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation, hath an interpretation.

label: Paul
text: Let all things be done unto edifying.

label: Paul
text: If any man speak in an [unknown] tongue, [let it be] by two, or at the most [by] three, and [that] by course; and let one interpret.

label: Paul
text: But if there be no interpreter, let him keep silence in the church; and let him speak to himself, and to God.

label: Paul
text: Let the prophets speak two or three, and let the other judge.

label: Paul
text: If [any thing] be revealed to another that sitteth by, let the first hold his peace.

label: Paul
text: For ye may all prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be comforted.

label: Paul
text: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.

label: Paul
text: For God is not [the author] of confusion, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.

label: Paul
text: Let your women keep silence in the churches: for it is not permitted unto them to speak; but [they are commanded] to be under obedience, as also saith the law.

label: Paul
text: And if they will learn any thing, let them ask their husbands at home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.

label: Paul
text: What?

label: Paul
text: came the word of God out from you?

label: Paul
text: or came it unto you only?

label: Paul
text: If any man think himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things that I write unto you are the commandments of the Lord.

label: Paul
text: But if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, brethren, covet to prophesy, and forbid not to speak with tongues.

label: Paul
text: Let all things be done decently and in order.

label: Paul
text: Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;

label: Paul
text: By which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain.

label: Paul
text: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures;

label: Paul
text: And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:

label: Paul
text: And that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve:

label: Paul
text: After that, he was seen of above five hundred brethren at once; of whom the greater part remain unto this present, but some are fallen asleep.

label: Paul
text: After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.

label: Paul
text: And last of all he was seen of me also, as of one born out of due time.

label: Paul
text: For I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

label: Paul
text: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which [was bestowed] upon me was not in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

label: Paul
text: Therefore whether [it were] I or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.

label: Paul
text: Now if Christ be preached that he rose from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?

label: Paul
text: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then is Christ not risen:

label: Paul
text: And if Christ be not risen, then [is] our preaching vain, and your faith [is] also vain.

label: Paul
text: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we have testified of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead rise not.

label: Paul
text: For if the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised:

label: Paul
text: And if Christ be not raised, your faith [is] vain; ye are yet in your sins.

label: Paul
text: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.

label: Paul
text: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.

label: Paul
text: But now is Christ risen from the dead, [and] become the firstfruits of them that slept.

label: Paul
text: For since by man [came] death, by man [came] also the resurrection of the dead.

label: Paul
text: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.

label: Paul
text: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ’s at his coming.

label: Paul
text: Then [cometh] the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.

label: Paul
text: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.

label: Paul
text: The last enemy [that] shall be destroyed [is] death.

label: Paul
text: For he hath put all things under his feet.

label: Paul
text: But when he saith, all things are put under [him, it is] manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.

label: Paul
text: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.

label: Paul
text: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all?

label: Paul
text: why are they then baptized for the dead?

label: Paul
text: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?

label: Paul
text: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.

label: Paul
text: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not?

label: Paul
text: let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.

label: Paul
text: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.

label: Paul
text: Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speak [this] to your shame.

label: Paul
text: But some [man] will say, How are the dead raised up?

label: Paul
text: and with what body do they come?

label: Paul
text: [Thou] fool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:

label: Paul
text: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other [grain]:

label: Paul
text: But God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.

label: Paul
text: All flesh [is] not the same flesh: but [there is] one [kind of] flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes, [and] another of birds.

label: Paul
text: [There are] also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial [is] one, and the [glory] of the terrestrial [is] another.

label: Paul
text: [There is] one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: for [one] star differeth from [another] star in glory.

label: Paul
text: So also [is] the resurrection of the dead.

label: Paul
text: It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:

label: Paul
text: It is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:

label: Paul
text: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body.

label: Paul
text: There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.

label: Paul
text: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam [was made] a quickening spirit.

label: Paul
text: Howbeit that [was] not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.

label: Paul
text: The first man [is] of the earth, earthy: the second man [is] the Lord from heaven.

label: Paul
text: As [is] the earthy, such [are] they also that are earthy: and as [is] the heavenly, such [are] they also that are heavenly.

label: Paul
text: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.

label: Paul
text: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.

label: Paul
text: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

label: Paul
text: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

label: Paul
text: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal [must] put on immortality.

label: Paul
text: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.

label: Paul
text: O death, where [is] thy sting?

label: Paul
text: O grave, where [is] thy victory?

label: Paul
text: The sting of death [is] sin; and the strength of sin [is] the law.

label: Paul
text: But thanks [be] to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.

label: Paul
text: Upon the first [day] of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as [God] hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.

label: Paul
text: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by [your] letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.

label: Paul
text: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.

label: Paul
text: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

label: Paul
text: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.

label: Paul
text: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

label: Paul
text: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.

label: Paul
text: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and [there are] many adversaries.

label: Paul
text: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also [do].

label: Paul
text: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.

label: Paul
text: As touching [our] brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.

label: Paul
text: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

label: Paul
text: Let all your things be done with charity.

label: Paul
text: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and [that] they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)

label: Paul
text: That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with [us], and laboureth.

label: Paul
text: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.

label: Paul
text: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.

label: Paul
text: The churches of Asia salute you.

label: Paul
text: Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

label: Paul
text: All the brethren greet you.

label: Paul
text: Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.

label: Paul
text: The salutation of [me] Paul with mine own hand.

label: Paul
text: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.

label: Paul
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you.

label: Paul
text: My love [be] with you all in Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy [our] brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:

label: Paul
text: Grace [be] to you and peace from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: Blessed [be] God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;

label: Paul
text: Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.

label: Paul
text: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.

label: Paul
text: And whether we be afflicted, [it is] for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, [it is] for your consolation and salvation.

label: Paul
text: And our hope of you [is] stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so [shall ye be] also of the consolation.

label: Paul
text: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:

label: Paul
text: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:

label: Paul
text: Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver [us];

label: Paul
text: Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift [bestowed] upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.

label: Paul
text: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.

label: Paul
text: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;

label: Paul
text: As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also [are] ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.

label: Paul
text: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;

label: Paul
