text: And to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judaea.

label: Paul
text: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness?

label: Paul
text: or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?

label: Paul
text: But [as] God [is] true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.

label: Paul
text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, [even] by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.

label: Paul
text: For all the promises of God in him [are] yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.

label: Paul
text: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, [is] God;

label: Paul
text: Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

label: Paul
text: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.

label: Paul
text: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.

label: Paul
text: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.

label: Paul
text: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?

label: Paul
text: And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is [the joy] of you all.

label: Paul
text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.

label: Paul
text: But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.

label: Paul
text: Sufficient to such a man [is] this punishment, which [was inflicted] of many.

label: Paul
text: So that contrariwise ye [ought] rather to forgive [him], and comfort [him], lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm [your] love toward him.

label: Paul
text: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.

label: Paul
text: To whom ye forgive any thing, I [forgive] also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave [it], for your sakes [forgave I it] in the person of Christ;

label: Paul
text: Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.

label: Paul
text: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to [preach] Christ’s gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,

label: Paul
text: I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.

label: Paul
text: Now thanks [be] unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.

label: Paul
text: For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:

label: Paul
text: To the one [we are] the savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life.

label: Paul
text: And who [is] sufficient for these things?

label: Paul
text: For we are not as many, which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.

label: Paul
text: Do we begin again to commend ourselves?

label: Paul
text: or need we, as some [others], epistles of commendation to you, or [letters] of commendation from you?

label: Paul
text: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:

label: Paul
text: [Forasmuch as ye are] manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.

label: Paul
text: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:

label: Paul
text: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency [is] of God;

label: Paul
text: Who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.

label: Paul
text: But if the ministration of death, written [and] engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which [glory] was to be done away:

label: Paul
text: How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?

label: Paul
text: For if the ministration of condemnation [be] glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.

label: Paul
text: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.

label: Paul
text: For if that which is done away [was] glorious, much more that which remaineth [is] glorious.

label: Paul
text: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:

label: Paul
text: And not as Moses, [which] put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:

label: Paul
text: But their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which [vail] is done away in Christ.

label: Paul
text: But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

label: Paul
text: Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord [is], there [is] liberty.

label: Paul
text: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, [even] as by the Spirit of the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;

label: Paul
text: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.

label: Paul
text: But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:

label: Paul
text: In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

label: Paul
text: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus’ sake.

label: Paul
text: For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to [give] the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.

label: Paul
text: [We are] troubled on every side, yet not distressed; [we are] perplexed, but not in despair;

label: Paul
text: Persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;

label: Paul
text: Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.

label: Paul
text: For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus’ sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.

label: Paul
text: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

label: Paul
text: We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;

label: Paul
text: Knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present [us] with you.

label: Paul
text: For all things [are] for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.

label: Paul
text: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward [man] is renewed day by day.

label: Paul
text: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding [and] eternal weight of glory;

label: Paul
text: While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen [are] temporal; but the things which are not seen [are] eternal.

label: Paul
text: For we know that if our earthly house of [this] tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

label: Paul
text: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:

label: Paul
text: If so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.

label: Paul
text: For we that are in [this] tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

label: Paul
text: Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing [is] God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.

label: Paul
text: Therefore [we are] always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:

label: Paul
text: (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)

label: Paul
text: We are confident, [I say], and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.

label: Paul
text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things [done] in [his] body, according to that he hath done, whether [it be] good or bad.

label: Paul
text: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.

label: Paul
text: For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to [answer] them which glory in appearance, and not in heart.

label: Paul
text: For whether we be beside ourselves, [it is] to God: or whether we be sober, [it is] for your cause.

label: Paul
text: For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:

label: Paul
text: And [that] he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we [him] no more.

label: Paul
text: Therefore if any man [be] in Christ, [he is] a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

label: Paul
text: And all things [are] of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;

label: Paul
text: To wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.

label: Paul
text: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech [you] by us: we pray [you] in Christ’s stead, be ye reconciled to God.

label: Paul
text: For he hath made him [to be] sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.

label: Paul
text: We then, [as] workers together [with him], beseech [you] also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.

label: Paul
text: (For he saith, I have heard thee in a time accepted, and in the day of salvation have I succoured thee: behold, now [is] the accepted time; behold, now [is] the day of salvation.)

label: Paul
text: Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:

label: Paul
text: But in all [things] approving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,

label: Paul
text: In stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;

label: Paul
text: By pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,

label: Paul
text: By the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,

label: Paul
text: By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, and [yet] true;

label: Paul
text: As unknown, and [yet] well known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;

label: Paul
text: As sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and [yet] possessing all things.

label: Paul
text: O [ye] Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.

label: Paul
text: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.

label: Paul
text: Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto [my] children,) be ye also enlarged.

label: Paul
text: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness?

label: Paul
text: and what communion hath light with darkness?

label: Paul
text: And what concord hath Christ with Belial?

label: Paul
text: or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?

label: Paul
text: And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols?

label: Paul
text: for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk in [them]; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean [thing]; and I will receive you,

label: Paul
text: And will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.

label: Paul
text: Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

label: Paul
text: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.

label: Paul
text: I speak not [this] to condemn [you]: for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live with [you].

label: Paul
text: Great [is] my boldness of speech toward you, great [is] my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.

label: Paul
text: For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without [were] fightings, within [were] fears.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;

label: Paul
text: And not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.

label: Paul
text: For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, though [it were] but for a season.

label: Paul
text: Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.

label: Paul
text: For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

label: Paul
text: For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea, [what] clearing of yourselves, yea, [what] indignation, yea, [what] fear, yea, [what] vehement desire, yea, [what] zeal, yea, [what] revenge!

label: Paul
text: In all [things] ye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, though I wrote unto you, [I did it] not for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.

label: Paul
text: Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.

label: Paul
text: For if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spake all things to you in truth, even so our boasting, which [I made] before Titus, is found a truth.

label: Paul
text: And his inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.

label: Paul
text: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all [things].

label: Paul
text: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;

label: Paul
text: How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.

label: Paul
text: For to [their] power, I bear record, yea, and beyond [their] power [they were] willing of themselves;

label: Paul
text: Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and [take upon us] the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.

label: Paul
text: And [this they did], not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.

label: Paul
text: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.

label: Paul
text: Therefore, as ye abound in every [thing, in] faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and [in] all diligence, and [in] your love to us, [see] that ye abound in this grace also.

label: Paul
text: I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.

label: Paul
text: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.

label: Paul
text: And herein I give [my] advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.

label: Paul
text: Now therefore perform the doing [of it]; that as [there was] a readiness to will, so [there may be] a performance also out of that which ye have.

label: Paul
text: For if there be first a willing mind, [it is] accepted according to that a man hath, [and] not according to that he hath not.

label: Paul
text: For [I mean] not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:

label: Paul
text: But by an equality, [that] now at this time your abundance [may be a supply] for their want, that their abundance also may be [a supply] for your want: that there may be equality:

label: Paul
text: As it is written, He that [had gathered] much had nothing over; and he that [had gathered] little had no lack.

label: Paul
text: But thanks [be] to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.

label: Paul
text: For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.

label: Paul
text: And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise [is] in the gospel throughout all the churches;

label: Paul
text: And not [that] only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and [declaration of] your ready mind:

label: Paul
text: Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:

label: Paul
text: Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

label: Paul
text: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which [I have] in you.

label: Paul
text: Whether [any do inquire] of Titus, [he is] my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren [be inquired of, they are] the messengers of the churches, [and] the glory of Christ.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.

label: Paul
text: For as touching the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:

label: Paul
text: For I know the forwardness of your mind, for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal hath provoked very many.

label: Paul
text: Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:

label: Paul
text: Lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.

label: Paul
text: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as [a matter of] bounty, and not as [of] covetousness.

label: Paul
text: But this [I say], He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully.

label: Paul
text: Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, [so let him give]; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.

label: Paul
text: And God [is] able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all [things], may abound to every good work:

label: Paul
text: (As it is written, He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth for ever.

label: Paul
text: Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for [your] food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)

label: Paul
text: Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.

label: Paul
text: For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;

label: Paul
text: Whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for [your] liberal distribution unto them, and unto all [men];

label: Paul
text: And by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.

label: Paul
text: Thanks [be] unto God for his unspeakable gift.

label: Paul
text: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence [am] base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:

label: Paul
text: But I beseech [you], that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.

label: Paul
text: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:

label: Paul
text: (For the weapons of our warfare [are] not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)

label: Paul
text: Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;

label: Paul
text: And having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.

label: Paul
text: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance?

label: Paul
text: If any man trust to himself that he is Christ’s, let him of himself think this again, that, as he [is] Christ’s, even so [are] we Christ’s.

label: Paul
text: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:

label: Paul
text: That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.

label: Paul
text: For [his] letters, say they, [are] weighty and powerful; but [his] bodily presence [is] weak, and [his] speech contemptible.

label: Paul
text: Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such [will we be] also in deed when we are present.

label: Paul
text: For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.

label: Paul
text: But we will not boast of things without [our] measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.

label: Paul
text: For we stretch not ourselves beyond [our measure], as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in [preaching] the gospel of Christ:

label: Paul
text: Not boasting of things without [our] measure, [that is], of other men’s labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

label: Paul
text: To preach the gospel in the [regions] beyond you, [and] not to boast in another man’s line of things made ready to our hand.

label: Paul
text: But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.

label: Paul
text: Would to God ye could bear with me a little in [my] folly: and indeed bear with me.

label: Paul
text: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present [you as] a chaste virgin to Christ.

label: Paul
text: But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

label: Paul
text: For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or [if] ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with [him].

label: Paul
text: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.

label: Paul
text: But though [I be] rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.

label: Paul
text: Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?

label: Paul
text: I robbed other churches, taking wages [of them], to do you service.

label: Paul
text: And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all [things] I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and [so] will I keep [myself].

label: Paul
text: As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore?

label: Paul
text: because I love you not?

label: Paul
text: God knoweth.

label: Paul
text: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.

label: Paul
text: For such [are] false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.

label: Paul
text: And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.

label: Paul
text: Therefore [it is] no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.

label: Paul
text: I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.

label: Paul
text: That which I speak, I speak [it] not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.

label: Paul
text: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.

label: Paul
text: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye [yourselves] are wise.

label: Paul
text: For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour [you], if a man take [of you], if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.

label: Paul
text: I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak.

label: Paul
text: Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.

label: Paul
text: Are they Hebrews?

label: Paul
text: so [am] I.

label: Paul
text: Are they Israelites?

label: Paul
text: so [am] I.

label: Paul
text: Are they the seed of Abraham?

label: Paul
text: so [am] I.

label: Paul
text: Are they ministers of Christ?

label: Paul
text: (I speak as a fool) I [am] more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.

label: Paul
text: Of the Jews five times received I forty [stripes] save one.

label: Paul
text: Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;

label: Paul
text: [In] journeyings often, [in] perils of waters, [in] perils of robbers, [in] perils by [mine own] countrymen, [in] perils by the heathen, [in] perils in the city, [in] perils in the wilderness, [in] perils in the sea, [in] perils among false brethren;

label: Paul
text: In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.

label: Paul
text: Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.

label: Paul
text: Who is weak, and I am not weak?

label: Paul
text: who is offended, and I burn not?

label: Paul
text: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.

label: Paul
text: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.

label: Paul
text: In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:

label: Paul
text: And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.

label: Paul
text: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory.

label: Paul
text: I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

label: Paul
text: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.

label: Paul
text: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)

label: Paul
text: How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

label: Paul
text: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.

label: Paul
text: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but [now] I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me [to be], or [that] he heareth of me.

label: Paul
text: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.

label: Paul
text: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

label: Paul
text: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness.

label: Paul
text: Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

label: Paul
text: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ’s sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

label: Paul
text: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.

label: Paul
text: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.

label: Paul
text: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except [it be] that I myself was not burdensome to you?

label: Paul
text: forgive me this wrong.

label: Paul
text: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.

label: Paul
text: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.

label: Paul
text: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.

label: Paul
text: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?

label: Paul
text: I desired Titus, and with [him] I sent a brother.

label: Paul
text: Did Titus make a gain of you?

label: Paul
text: walked we not in the same spirit?

label: Paul
text: [walked we] not in the same steps?

label: Paul
text: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you?

label: Paul
text: we speak before God in Christ: but [we do] all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.

label: Paul
text: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and [that] I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest [there be] debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

label: Paul
text: [And] lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and [that] I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.

label: Paul
text: This [is] the third [time] I am coming to you.

label: Paul
text: In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.

label: Paul
text: I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not spare:

label: Paul
text: Since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, which to you-ward is not weak, but is mighty in you.

label: Paul
text: For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God.

label: Paul
text: For we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him by the power of God toward you.

label: Paul
text: Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves.

label: Paul
text: Know ye not your own selves, how that Jesus Christ is in you, except ye be reprobates?

label: Paul
text: But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates.

label: Paul
text: Now I pray to God that ye do no evil; not that we should appear approved, but that ye should do that which is honest, though we be as reprobates.

label: Paul
text: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.

label: Paul
text: For we are glad, when we are weak, and ye are strong: and this also we wish, [even] your perfection.

label: Paul
text: Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the power which the Lord hath given me to edification, and not to destruction.

label: Paul
text: Finally, brethren, farewell.

label: Paul
text: Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.

label: Paul
text: Greet one another with an holy kiss.

label: Paul
text: All the saints salute you.

label: Paul
text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, [be] with you all.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)

label: Paul
text: And all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:

label: Paul
text: Grace [be] to you and peace from God the Father, and [from] our Lord Jesus Christ,

label: Paul
text: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:

label: Paul
text: To whom [be] glory for ever and ever.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:

label: Paul
text: Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

label: Paul
text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.

label: Paul
text: As we said before, so say I now again, If any [man] preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.

label: Paul
text: For do I now persuade men, or God?

label: Paul
text: or do I seek to please men?

label: Paul
text: for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

label: Paul
text: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.

label: Paul
text: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught [it], but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:

label: Paul
text: And profited in the Jews’ religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.

label: Paul
text: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb, and called [me] by his grace,

label: Paul
text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:

label: Paul
text: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.

label: Paul
text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.

label: Paul
text: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord’s brother.

label: Paul
text: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.

label: Paul
text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;

label: Paul
text: And was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:

label: Paul
text: But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.

label: Paul
text: And they glorified God in me.

label: Paul
text: Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with [me] also.

label: Paul
text: And I went up by revelation, and communicated unto them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to them which were of reputation, lest by any means I should run, or had run, in vain.

label: Paul
text: But neither Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised:

label: Paul
text: And that because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:

label: Paul
text: To whom we gave place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.

label: Paul
text: But of these who seemed to be somewhat, (whatsoever they were, it maketh no matter to me: God accepteth no man’s person:) for they who seemed [to be somewhat] in conference added nothing to me:

label: Paul
text: But contrariwise, when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me, as [the gospel] of the circumcision [was] unto Peter;

label: Paul
text: (For he that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision, the same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles:)

label: Paul
text: And when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that we [should go] unto the heathen, and they unto the circumcision.

label: Paul
text: Only [they would] that we should remember the poor; the same which I also was forward to do.

label: Paul
text: But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.

label: Paul
text: For before that certain came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.

label: Paul
text: And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him; insomuch that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation.

label: Paul
text: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, I said unto Peter before [them] all, If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of Gentiles, and not as do the Jews, why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?

label: Paul
text: We [who are] Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,

label: Peter
text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

label: Peter
text: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.

label: Peter
text: Blessed [be] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

label: Peter
text: To an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven for you,

label: Peter
text: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

label: Peter
text: Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:

label: Peter
text: That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:

label: Peter
text: Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see [him] not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

label: Peter
text: Receiving the end of your faith, [even] the salvation of [your] souls.

label: Peter
text: Of which salvation the prophets have inquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of the grace [that should come] unto you:

label: Peter
text: Searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow.

label: Peter
text: Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

label: Peter
text: Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;

label: Peter
text: As obedient children, not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:

label: Peter
text: But as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;

label: Peter
text: Because it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.

label: Peter
text: And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man’s work, pass the time of your sojourning [here] in fear:

label: Peter
text: Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, [as] silver and gold, from your vain conversation [received] by tradition from your fathers;

label: Peter
text: But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:

label: Peter
text: Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you,

label: Peter
text: Who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.

label: Peter
text: Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren, [see that ye] love one another with a pure heart fervently:

label: Peter
text: Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.

label: Peter
text: For all flesh [is] as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass.

label: Peter
text: The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:

label: Peter
text: But the word of the Lord endureth for ever.

label: Peter
text: And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you.

label: Peter
text: Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speakings,

label: Peter
text: As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

label: Peter
text: If so be ye have tasted that the Lord [is] gracious.

label: Peter
text: To whom coming, [as unto] a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, [and] precious,

label: Peter
text: Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

label: Peter
text: Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.

label: Peter
text: Unto you therefore which believe [he is] precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,

label: Peter
text: And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, [even to them] which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

label: Peter
text: But ye [are] a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

label: Peter
text: Which in time past [were] not a people, but [are] now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

label: Peter
text: Dearly beloved, I beseech [you] as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;

label: Peter
text: Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by [your] good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.

label: Peter
text: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord’s sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;

label: Peter
text: Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.

label: Peter
text: For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

label: Peter
text: As free, and not using [your] liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.

label: Peter
text: Honour all [men].

label: Peter
text: Love the brotherhood.

label: Peter
text: Fear God.

label: Peter
text: Honour the king.

label: Peter
text: Servants, [be] subject to [your] masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.

label: Peter
text: For this [is] thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

label: Peter
text: For what glory [is it], if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently?

label: Peter
text: but if, when ye do well, and suffer [for it], ye take it patiently, this [is] acceptable with God.

label: Peter
text: For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:

label: Peter
text: Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:

label: Peter
text: Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committed [himself] to him that judgeth righteously:

label: Peter
text: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

label: Peter
text: For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

label: Peter
text: Likewise, ye wives, [be] in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

label: Peter
text: While they behold your chaste conversation [coupled] with fear.

label: Peter
text: Whose adorning let it not be that outward [adorning] of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;

label: Peter
text: But [let it be] the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, [even the ornament] of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.

label: Peter
text: For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:

label: Peter
text: Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.

label: Peter
text: Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with [them] according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.

label: Peter
text: Finally, [be ye] all of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren, [be] pitiful, [be] courteous:

label: Peter
text: Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.

label: Peter
text: For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:

label: Peter
text: Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.

label: Peter
text: For the eyes of the Lord [are] over the righteous, and his ears [are open] unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord [is] against them that do evil.

label: Peter
text: And who [is] he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?

label: Peter
text: But and if ye suffer for righteousness’ sake, happy [are ye]: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;

label: Peter
text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and [be] ready always to [give] an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

label: Peter
text: Having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

label: Peter
text: For [it is] better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.

label: Peter
text: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:

label: Peter
text: By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;

label: Peter
text: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

label: Peter
text: The like figure whereunto [even] baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:

label: Peter
text: Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.

label: Peter
text: Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin;

label: Peter
text: That he no longer should live the rest of [his] time in the flesh to the lusts of men, but to the will of God.

label: Peter
text: For the time past of [our] life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries:

label: Peter
text: Wherein they think it strange that ye run not with [them] to the same excess of riot, speaking evil of [you]:

label: Peter
text: Who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead.

label: Peter
text: For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.

label: Peter
text: But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.

label: Peter
text: And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.

label: Peter
text: Use hospitality one to another without grudging.

label: Peter
text: As every man hath received the gift, [even so] minister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

label: Peter
text: If any man speak, [let him speak] as the oracles of God; if any man minister, [let him do it] as of the ability which God giveth: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever.

label: Peter
text: Amen.

label: Peter
text: Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you, as though some strange thing happened unto you:

label: Peter
text: But rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ’s sufferings; that, when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy.

label: James
text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.

label: James
text: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

label: James
text: Knowing [this], that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

label: James
text: But let patience have [her] perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

label: James
text: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all [men] liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

label: James
text: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering.

label: James
text: For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.

label: James
text: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.

label: James
text: A double minded man [is] unstable in all his ways.

label: James
text: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:

label: James
text: But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.

label: James
text: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.

label: James
text: Blessed [is] the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

label: James
text: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:

label: James
text: But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.

label: James
text: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.

label: James
text: Do not err, my beloved brethren.

label: James
text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.

label: James
text: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

label: James
text: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:

label: James
text: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

label: James
text: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.

label: James
text: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

label: James
text: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:

label: James
text: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.

label: James
text: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth [therein], he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.

label: James
text: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion [is] vain.

label: James
text: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, [and] to keep himself unspotted from the world.

label: James
text: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, [the Lord] of glory, with respect of persons.

label: James
text: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;

label: James
text: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:

label: James
text: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?

label: James
text: Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?

label: James
text: But ye have despised the poor.

label: James
text: Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?

label: James
text: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?

label: James
text: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:

label: James
text: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.

label: James
text: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one [point], he is guilty of all.

label: James
text: For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill.

label: James
text: Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.

label: James
text: So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.

label: James
text: For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.

label: James
text: What [doth it] profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works?

label: James
text: can faith save him?

label: James
text: If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,

label: James
text: And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be [ye] warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what [doth it] profit?

label: James
text: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.

label: James
text: Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.

label: James
text: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.

label: James
text: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?

label: James
text: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?

label: James
text: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?

label: James
text: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.

label: James
text: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.

label: James
text: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent [them] out another way?

label: James
text: For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.

label: James
text: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.

label: James
text: For in many things we offend all.

label: James
text: If any man offend not in word, the same [is] a perfect man, [and] able also to bridle the whole body.

label: James
text: Behold, we put bits in the horses’ mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.

label: James
text: Behold also the ships, which though [they be] so great, and [are] driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.

label: James
text: Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things.

label: James
text: Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!

label: James
text: And the tongue [is] a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

label: James
text: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:

label: James
text: But the tongue can no man tame; [it is] an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.

label: James
text: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.

label: James
text: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing.

label: James
text: My brethren, these things ought not so to be.

label: James
text: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet [water] and bitter?

label: James
text: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries?

label: James
text: either a vine, figs?

label: James
text: so [can] no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

label: James
text: Who [is] a wise man and endued with knowledge among you?

label: James
text: let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

label: James
text: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.

label: James
text: This wisdom descendeth not from above, but [is] earthly, sensual, devilish.

label: James
text: For where envying and strife [is], there [is] confusion and every evil work.

label: James
text: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, [and] easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

label: James
text: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.

label: James
text: From whence [come] wars and fightings among you?

label: James
text: [come they] not hence, [even] of your lusts that war in your members?

label: James
text: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

label: James
text: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume [it] upon your lusts.

label: James
text: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God?

label: James
text: whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

label: James
text: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?

label: James
text: But he giveth more grace.

label: James
text: Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

label: James
text: Submit yourselves therefore to God.

label: James
text: Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

label: James
text: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you.

label: James
text: Cleanse [your] hands, [ye] sinners; and purify [your] hearts, [ye] double minded.

label: James
text: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and [your] joy to heaviness.

label: James
text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

label: James
text: Speak not evil one of another, brethren.

label: James
text: He that speaketh evil of [his] brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

label: James
text: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?

label: James
text: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:

label: James
text: Whereas ye know not what [shall be] on the morrow.

label: James
text: For what [is] your life?

label: James
text: It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

label: James
text: For that ye [ought] to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.

label: James
text: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.

label: James
text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth [it] not, to him it is sin.

label: James
text: Go to now, [ye] rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon [you].

label: Jude
text: Jude, the servant of Jesus Christ, and brother of James, to them that are sanctified by God the Father, and preserved in Jesus Christ, [and] called:

label: Jude
text: Mercy unto you, and peace, and love, be multiplied.

label: Jude
text: Beloved, when I gave all diligence to write unto you of the common salvation, it was needful for me to write unto you, and exhort [you] that ye should earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints.

label: Jude
text: For there are certain men crept in unawares, who were before of old ordained to this condemnation, ungodly men, turning the grace of our God into lasciviousness, and denying the only Lord God, and our Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Jude
text: I will therefore put you in remembrance, though ye once knew this, how that the Lord, having saved the people out of the land of Egypt, afterward destroyed them that believed not.

label: Jude
text: And the angels which kept not their first estate, but left their own habitation, he hath reserved in everlasting chains under darkness unto the judgment of the great day.

label: Jude
text: Even as Sodom and Gomorrha, and the cities about them in like manner, giving themselves over to fornication, and going after strange flesh, are set forth for an example, suffering the vengeance of eternal fire.

label: Jude
text: Likewise also these [filthy] dreamers defile the flesh, despise dominion, and speak evil of dignities.

label: Jude
text: Yet Michael the archangel, when contending with the devil he disputed about the body of Moses, durst not bring against him a railing accusation, but said, The Lord rebuke thee.

label: Jude
text: But these speak evil of those things which they know not: but what they know naturally, as brute beasts, in those things they corrupt themselves.

label: Jude
text: Woe unto them!

label: Jude
text: for they have gone in the way of Cain, and ran greedily after the error of Balaam for reward, and perished in the gainsaying of Core.

label: Jude
text: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds [they are] without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

label: Jude
text: Raging waves of the sea, foaming out their own shame; wandering stars, to whom is reserved the blackness of darkness for ever.

label: Jude
text: And Enoch also, the seventh from Adam, prophesied of these, saying, Behold, the Lord cometh with ten thousands of his saints,

label: Jude
text: To execute judgment upon all, and to convince all that are ungodly among them of all their ungodly deeds which they have ungodly committed, and of all their hard [speeches] which ungodly sinners have spoken against him.

label: Jude
text: These are murmurers, complainers, walking after their own lusts; and their mouth speaketh great swelling [words], having men’s persons in admiration because of advantage.

label: Jude
text: But, beloved, remember ye the words which were spoken before of the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ;

label: Jude
text: How that they told you there should be mockers in the last time, who should walk after their own ungodly lusts.

label: Jude
text: These be they who separate themselves, sensual, having not the Spirit.

label: Jude
text: But ye, beloved, building up yourselves on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Ghost,
